para_P.title: Is the value of USD expected to be at least 145 JPY (yen) by the end of trading on August 9th, 2024?

[image]

The market will determine the outcome based on the USD/JPY closing rate available on Yahoo! Finance for August 9th, 2024.

question.title: Given USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On August 9th, 2024, the USD/JPY exchange rate closes at or above 145 JPY as listed on Yahoo! Finance. 

Then, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle?

For the condition to hold, the USD/JPY exchange rate must be at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024.

For the outcome to resolve as YES, Joe Biden must make an unambiguous and conclusive announcement before the specified date and time, indicating he will not accept the nomination. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, the outcome resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the USD exchange rate is at least 145 JPY at the end of trading on August 9, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Imagine this scenario: On August 9, 2024, the closing USD/JPY exchange rate is 145 JPY or higher, as reported by Yahoo! Finance. 

In that case, will Joe Biden or his representatives issue a clear, public, and formal statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election? 

For this condition to be satisfied, the USD/JPY exchange rate must be no less than 145 JPY at the close of business on August 9, 2024.

To achieve a YES outcome, Joe Biden needs to make an unequivocal and definitive announcement before the given date and time, indicating his refusal to accept the nomination. If such an announcement is not made by the cut-off time, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Given both USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9, 2024 and Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

Then, will the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 75,000 and at most 76,000 as per Yahoo Finance?

(a) USD/JPY value will be determined by the close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.
(c) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the following three events take place: (a) will the USD reach a value of at least 145 JPY at the market close on August 9th, 2024, (b) will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) will the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be more than 75,000 but not exceeding 76,000?
para_P.body:
(a) The USD/JPY exchange rate will be assessed based on the closing information provided for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden or his campaign needs to issue a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming election cycle. This statement must be clear-cut and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would consider accepting the nomination.
(c) The outcome of this question will be determined by the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will a president be chosen in South Africa prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the South African National Assembly formally selects a president before the date of July 1, 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Conditional on South Africa electing a president before July 1, 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024. This question will resolve as **Yes** if the South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

Then, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15? Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If South Africa has a president elected prior to July 1, 2024, will the associated market have a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: South Africa successfully elects a president before July 1, 2024. This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the South African National Assembly officially selects a president before July 1, 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

In that case, will the associated market have at least 377 traders by the end of July 15? It resolves to YES if the market mentioned above reaches 377 traders before it closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It resolves to NO in all other situations.

question.title: Conditional on South Africa electing a president before July 1, 2024, and the market getting at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as follows:

**Condition**: The condition is met if both of the following occur:
1. The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to credible sources.
2. The linked market has at least 377 traders before it closes on July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time.

**Outcome**: If the condition is met, the outcome resolves to YES if the July 2024 Manifold poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

The Manifold poll asks respondents if weak AGI has been achieved, without providing a definition, allowing them to vote based on their own understanding. The poll opens on the 23rd of each month and closes on the 30th.

para_P.title: If South Africa selects a president prior to July 1, 2024, and the market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by July 15, 2024, will a minimum of 30% of Manifold participants concur that weak AGI was realized before July 23, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question resolves as follows:

**Condition**: The condition is satisfied if both of the following take place:
1. The South African National Assembly officially selects a president before July 1, 2024, based on credible sources.
2. The associated market has no fewer than 377 traders before it concludes on July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time.

**Outcome**: If the condition is satisfied, the outcome will be YES if the July 2024 Manifold poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) that is greater than or equal to 0.3, disregarding "no opinion" respondents. If not, it will resolve to NO.

The Manifold poll inquires whether respondents believe weak AGI has been achieved, without offering a definition, thus allowing them to vote based on their own interpretation. The poll opens on the 23rd of each month and closes on the 30th.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024, and the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, (2) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **South African Presidential Election and Market Traders**:
   - The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.
   - The market linked [here](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time).

2. **Manifold Poll on Weak AGI**:
   - The July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. This indicates that at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) South Africa will choose a president prior to July 1, 2024, and the related market will have no fewer than 377 traders by July 15, 2024, (2) At least 30% of respondents on Manifold believe that weak AGI was accomplished before July 23, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

1. **Presidential Election in South Africa and Market Participation**:
   - The South African National Assembly formally selects a president before July 1, 2024, as reported by trustworthy sources.
   - The associated market [here](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) must have a minimum of 377 traders before it closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time).

2. **Manifold Survey on Weak AGI**:
   - The results of the July 2024 survey show a YES/(NO + YES) ratio of at least 0.3, excluding respondents with "no opinion." This means that at least 30% of Manifold participants agree that weak AGI was achieved prior to July 23, 2024.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU on June 30, 2024, and with a **NO** otherwise.

For the purpose of this question, "accessible" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without employing a VPN (though they may need to pay for it). If it is not accessible in specific EU countries (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive resolution if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT being generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that before June 1, 2024, one of the following events occurs: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines? If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the default situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN, potentially requiring payment, and at least more than 50% of the population has access. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and remains valid even if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service is fundamentally the same.

Then, is it accurate that before June 1, 2024, one of the following scenarios occurs: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines? If there are no reports of such events before that date, then this will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on both ChatGPT being available in the EU and diplomatic actions between the Philippines and China, will OpenAI publish an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, with at least >50% of the population able to use it. (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, where one of the following occurs: The Philippines expels or recalls a diplomat with the PRC, or the PRC expels or recalls a diplomat with the Philippines.

Given both (a) and (b) occur, will OpenAI publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models? If so, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, NO.

para_P.title: Assuming both that ChatGPT is accessible in the EU and that there are diplomatic developments between the Philippines and China, is it expected that OpenAI will release an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following assumptions: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024, meaning that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without needing a VPN, with over 50% of the population having access. (b) Before June 1, 2024, there are diplomatic actions involving expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China, which could involve either the Philippines expelling or recalling a diplomat from the PRC or the PRC expelling or recalling a diplomat from the Philippines.

If both (a) and (b) are true, will OpenAI issue a public report by June 30, 2024, detailing findings from an external review of the safety of one of its AI models? If the answer is affirmative, then the response is YES; if not, then it is NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, and (3) OpenAI publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) The question about diplomatic expulsions or recalls resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(3) The question about OpenAI publishing a report resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

This combined question resolves as **YES** only if all three conditions (1), (2), and (3) resolve as **YES**. Otherwise, it resolves as **NO**.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024, (2) There are diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024, and (3) OpenAI releases a report detailing the findings from external safety evaluations of their models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The inquiry regarding OpenAI's ChatGPT is resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. Here, "widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without the use of a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to (for instance) minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It still resolves positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) The inquiry about diplomatic expulsions or recalls is resolved as **Yes** if, before June 1, 2024, any of these four events occur, based on official declarations or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, this will resolve as **No**.

(3) The inquiry regarding OpenAI publishing a report resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *publicly available* report containing the findings from an *external* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

This composite question resolves as **YES** only if all three conditions (1), (2), and (3) resolve as **YES**. Otherwise, it resolves as **NO**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be resigning, thereby not completing his current presidential term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time; however, he is not required to have formally resigned and vacated his office by that date. A statement of his plans to do so is adequate for this market to resolve positively.

If no such announcements occur, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning, will Kamala Harris be president by Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. He does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July; an announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient.

Given this, will Vice President Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The primary resolution source for this outcome will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare his withdrawal and resignation, will Kamala Harris assume the presidency by Friday?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden states that he is ceasing his re-election campaign and that he will resign from his current position before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. He is not required to have officially left office before the end of July; a declaration of his intention to resign is adequate.

In light of this, will Vice President Kamala Harris be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The main source for determining this outcome will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

question.title: Given both Joe Biden drops out of re-election and resigns, and Kamala Harris becomes President, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out of the re-election and resigning before the end of July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024. This question resolves to YES if both of these conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden announces that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement suffices; he does not need to have formally resigned by then. (b) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting will be used as the resolution source. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

Then, is it true that diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden withdraws from the re-election and steps down, and Kamala Harris assumes the presidency, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Both of these events occur: (a) Joe Biden declares his withdrawal from the re-election and resignation before the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024. This inquiry will be answered with YES if both conditions are fulfilled: (a) Joe Biden announces that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement is sufficient; he does not need to have officially resigned by that time. (b) Kamala Harris is officially appointed as President or Acting President of the United States at any moment before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official information from the US government or a consensus of reliable reporting will serve as the resolution source. If both conditions are not satisfied, the question will be answered with NO.

Thus, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? This question will be answered as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, any of these four events take place, according to official announcements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out of the re-election and resigning before the end of July 2024, (2) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and (3) diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if all of the following conditions are met: 

1. Joe Biden announces that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement suffices; he does not need to have formally resigned by then.

2. Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting will be used as the resolution source.

3. Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following three events will take place: (1) Joe Biden declares he is withdrawing from the race for re-election and resigning prior to the end of July 2024, (2) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and (3) there are diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if all of the subsequent conditions are satisfied: 

1. Joe Biden makes an announcement indicating that he is stepping down from the re-election campaign and will resign from the presidency before the conclusion of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement alone is sufficient; he does not need to have officially resigned by that time.

2. Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official declarations from the US government or a consensus of reliable reporting will serve as the basis for resolution.

3. Before August 1, 2024, one of the following four occurrences takes place, as per official announcements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats who is in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If any of these criteria are not fulfilled, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is chosen as Vice President, the market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the Vice President after the original nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can settle right after the nomination.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris being the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Details for the condition: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves negatively if Trump is not removed or blocked from any ballot by July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic Vice Presidential nominee, will Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President, will Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from being listed on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (such as President, Senate, or House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Condition details: If Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic VP, this market will conclude with a yes. If a different individual is chosen for VP, the outcome will be no. Any change in the VP selection after the initial nomination will not affect the market's resolution. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

Criteria for resolution: This inquiry will be resolved as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be validated by official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable news reports. Speculative analyses, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution. The question will resolve negatively if Trump remains on all ballots by July 15, 2024.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP nominee and Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President candidate, and (2) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:

- For the condition: Kamala Harris must be officially nominated as the Democratic VP candidate. Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, confirmed through official state announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports.

- For the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to nominate its 2024 presidential candidate. Resolves **No** if only one ballot is required.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate and Donald Trump is disqualified from the primary ballot due to the 14th Amendment, will the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (1) Kamala Harris is selected as the candidate for Vice President of the Democratic Party, and (2) Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. Will the Democratic Party need to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its nominee for the 2024 presidential election? 

Criteria for resolution:

- For the condition: Kamala Harris must be formally chosen as the Democratic VP candidate. Donald Trump must be officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, verified through official state announcements, judicial rulings, or reliable media sources.

- For the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to nominate its presidential candidate for 2024. Resolves **No** if only a single ballot is necessary.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee, (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris: This condition will be satisfied if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this condition will not be satisfied. The nomination decision is final at the time of the initial nomination.

(2) Donald Trump: This condition will be satisfied if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice. The condition will not be satisfied if these criteria are not met as of July 15, 2024. Legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date are not considered; the focus is strictly on the status as of July 15, 2024.

(3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This condition resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of these events will take place: (1) Kamala Harris becomes the Democratic Vice Presidential nominee, (2) Donald Trump is either removed or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (3) the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Kamala Harris: This criterion will be met if Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President. If another individual is appointed as VP, then this criterion will not be fulfilled. The decision regarding the nomination is conclusive at the time of the initial selection.

(2) Donald Trump: This criterion will be met if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements are not adequate. This criterion will not be satisfied if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes after this date are not taken into account; the emphasis is solely on the situation as of July 15, 2024.

(3) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This criterion will resolve as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 U.S. presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this criterion will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Armenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Armenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Armenia set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Armenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Armenia fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given Armenia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Belgium also qualify?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Armenia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It resolves as **Yes** if Belgium also participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Armenia has qualified. If Belgium does not qualify under these conditions, the question resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for P: Armenia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for P to be true.
Resolution criteria for Q: Given P is true, Belgium must also participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for Q to resolve as **Yes**. If Belgium does not qualify, Q resolves as **No**. If P is not true, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Armenia makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Belgium also make it?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Armenia secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. It concludes with a **Yes** if Belgium also competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, contingent upon Armenia's qualification. Should Belgium fail to meet these conditions, the outcome will be **No**.

Criteria for determining P: Armenia must compete in a Semi-final and be officially acknowledged by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for P to hold true.
Criteria for determining Q: Assuming P is true, Belgium must also compete in a Semi-final and be officially recognized by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for Q to result in **Yes**. If Belgium does not qualify, Q will result in **No**. If P is not true, the outcome will be N/A.

question.title: Given both Armenia and Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Armenia and Belgium participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland also qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? 

Resolution criteria:

- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the outcome resolves as **No**.
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Armenia and Belgium secure their spots in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Ireland also make it through?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Armenia and Belgium compete in their respective Semi-finals and are officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland also advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? 

Criteria for resolution:

- The result is **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not advance, the result is **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following countries qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024: Armenia, Belgium, and Ireland?

If any of these countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Armenia, Belgium, and Ireland all make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Armenia competes in its designated Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (2) Belgium participates in its designated Semi-final and is officially recognized by the EBU as qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (3) Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the EBU as qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these nations fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the French Prime Minister be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the political party of the French Prime Minister is different from New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable information.

question.title: Given the Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024. This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

Then, is the following true: Joe Biden is still president by the end of July? This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: If the Prime Minister of France is affiliated with a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024, will Joe Biden remain in office until the end of July?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: The Prime Minister of France is part of a coalition that is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024. This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if the Prime Minister's party is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

Thus, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden is still in office by the end of July? This market will affirmatively resolve if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

question.title: Given both the Prime Minister of France is not from New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, and Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 
1. The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.
2. Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition resolves as true if both conditions (1) and (2) are met.
- The outcome resolves as Yes if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the outcome resolves as No. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: If the Prime Minister of France is not affiliated with New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, and Joe Biden remains in office by the end of July 2024, will Rishi Sunak not succeed in being elected during the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements hold true: 
1. The Prime Minister of France's party is neither New Popular Front nor Together as of July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.
2. Joe Biden continues to be the President of the United States as of 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will Rishi Sunak not be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024? 

Criteria for resolution: 
- The condition is considered true if both statements (1) and (2) are satisfied.
- The result is Yes if Rishi Sunak does not succeed in becoming a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election for any reason. If he is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in that election, the result will be No. Resolution must reference credible media sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024 (c) Rishi Sunak will fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (2) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (3) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election, according to credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together, Joe Biden still be in office by the end of July 2024, and Rishi Sunak not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if all the following criteria are satisfied: (1) The French Prime Minister's party is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources. (2) Joe Biden remains the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (3) Rishi Sunak does not secure a position as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, according to trustworthy media reports or an official statement from the returning officer of his constituency.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, with a positive value indicating a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that at least 30% of respondents in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024? The poll asks respondents whether weak AGI has been achieved, without defining the term, and resolves to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses.

para_P.title: With Trump's advantage over Biden ranging from 3 to 4 points on July 15, 2024, will a minimum of 30% of Manifold survey participants concur that weak AGI was attained prior to July 23, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds: On July 15, 2024, the margin by which Donald Trump leads Joe Biden is more than 3 points but no more than 4 points, based on 538's national polling average. This figure is derived from the data displayed on the chart for that date, reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value signifies a lead for Trump.

Thus, is it accurate that at least 30% of participants in the July 2024 Manifold survey agree that weak AGI was reached before July 23, 2024? The survey inquires whether respondents believe weak AGI has been realized, without providing a definition for the term, and will be considered YES if the proportion of YES/(NO + YES) is at least 0.3, disregarding responses of "no opinion."

question.title: Conditional on both Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points and at least 30% agreeing weak AGI is achieved, will Biden announce dropping out and resigning before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. (2) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. 

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce both that he is dropping out of the 2024 presidential race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- For condition (1), Trump's lead must be assessed based on 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024.
- For condition (2), the Manifold poll must show at least 30% of respondents saying YES to weak AGI being achieved, based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio.
- For the outcome, Biden must announce his intention to drop out and resign before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The formal resignation does not need to occur by this date, just the announcement.

para_P.title: Given the situation where Trump's advantage over Biden is between 3 and 4 points and at least 30% believe weak AGI has been attained, will Biden declare his withdrawal and step down before August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: (1) On July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden is more than 3 points but not exceeding 4 points, according to 538's national polling average. (2) A minimum of 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll agree that weak AGI has been reached prior to July 23, 2024. 

Under these circumstances, will Joe Biden make an announcement regarding his exit from the 2024 presidential campaign and his resignation from the presidency before the end of July 2024? 

Criteria for resolution: 
- For condition (1), Trump's lead must be evaluated based on 538's national polling average as of July 15, 2024.
- For condition (2), the Manifold poll must indicate that at least 30% of participants responded YES to the question of weak AGI being achieved, based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio.
- Regarding the outcome, Biden must declare his intent to withdraw and resign before the conclusion of July 2024, Pacific Time. The actual resignation does not need to take place by this date, only the announcement.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be assessed based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on their chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The question resolves positively if Trump's lead is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points. (2) The Manifold poll, conducted monthly, asks if weak AGI has been achieved, allowing respondents to use their own definitions. The July 2024 poll must have at least 30% of respondents saying YES for this part to resolve positively. The poll results are based on YES/(NO + YES) ratio, ignoring "no opinion" responses. (3) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will all of the following take place: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) a minimum of 30% of Manifold survey participants concur that weak AGI was achieved prior to July 23, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden declare that he is both withdrawing from the race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden will be determined using 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as displayed on their chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a lead for Trump. The question is affirmed if Trump's advantage is more than 3 and at most 4 points. (2) The Manifold survey, conducted monthly, inquires whether weak AGI has been realized, allowing respondents to define the term themselves. The July 2024 survey must have at least 30% of respondents answering YES for this condition to be met. The results are calculated based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio, disregarding "no opinion" responses. (3) This resolves YES if Joe Biden states that he is both ceasing his campaign for re-election and resigning from his presidential position. These statements must be made before the conclusion of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated the office by the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is enough to affirm this market. If not, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden publicly declare his refusal of the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This question resolves positively if France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) based on the medal table, which is ordered by the number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze Medals won by each country. If the Olympics do not take place in 2024, the question resolves ambiguously.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will France finish among the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Prior to July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the nomination.

In that case, will France secure a position in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if France ranks in the top 5 (ties are considered affirmative) according to the medal standings, which are categorized by the number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze Medals earned by each nation. If the Olympics do not occur in 2024, the question will be deemed ambiguous.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination and France places in Top 5 at the 2024 Olympics, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee?
question.body:

(a) Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. question.title: Given Biden remains President through end of July 2024, will OpenAI commit to no retaliation for public risk disclosure before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not affect this condition.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle? This resolves as YES if both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: If Biden stays in office until the end of July 2024, will OpenAI pledge not to retaliate for disclosing public risks prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Biden continues as the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This indicates he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President before that date. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not alter this stipulation.

Then, is it accurate that prior to July 1, 2024, OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" policy? This will be considered YES if both of the following conditions are satisfied:

- OpenAI publicly declares its commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" policy through a statement from the organization or a spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The declaration can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote from an interview). The statement from OpenAI must reflect an enhanced commitment to the principle in question, compared to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already promote a culture of open criticism." 
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact specific signatories or endorsers to evaluate their level of approval regarding OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this inquiry to conclude as YES.

question.title: Conditional on Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China in the context of Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Condition: Vivek Ramaswamy must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following events occur, according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before that date, the question resolves as **No**. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee and diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

2. Before August 1, 2024, diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China, as defined by the following events: 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given these conditions are true, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

For the purposes of this question, a "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g., if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this question resolves to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

para_P.title: Assuming that Vivek Ramaswamy is the chosen Republican candidate and there are rising diplomatic conflicts between the Philippines and China, will Iran launch a military operation prior to August 13th, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following as accurate: 

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

2. Before August 1, 2024, diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China, characterized by these events: 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

If these circumstances hold true, will Iran commence a military operation on Israeli territory, in its airspace, or in its maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

In this context, a "military operation" refers to any forceful action carried out by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot on Israeli land, the answer to this question would be "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by credible reports. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers are excluded. Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil, will be considered. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups will not be included.
