   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

3. Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this condition, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this condition is met) that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this condition. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this condition. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this condition.

If all three conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following three events will happen: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (2) There are diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024, and (3) Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones from July 30 to August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Prior to August 1, 2024, one of the following four scenarios occurs, as per official declarations or [reliable reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one diplomat stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats in the Philippines. 

3. Iran launches a military operation on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this condition, a "military operation" is defined as any use of force carried out by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime territory (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, this condition is satisfied) that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or confirmed by a consensus of credible reporting. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not contribute to the fulfillment of this condition. Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian territory, will be considered for this condition. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be counted for this condition.

If all three criteria are fulfilled, this inquiry will resolve with a **Yes**. If any of these criteria are not fulfilled, this inquiry will resolve with a **No**.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the final value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 75,000 but remain at or below 77,000?
para_P.body: This inquiry determines the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Given the BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will die before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition (P): The closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000.
- For the outcome (Q): Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 25th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX finishes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 21, 2024, the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX exceeds 75,000 and is at most 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

Then, can we conclude that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday, July 26, 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition (P): The closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be above 75,000 and at most 77,000.
- For the outcome (Q): Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 25, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Given that both the BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Joe Biden dies before July 26, will he announce dropping out and resigning before the end of July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k, according to Yahoo Finance, and (b) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before the end of July 2024, in Pacific Time, that he is both dropping out of the re-election race and resigning from the presidency, even if the formal resignation occurs later? An announcement of intention is sufficient for a YES resolution. If these conditions are not met, the question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX finishes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Joe Biden passes away prior to July 26, will he declare his withdrawal and resignation before July ends?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) The closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is above 75k but does not exceed 77k, as reported by Yahoo Finance, and (b) there is a public confirmation of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th.

Under these circumstances, will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 2024 concludes, in Pacific Time, stating that he is both withdrawing from the re-election campaign and resigning from the presidency, even if the official resignation happens at a later date? A declaration of intention suffices for a YES outcome. If these criteria are not fulfilled, the question will be labeled as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Joe Biden die before Saturday? (c) Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body: (a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance. (b) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO. (c) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will the following events take place: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the final value of the BSE SENSEX exceed 75,000 but not go beyond 77,000? (b) Will Joe Biden pass away before Saturday? (c) Will Joe Biden declare that he is both withdrawing from the presidential race and resigning from his position before July concludes?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry is determined by the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance. (b) Resolves to YES if an official statement regarding Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If not, it resolves to NO. (c) Resolves to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and will resign, without needing to have officially stepped down from office before the end of July. A declaration of his intent to do so is adequate for this market to resolve. Otherwise, this market resolves to NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public statement against the proposal to swiftly nominate Biden?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend's attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are significantly concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given both (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing Biden's early nomination and (2) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

The resolution criterion is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the final nominee on the election day.

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Given this, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? If more than one round is needed, this resolves as Yes, indicating a brokered convention. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as No.

para_P.title: If Larry Elder is the Republican candidate, will there be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. This choice is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not determined on the election day itself.

In light of this, will the Democratic Party need to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? If multiple rounds are necessary, the answer is Yes, indicating a brokered convention. If only a single ballot is sufficient, then the answer is No.

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee and Democrats have a brokered convention, will the US end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD by August 3, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will the US Department of Commerce officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024? If the agreement is ended before that date, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate and the Democrats hold a contested convention, will the United States discontinue its contract with Verisign for the .com domain by August 3, 2024?

Then, will the US Department of Commerce formally end or phase out its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024? If the agreement is terminated before that date, the answer is **Yes**; if not, the answer is **No**. If the condition is not satisfied, the response is N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder is the Republican nominee and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, and (b) the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. (2) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If both conditions are satisfied, this question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and the Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. (2) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's administration of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If both criteria are met, this question will be answered with **Yes**; if not, it will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Conditional on both Kamala's odds increasing and the French PM not being from specified parties, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, specifically if her Electoral College probability is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, as verified by credible sources.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will be nominated as the Democratic Vice President? If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this question resolves to YES. If someone else is selected as VP, it resolves to NO. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.

para_P.title: Given the increase in Kamala's chances and the French PM not being affiliated with certain parties, will Kamala Harris serve as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: (a) According to Nate Silver's model, Kamala Harris's chances of winning are projected to rise over the next week, particularly if her Electoral College likelihood exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. (b) The Prime Minister of France is from a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024, as confirmed by reliable sources.

Then, can we conclude that Kamala Harris will be chosen as the Democratic Vice President? If Kamala Harris is indeed selected as the Democratic VP, this inquiry will conclude with a YES. If a different candidate is appointed as VP, it will conclude with a NO. Subsequent changes to the VP following the initial selection will not impact the outcome.

(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(c) If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) Nate Silver's model indicates an increase in Kamala's chances of winning over the next week (b) On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France is part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together (c) Kamala Harris receives the Democratic nomination for VP?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be confirmed with a YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be confirmed with a NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Prime Minister of France's party is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

(c) This market will affirm a YES if Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic VP. If another person is appointed as VP, the market will confirm a NO. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit the race. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several versions of letters being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one draft urging Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the matter.

This market will be resolved as YES if a group of at least five identified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter similar to what has been reported, or it might occur through a group discussion with Biden where they collectively request that he step down.

For a YES resolution, it is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to the media that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not suffice.

Any reports regarding an unspecified number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to withdraw will not fulfill the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market closes. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, the market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to pressure Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th.

Then, will Joe Biden still be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

para_P.title: If a collective of no fewer than five identifiable Democratic House Representatives or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th, will Joe Biden remain in the presidency by the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. Various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would request Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators jointly ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be through signing a letter similar to what has been reported, or it could take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

It is necessary that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. If five individuals individually inform journalists that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are subsequently disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Assuming the following is accurate: A coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to pressure Joe Biden to withdraw from the 2024 re-election campaign prior to July 20th.

Then, will Joe Biden still hold the office of President of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

question.title: Given both Democratic pressure on Biden to drop out and Biden's presidency by July end, will Trump gain 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, and (b) Joe Biden is still president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% more support among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference must be >= 0.03. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Considering the Democratic urging for Biden to withdraw and his presidency lasting until the end of July, will Trump see a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) A coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to reflect on stepping back from his 2024 re-election bid prior to July 20th, and (b) Joe Biden remains in the role of President of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump experience a minimum of 3% additional backing from Manifold participants when competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democratic candidate? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: This will be categorized as YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the initial Manifold survey surpasses that in the subsequent survey by 3% or more when both surveys conclude on July 6. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference must be >= 0.03. If not, it will be categorized as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July, and (c) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this condition is not satisfied.

(b) Joe Biden must still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024.

(c) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: Is it possible for all of the following to take place: (a) A collective of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators pressuring Biden to withdraw before July 20th, (b) Joe Biden remaining in the presidency by the end of July, and (c) Trump achieving a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold respondents when competing against Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) A coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly suggest he do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be done through a signed letter or another method such as a group meeting with Biden to collectively request his withdrawal. All five individuals must be included in the same group communication. Any reports of an unspecified number of Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to stand down will not fulfill this requirement unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before this date. If these conditions are not met by July 20th, this requirement is not fulfilled.

(b) Joe Biden must still hold the official position of President of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

(c) Two Manifold polls will be conducted, both closing on July 6. One poll will ask Manifold respondents to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other will inquire about their choice between a generic Democrat and Biden.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically polled performs better or falls within the margin of error. Do Manifold respondents reflect the general populace?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the result of the formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve to N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being introduced in the future.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is not based on who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election, but solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention.

2. The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for this resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

If the first condition is not met, the question resolves to N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Will Hurd is the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Will Hurd is appointed by the delegates at the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the choice made by the Republican National Convention, not on who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election.

2. The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024. The resolution will utilize data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will reference the precise (not rounded) figure.

If the first criterion is not fulfilled, the question will resolve to N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and the US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will Mayor Wilson show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. Then, given these conditions, will Mayor Kurt Wilson be physically present or confirmed via Zoom (with camera on and identification) at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024? If he is present or confirmed as described, the question resolves to yes; otherwise, it resolves to no.

para_P.title: Assuming that both Will Hurd is the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and that the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July 2024, will Mayor Wilson attend the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
para_P.body: Let’s consider the following assumptions: (a) Will Hurd is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, based on the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. Under these circumstances, will Mayor Kurt Wilson be in attendance or confirmed via Zoom (with video on and identification) at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024? If he is present or confirmed as specified, the answer will be yes; if not, it will be no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024? (b) Will Mayor Wilson show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 1) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and 2) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024, or if he dials in on Zoom with confirmation of his identity (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself). Resolves to **No** if he isn't there.

For (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Hurd will be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and the Core CPI in the US will rise by more than 0.1% in July 2024? (b) Will Mayor Wilson attend the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: 1) Hurd is picked by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and 2) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Mayor Kurt Wilson is present at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024, or if he joins via Zoom with verification of his identity (e.g., camera on, speaking and confirming his identity). It will resolve to **No** if he is absent.

For (a), the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined exclusively by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Liz Cheney going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will conclude as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Liz Cheney being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not relevant to who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, given this condition, will Kamala Harris announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th? This resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate, and NO if she announces anyone else. The resolution will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

para_P.title: Assuming Liz Cheney is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala Harris choose either Kelly or Shapiro as her Vice Presidential running mate?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the scenario where Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is made solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and does not pertain to who will be the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

Under this premise, will Kamala Harris reveal her selection for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th? The answer is YES if Kamala Harris declares either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate, and NO if she selects someone else. The final decision will be confirmed only when Kamala Harris makes the announcement herself.

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for President and Kamala Harris picks Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as VP, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th district in the special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs: (1) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by her.

Then, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If Liz Cheney becomes the Republican candidate for President and Kamala Harris chooses either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her Vice Presidential running mate, will the Republican Party hold onto Ohio's 6th district in the upcoming special election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following takes place: (1) Liz Cheney is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Kamala Harris publicly announces her choice for Vice President as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th, with her confirmation.

Then, will the Republican Party manage to keep Ohio's 6th congressional district (which was formerly represented by Bill Johnson) in the special election of 2024?

Resolution criteria: The question is answered with Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In the event of conflicting reports from popular sources, an authoritative statement or source from Ohio will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be considered void.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (2) Kamala Harris picks either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her VP, and (3) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(1) Liz Cheney must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(2) Kamala Harris must announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

(3) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will take place: (1) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (2) Kamala Harris chooses either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her Vice President, and (3) the Republican Party maintains control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body:
(1) Liz Cheney needs to be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(2) Kamala Harris is required to reveal her selection for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th. This selection must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

(3) This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate representing the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If there are conflicting reports from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will Renew secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Renew secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be considered **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, the resolution will rely on official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media sources.

question.title: Conditional on Renew holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, given this, will the BJP have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections? This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP forms the government and as **No** for all other outcomes.

The next Indian general election is expected to occur in May 2024, following any election after June 1, 2022.

para_P.title: Assuming Renew secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the BJP establish the government after the upcoming Indian general election in 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the premise that Renew secures the highest number of seats post the 2024 European Parliament elections. This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Renew indeed holds the highest number of seats, and as **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, the resolution will depend on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

Therefore, based on this scenario, will the BJP have a representative inaugurated as the next Indian Prime Minister after the forthcoming general elections? This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP successfully forms the government, and as **No** for any other possible outcomes.

The anticipated date for the next Indian general election is May 2024, following any elections that take place after June 1, 2022.

question.title: Given Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections AND BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election, will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: 
1. Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.
2. The BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).
3. The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

If any of these conditions is not met, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Renew secures the highest number of seats in the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections AND the BJP establishes the government after the upcoming Indian general election, will the French Prime Minister be a part of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if all the following criteria are fulfilled: 
1. Renew secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. In case of a tie between two groups for seats, this resolution will rely on official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media reports.
2. The BJP has a representative inaugurated as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections that take place after June 1, 2022 (currently anticipated for May 2024).
3. The political affiliation of the French Prime Minister is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to reliable sources.

If any of these criteria are not satisfied, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Elon Musk attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and Linda Yaccarino is Twitter CEO on July 1, 2024, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as YES if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee and there is another Democratic debate, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then, regarding the situation in Ukraine, it resolves as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

If the condition regarding Larry Elder and the Democratic debate is not met, the question resolves N/A.

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control over the location or a lack of Russian control over the location.

question.title: If Kamala Harris becomes President by Friday, will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This designation can be confirmed through official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Given this scenario, will Nikki Haley be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Nikki Haley is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, regardless of any other candidates or options that may be present.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris assume the presidency by Friday, will Nikki Haley be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Imagine the following situation: Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This recognition can be validated through official announcements from the US government or a general agreement among reliable news sources.

In light of this situation, will Nikki Haley be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer is Yes if Nikki Haley is appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, irrespective of any other candidates or alternatives that may exist.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and Nikki Haley being selected as the Republican nominee, will a reliable media outlet cover Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, will a reliable media outlet cover the story of Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Assuming Kamala Harris takes on the role of President or Acting President prior to July 26, 2024, and Nikki Haley is appointed as the Republican nominee, will a trustworthy news organization report on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
Consider the following conditions: (a) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET, with the primary resolution source being official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of credible journalism. 

(b) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based on the selection made by the convention's delegates rather than the announcement made on election day. 

In this scenario, will a trustworthy news organization report on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question will be marked as YES if a major and credible news outlet, such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post, covers the withdrawal with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially declares his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, (b) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) if Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(c) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, (b) Nikki Haley is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) if Joe Biden withdraws, a credible news organization reports the situation at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for this resolution will be official announcements from the US government, along with a consensus of trustworthy reports also taken into account.

(b) Nikki Haley is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is declared the nominee on the election day.

(c) In the event that President Joe Biden steps down, a major and reputable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes an official announcement about his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not suffice. This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure denotes a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by Trump's lead in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given this situation, will Joe Biden drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time? Resolves YES if Biden drops out before this date, otherwise resolves NO.

para_P.title: Considering that Trump is ahead of Biden by a margin of 2 to 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming that Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average. This is established by Trump's lead reflected in the 538 national polling average for the upcoming presidential election, reported on July 15, 2024. A positive figure signifies Trump's lead.

In light of this scenario, will Joe Biden exit the race or be otherwise unable to proceed before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024? The outcome is YES if Biden withdraws before this deadline, otherwise it is NO.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, and Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose both of the following conditions are true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden drops out of the 2024 presidential race before July 20, 2024. Given these conditions, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for P: 
- (a) Resolves true if on July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average.
- (b) Resolves true if Biden drops out before July 20, 2024.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if credible reports indicate an attack attributed to Iran within Israel's borders leads to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024.

para_P.title: If Trump's margin over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, and Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, will Iran execute a lethal strike inside Israel before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming both of the following statements hold true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is more than 2 and at most 3 points as per 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden exits the 2024 presidential election prior to July 20, 2024. Under these circumstances, will Iran conduct a fatal attack within the borders of Israel before May 1, 2024? 

Criteria for determining the truth of P: 
- (a) Resolves as true if on July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and at most 3 according to 538's national polling average.
- (b) Resolves as true if Biden exits before July 20, 2024.

Criteria for determining Q: Resolves YES if credible information suggests an attack linked to Iran within the territory of Israel results in the death of at least five people before May 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) Biden will drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Iran will carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

(c) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will happen: (a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but at most 3 according to the national polling average by 538, (b) Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and (c) Iran will execute a lethal assault inside Israel before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when it is checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for this question's context.

(b) If Biden exits or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

(c) This question will resolve to **Yes** if, after this question is published and before May 1, 2024, credible information surfaces indicating that an attack linked to Iran has occurred within Israel, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will one country secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the answer to be **Yes**.

question.title: Given the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win at least 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the outcomes of two scenarios at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Suppose the following is true: A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means the same nation must win at least two of these events.

Then, the question asks: Will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

The resolution criteria for the second part: The market resolves to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If confirmed prior to the end of the Games, the market resolves immediately to "Yes". Otherwise, it resolves to "No".

para_P.title: If a single country secures victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes achieve at least 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the results of two conditions at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Assuming the following holds true: One National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports, which include association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This implies that the same country must triumph in at least two of these competitions.

Subsequently, the question posed is: Will Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

The criteria for resolution regarding the second part: The market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, as determined by the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reputable sources. If this is verified before the conclusion of the Games, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, it will resolve to "No".

question.title: Given that both a single nation wins more than one women's team sport and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals at Paris 2024, will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question considers the scenario where both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics:
(a) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals, as determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable.

Given these conditions, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

The question resolves positively if the USA is the unique highest ranked team, ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, and negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

para_P.title: If a single country secures victories in multiple women's team sports and Individual Neutral Athletes attain 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the USA lead the Olympic Medal Table?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which both of the following happen at the Paris 2024 Olympics:
(a) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.
