(b) Individual Neutral Athletes together win 21 or more gold medals, as confirmed by the official medal tally released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if IOC reporting is not available.

Under these circumstances, will the United States Olympic Team be the sole top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is determined by aggregating all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them by:
1. Total Number of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Total Number of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Total Number of Bronze Medals.

The question is answered positively if the USA is the sole top-ranked team, ambiguously if the Paris Olympics are not held before 2027, and negatively if any other team achieves a ranking that is higher or equal to that of the US team.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (1) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, and (2) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question resolves to Yes if all of the following conditions are met at the Paris 2024 Olympics: 

1. The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals, as determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable.

3. The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
   - Number of Gold Medals
   - (Where Gold Medals are tied) Number of Silver Medals
   - (Where Silver Medals are tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (1) A single nation secures victories in multiple women's team sports and Individual Neutral Athletes earn 21 or more gold medals, and (2) The USA leads the Olympic Medal Table?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the following criteria are fulfilled at the Paris 2024 Olympics: 

1. The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieves gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

2. Individual Neutral Athletes, as a group, accumulate 21 or more gold medals, as verified by the official medal tally released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if IOC reporting is not available.

3. The United States Olympic Team ranks as the (sole) highest team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is determined by compiling all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them by:
   - Total Gold Medals
   - (In cases of tied Gold Medals) Total Silver Medals
   - (In cases of tied Silver Medals) Total Bronze Medals.

The question will be considered ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. If any of these conditions are unmet, the question will be answered as No.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not included. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

Background: A GOP legislator has requested Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from office.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then is the following true? Before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports, at least one of the following events happens:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Should President Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between China and the Philippines before August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: Before August 2024, the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another applicable authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that President Biden is incapable of fulfilling the responsibilities of his position, leading to the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Then, is it accurate to say that before August 1, 2024, based on official announcements or reliable sources, at least one of the following events occurs:

- The Philippines dismisses at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.
- The PRC dismisses at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
- The PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

If no such reports exist before that date, then the answer is No.

question.title: Given both Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 and diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, meaning the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China, meaning one of these events occurs: The Philippines expels or recalls at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), or the PRC expels or recalls at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

Then, given these conditions, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024; resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment does not cause a NO resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: If Biden is declared unable to perform his duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 and there are diplomatic expulsions or recalls between China and the Philippines prior to August 2024, will he still be President at the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: Before August 2024, (a) Biden is officially declared unable to fulfill the responsibilities of his office under the 25th Amendment Section 4, which means the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) formally states that "the President cannot carry out the powers and duties of his office," leading to the Vice President assuming the role of Acting President, and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between China and the Philippines, indicating that one of the following happens: The Philippines expels or recalls at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC), or the PRC expels or recalls at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

Under these circumstances, will Biden continue to be the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET)? This will be answered with YES if Biden is still President at the end of July 2024; it will be NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. Note that a temporary transfer of power as per the 25th Amendment does not result in a NO answer, as the Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 2024, and will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines. The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No. This question resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden is declared unable to fulfill his duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and (b) there are diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China before August 2024, while Biden continues as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not considered.

(b) Resolves to YES if before August 1, 2024, one of the following occurs, based on official announcements or credible reports: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC. The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines. The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. If there are no such reports by that date, then this resolves to No. This question has the same resolution as the original on Metaculus.

(c) Resolves to YES if Biden remains in office as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making the Vice President the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination for the Democratic Vice President, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is chosen for the VP position, the market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is met. If someone else is selected as VP, it is not met. The VP nomination is considered final at the time of initial nomination.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th. This could be by signing a letter or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris be the Democratic Vice Presidential nominee, will a minimum of five identified Democratic House Members or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming Kamala Harris receives the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency, will at least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House of Representatives or the Senate collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Criteria for determining the condition: This condition is satisfied if Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic VP. If another individual is chosen for this role, it is not satisfied. The finality of the VP nomination is established at the moment of its initial announcement.

Criteria for determining the outcome: A YES resolution occurs if a collective of no fewer than five named Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate jointly requests Biden to consider withdrawing from his 2024 re-election campaign, or to actively encourage him to do so, before July 20th. This could take the form of a signed letter or another method of unified action. All five members must be included in the same group communication. If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, the outcome will be a NO.

question.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP and at least 5 Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Biden have a 45+ minute on-camera interview before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President, and at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collectively urge Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th. Given this scenario, will Joe Biden participate in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- Kamala Harris must be initially nominated as the Democratic Vice President.
- A group of at least five named Democratic lawmakers must collectively act to urge Biden to reconsider his re-election campaign before July 20th.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024.
- The interview must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include podcasts, late night shows, or edited interviews like those on 60 Minutes.
- At least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person must be released.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris be the Democratic Vice President and if five or more Democratic legislators urge Biden to step down prior to July 20th, will Biden conduct a 45+ minute on-camera interview before July 2024 concludes?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President, and a minimum of five identified Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate jointly press Joe Biden to withdraw from the 2024 re-election race before July 20th. In light of this situation, will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?

Criteria for assessing the condition: 
- Kamala Harris must be officially nominated as the Democratic Vice President.
- A collective of no fewer than five specific Democratic lawmakers must act together to persuade Biden to reconsider his re-election bid before July 20th.

Criteria for assessing the outcome:
- Biden must take part in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024.
- The interview should not involve press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town halls, etc., but may include podcasts, late-night television shows, or edited interviews such as those featured on 60 Minutes.
- At least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person must be made public.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP, at least 5 named Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. The resolution is based on the initial nomination, and any changes after that do not affect the outcome. (2) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The group must act collectively, such as by signing a letter or meeting Biden in person. (3) Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. If all three conditions are satisfied, this question resolves to YES. If any condition is not met, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris set to be the Democratic Vice President, given that a minimum of five identified Democratic lawmakers urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, and will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if all of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Kamala Harris receives the nomination as the Democratic Vice President. The resolution relies on the initial nomination, and any subsequent changes will not influence the result. (2) At least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House of Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The group must act in unison, such as by signing a letter or meeting Biden face-to-face. (3) Joe Biden engages in an in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, made public before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 Minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. If all three criteria are met, this question will be answered with YES. If any criterion is not fulfilled, it will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday?
question.body: This market will resolve YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August, 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET

para_P.title: Is it possible that Maria Corina Machado will be incarcerated prior to Friday?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a YES if the opposition figure Maria Corina Machado is detained before the clock strikes midnight on Friday, August 3rd, 2024, in VET time.

question.title: Conditional on Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday, will a reliable media outlet cover Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Given this condition, we are interested in whether a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post will cover President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Maria Corina Machado must be imprisoned before the specified date and time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves YES if a reliable media outlet covers the dropout at least 6 hours before the official announcement. The question resolves as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Maria Corina Machado is jailed prior to Friday, will a trustworthy news source report on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the hypothetical situation in which Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is jailed before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Under this premise, we seek to determine if a major and credible news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post will report on President Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his formal announcement through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not suffice.

Criteria for the condition to be met: Maria Corina Machado must be jailed before the specified date and time.
Criteria for the outcome: The inquiry resolves to YES if a reliable news source reports the withdrawal at least 6 hours before the official announcement. The inquiry resolves as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Given both (a) Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday and (b) Joe Biden's dropout is covered by reliable media at least 6 hours in advance, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 
(a) Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This condition is only relevant if Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given these conditions, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: If both (a) Maria Corina Machado is detained prior to Friday and (b) Joe Biden's withdrawal is reported by credible media outlets at least 6 hours beforehand, will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House/Senate endorse a public statement against the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements are accurate: 
(a) Maria Corina Machado, the leader of the opposition, is detained before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) Should President Joe Biden decide to withdraw, a major and trustworthy media source like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his formal announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This condition applies only if Biden withdraws before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

Given these statements, will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House/Senate endorse a public statement opposing the early nomination of Biden?

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they claim suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain profoundly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of at least 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday? (b) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (2) Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(1) (a) Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, must be imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post must cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This condition is only relevant if Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.
(2) Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (1) Will the following happen: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado be incarcerated prior to Friday? (b) If Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy news outlet report the event at least 6 hours ahead of his official announcement? (2) Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
(1) (a) The opposition leader, Maria Corina Machado, needs to be incarcerated before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) Should President Joe Biden withdraw, a major and reputable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post must report on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his formal announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This stipulation is only applicable if Biden withdraws before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention. Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or remarks by individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.
(2) Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s plan to secure President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially intended, which they claim suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still very concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a clever way to suppress debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t operate that way,” Huffman noted in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators associated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Multiple such letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** outcome. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who wins the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this context, we want to know if there will be another Democratic party presidential debate. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise. 

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Will Hurd is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will there be an additional debate among Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this scenario, we seek to determine if there will be an additional debate among Democratic party presidential candidates. 

Criteria for the condition: Will Hurd must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if there is a debate featuring potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases. 

If the condition is not satisfied, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Will Hurd is the Republican nominee and there is another Democratic party presidential debate, will Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Given these conditions, will Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: If Will Hurd is the Republican candidate and another Democratic presidential debate occurs, will Kamala Harris take office as President by July 26, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (a) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made solely based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is announced as the Republican nominee on election day in 2024. (b) There will be a debate among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Under these circumstances, will Kamala Harris be officially appointed as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The main source for resolving this question will be official US government information, but a consensus of reliable news reporting will also be considered.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) there be another Democratic party presidential debate, AND (c) Kamala Harris be designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. (c) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used. If all conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following events will take place: (a) Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) another Democratic presidential debate occurs, AND (c) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) There takes place a debate among prospective Democratic candidates (for instance, Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. (c) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary source for resolving this matter will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus of reliable reporting will also be considered. If any of the conditions are not fulfilled, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
The resolution will be Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The resolution will be No if this situation does not occur.

An incident will be classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any official agency of the State of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or any member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person (other than the terrorists) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given this, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024? The question will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will there be a military-related fatality involving China and Taiwan in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A terrorist incident occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, causing injury or death to at least one individual (excluding the terrorists) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The incident must be classified as a 'terrorist incident' by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

In light of this, will there be a military-related fatality involving China and Taiwan in 2024? The question will be answered as Yes if, prior to June 6, 2024, credible information verifies one or more fatalities among the military forces of China or Taiwan due to conflict between the two nations. If this condition is not satisfied, the resolution will be N/A.

question.title: Given both a terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (b) there is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024. 

Details for (a): Resolves Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Details for (b): Resolves Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

Then, is it true that at least 24 world records will be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as Yes if 24 or more world records are broken during the Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: If both a terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and there is a military conflict resulting in fatalities between China and Taiwan prior to June 6, 2024, will a minimum of 24 world records be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (b) there are fatalities due to military conflict between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024. 

For (a): This will resolve as Yes if a terrorist act in Metropolitan France causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

For (b): This will resolve as Yes if credible reports confirm one or more fatalities among the armed forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict between the two nations before June 6, 2024.

Then, is it accurate to say that at least 24 world records will be surpassed during the 2024 Paris Olympics? This will resolve as Yes if 24 or more world records are established during the Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) An armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) At least 24 world records broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about a terrorist act in metropolitan France will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The question about an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(c) The question about world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics will resolve as Yes if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) A fatality resulting from armed conflict between China and Taiwan happens before June 6, 2024, and (c) At least 24 world records are set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding a terrorist incident in metropolitan France will be deemed Yes if a terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), occurring between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be considered No if this does not occur. An event is classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

(b) The inquiry concerning a fatality due to armed conflict between China and Taiwan will be regarded as Yes if, prior to June 6th, 2024, reliable reports confirm one or more deaths among the military forces of China or Taiwan due to conflict between the two nations.

(c) The inquiry about world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics will be regarded as Yes if the total number of world records established during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among the possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Conditional on there being another Democratic party presidential debate, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolves as YES. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming there will be another Democratic party presidential debate, will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in other cases.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Greens–EFA political group has the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups have the same number of seats, this is considered a YES. The resolution will rely on official announcements from the European Parliament or credible news sources.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Given both a Democratic debate and Greens-EFA win, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: In the event of a Democratic debate and a Greens-EFA victory, will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: (a) A debate takes place among potential Democratic candidates (including Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. Under these circumstances, will Biden be considered incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?

Criteria for resolution: Resolves to YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent body) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) There will be another Democratic party presidential debate prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, (b) Greens–EFA will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, AND (c) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en), credible media reports, and official declarations regarding the 25th Amendment.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) Another presidential debate for the Democratic party will occur before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, (b) The Greens–EFA will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, AND (c) Biden will be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if a debate is held among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

(b) This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**.

(c) This will be marked as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

This question will be resolved based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en), trustworthy media reports, and official announcements regarding the 25th Amendment.

question.title: Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday?
question.body: This market will resolve YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August, 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET

para_P.title: Will Maria Corina Machado face imprisonment prior to Friday?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is incarcerated before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.

question.title: Conditional on Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Then, will the S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Maria Corina Machado must be imprisoned before the specified time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for the most seats, both resolve as YES. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Assuming Maria Corina Machado is incarcerated prior to Friday, will the S&D party secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: Maria Corina Machado, the leader of the opposition, is detained before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. In that case, will the S&D party have the greatest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament?

Criteria for the condition to be met: Maria Corina Machado must be detained before the stated time. 
Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to YES if the S&D party has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two parties are equal in the number of seats, both are considered YES. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Conditionally on both Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday and S&D holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, including scenarios where S&D is tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution for this condition will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Given these conditions, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024? This referendum must have the consent of the London government and may be advisory, but not a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum without UK government permission.

para_P.title: Assuming both that Maria Corina Machado is incarcerated prior to Friday and that S&D secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, is it possible for Scotland to conduct a formal, authorized referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following two scenarios as true:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is detained before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D party has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, which includes situations where S&D is tied for the most seats with another party. The determination of this condition will rely on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

Under these circumstances, is Scotland set to hold a formal, sanctioned referendum regarding its independence from the United Kingdom prior to May 3, 2024? This referendum must receive approval from the London government and may be advisory in nature, but it cannot be classified as a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum that lacks UK government consent.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday? (b) Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (c) Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This includes scenarios where S&D is tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution for condition (b) will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(c) There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

para_P.title: Will all of the following take place: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado be jailed prior to Friday? (b) Will the S&D party secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (c) Will Scotland conduct an official, authorized referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if every one of the following criteria is satisfied:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is jailed before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D party secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. This includes situations where S&D is tied with another party for the most seats. The determination for condition (b) will rely on official announcements by the European Parliament or trustworthy media sources.

(c) A referendum is conducted in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum takes place before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it does not need to have any legally binding consequences. It will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A referendum must be regarded as having the approval of the London government.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Republican Party to keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. Should there be conflicting reports from popular sources, an authoritative statement or source from Ohio State will be utilized. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be deemed void.

question.title: Conditional on the Republican Party retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question considers whether the Republican Party retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election could be related to Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024.

Condition: The Republican Party must win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. This is confirmed if credible sources report a Republican victory. If sources disagree, an Ohio State source will be used. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the condition is annulled.

Outcome: Biden is declared incapacitated if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, declaring him unable to discharge his duties, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of incapacity does not matter. Exiting office by other means or invoking Section 3 does not count.

para_P.title: If the Republican Party keeps control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024, will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the potential connection between the Republican Party maintaining control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and the possibility of Biden being recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024.

Condition: The Republican Party must secure victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was previously represented by Bill Johnson. This will be verified if reputable sources announce a Republican win. If there is conflicting information, a source from Ohio will be consulted. If the election does not take place before January 1, 2025, this condition will be nullified.

Outcome: Biden will be considered incapacitated if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, asserting that he is unable to fulfill his responsibilities, resulting in the Vice President acting as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of incapacity is irrelevant. Leaving office through other methods or invoking Section 3 does not apply.

question.title: Given the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th district in the 2024 special election AND Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Resolution criteria for the condition: (a) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used in case of disagreement, and the election is held before January 1, 2025. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Biden must remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If the Republican Party keeps control of Ohio's 6th district in the special election of 2024 AND Biden is deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, will Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if the Republican Party maintains control of the 6th congressional district in Ohio during the 2024 special election and Biden is officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, while still serving as the US President through the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). It will be answered NO if Biden resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

Criteria for determining the condition: (a) Reliable sources confirm that a candidate from the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with statements from Ohio State being considered in case of disputes, and the election must occur before January 1, 2025. (b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) must invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office," resulting in the Vice President acting as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden's exit from the office due to death, resignation, or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Biden must remain the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET). A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th Amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (2) Biden remains President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur:

(1) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used in case of disagreement, and the election is held before January 1, 2025. Additionally, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (1) The Republican Party holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024 and Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, (2) Biden continues to serve as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent conditions are met:

(1) Reliable sources indicate that an individual representing the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with information from Ohio State sources or statements being used in cases of conflict, and the election takes place before January 1, 2025. Furthermore, the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) must invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office," resulting in the Vice President acting as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) Biden remains the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his VP as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Lithuania set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Lithuania fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Given Lithuania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Lithuania secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia also secure a spot?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In that case, will Slovenia take part in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Given both Lithuania and Slovenia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Cyprus also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Lithuania and Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Cyprus participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if both Lithuania and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final as per the EBU announcement. 
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Cyprus qualifies for the Grand Final as per the EBU announcement, and **No** otherwise. 
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Lithuania and Slovenia secure their spots in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Cyprus also secure a spot?
para_P.body:
