Assuming the following holds true: Lithuania and Slovenia both take part in a Semi-final and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured their places in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In this case, will Cyprus also take part in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is satisfied if Lithuania and Slovenia are confirmed for the Grand Final by the EBU. 
- The outcome is determined as **Yes** if Cyprus is confirmed for the Grand Final by the EBU, and **No** if it is not. 
- If the condition is not satisfied, the question is marked as N/A.

question.title: Will Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all three countries: Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus, participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus all take part in a Semi-final and are officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Should any of these nations fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
[image]

Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

para_P.title: Is the value of USD expected to be 145 JPY or more at the end of trading on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
[image]

The market outcome will be determined by the USD/JPY closing rate provided for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Conditional on USD being worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The USD is worth at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to the USD/JPY close listed on Yahoo! Finance. Then, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Assuming the USD is valued at 145 JPY or more at the end of trading on August 9th, 2024, will the head of the Secret Service step down in the following 90 days?
para_P.body: Let’s consider this scenario: The USD is valued at a minimum of 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, as per the USD/JPY closing rate available on Yahoo! Finance. In that case, will Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to be the director prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: Conditional on both USD being worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, and Kimberly Cheatle no longer being the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) The market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance, and the USD is worth >= 145 JPY. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds her position before October 12, 2024. Given these conditions, will Donald Trump be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as YES if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and NO otherwise. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Assuming that the USD is valued at 145 JPY or more at the close on August 9, 2024, and that Kimberly Cheatle is no longer serving as the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, will Donald Trump be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: Let us consider the following conditions: (a) The market will be determined by the USD/JPY closing value on August 9, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance, with the USD being worth at least 145 JPY. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, who is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, must resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to be in her role before October 12, 2024. Under these circumstances, will Donald Trump be nominated as the Republican candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve to YES if Donald Trump is nominated by the Republican National Convention, and NO if he is not. The outcome is determined exclusively by the decision of the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, (b) Kimberly Cheatle no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (c) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, must resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. (c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) the USD will be valued at 145 JPY or more at the close on August 9th, 2024, (b) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer serve as the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, and (c) Donald Trump will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The market will determine the USD/JPY closing value for August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, who holds the position of Director of the U.S. Secret Service, must either resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to be the director before October 12, 2024. (c) This question will be marked as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. The question may take into account new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Asa Hutchinson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this is true, will Biden drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming that Asa Hutchinson is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden choose to withdraw or be incapable of continuing his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time?

Criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to YES if Biden withdraws or is unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: If Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee and Biden drops out before July 20, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) in a vote, according to reports from credible sources?

para_P.title: Should Asa Hutchinson secure the Republican nomination and Biden withdraws prior to July 20, will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and Biden steps aside or is otherwise incapable of continuing the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. In that case, will the Pandemic Agreement be sanctioned during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) through a voting process, as indicated by reliable sources?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden drop out before July 20, and (c) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election, (2) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, and (3) during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. If any of these conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the following happen: (a) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden withdraws before July 20, and (c) the Pandemic Agreement gets ratified at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if all of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, no matter who is nominated on election day, (2) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, and (3) during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned in a vote, as reported by reliable sources. If any of these criteria are not satisfied, this inquiry will be regarded as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in support between Trump and Biden be more than 2 but no more than 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the difference in support for Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. 

Resolution criterion for this condition: This is based on the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported by 538 on July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Chris Christie will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criterion for this outcome: This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by the selection at the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual Republican nominee on the election day.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden falls between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Chris Christie secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 4 as per 538's national polling average. 

The resolution basis for this scenario: This is derived from the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election reported by 538 on July 15, 2024, and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

Then, is it accurate to say that Chris Christie will obtain the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

The resolution basis for this result: This will be considered Yes if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the selection made at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who the eventual Republican nominee is on election day.

question.title: Given both Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points and Chris Christie is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
2. Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, is it true that Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition, both of the following must occur:
  (a) Trump's lead over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.
  (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome, Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: With Trump's advantage over Biden ranging from 2 to 4 points and Chris Christie being the Republican nominee, will Trump's advantage fall between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: 
1. On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 and at most 4, based on 538's national polling average.
2. Chris Christie is the chosen Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, is it accurate to say that Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 3 and remain at or below 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition to be satisfied, both of the following must take place:
  (a) Trump's advantage over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.
  (b) Chris Christie is confirmed as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention.
- For the outcome, Trump's advantage over Biden must be greater than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

If the condition is not satisfied, it resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's margin over Biden will exceed 3 but not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Chris Christie will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and at most 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front.

(b) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Chris Christie is named by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This determination is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

This disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

Then, will the BJP have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, expected for May 2024? This question resolves as Yes if the BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, and No otherwise.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will the BJP secure the position of government after the upcoming Indian general election in 2024?

Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements are insufficient for this determination. The inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or potential reversals that may take place after the stated date. Then, will the BJP have a representative taking the oath as the next Indian Prime Minister following the forthcoming general elections, anticipated for May 2024? This question will be answered with Yes if the BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, and No otherwise.

question.title: Given Trump is removed from a primary ballot and BJP forms government, will a Trump be the 2024 Republican nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively. (2) The BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024.

Resolves Yes if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. Resolves No otherwise.

Resolves Yes if one of the following individuals is the Republican candidate for the U.S. Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.body: This question will be considered "Yes" if all of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI make a public pledge to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the following conditions are met:

- OpenAI publicly pledges to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a declaration from the organization or a representative, such as Sam Altman. The declaration can take the form of either a formal announcement (like a press release) or an informal remark (such as a tweet or a comment in an interview). The communication from OpenAI must demonstrate a heightened commitment to the principle compared to the period when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the organization has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact select signatories or endorsers to evaluate their level of contentment with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this inquiry to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI committing to "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" by July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce he is dropping out and resigning before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle, with verification from Metaculus that the commitment is satisfactory to at least one member of righttowarn.ai. 

Given this, will Joe Biden announce, before the end of July 2024 Pacific Time, both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term? The announcement must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned by then. If the announcement is made, this resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO on August 1st, 2024.

para_P.title: If OpenAI guarantees "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" by July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden declare his withdrawal and resignation prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle, confirmed by Metaculus as satisfactory to at least one member of righttowarn.ai. 

In light of this, will Joe Biden state, before the conclusion of July 2024 Pacific Time, that he is no longer seeking re-election and that he intends to resign, thus not finishing his current term? The statement must be made before the end of July 2024, although he does not need to have officially resigned by that time. If the statement is issued, this results in a YES. If not, it results in a NO on August 1st, 2024.

question.title: Given both (a) OpenAI commits to 'no retaliation for public risk disclosure' and (b) Joe Biden announces resignation by July 2024, will Iran initiate military action against Israel before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024. This means that before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:
- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

(b) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Then, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

For the purposes of this question, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

para_P.title: If both (a) OpenAI pledges to 'no retaliation for public risk disclosure' and (b) Joe Biden declares his resignation by July 2024, will Iran carry out military operations against Israel prior to August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements hold true: 
(a) OpenAI publicly pledges to adhere to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024. This entails that prior to July 1, 2024, both conditions are satisfied:
- OpenAI makes a public pledge to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement from the organization or a representative, such as Sam Altman. The statement can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote from an interview). The communication from OpenAI must demonstrate a heightened commitment to this principle compared to the period when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the organization has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact select signatories or supporters to evaluate their level of contentment with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as stringent as "this was a commendable initial step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

(b) Joe Biden declares that he is no longer seeking re-election and that he will resign and not finish his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. These declarations must be made before the conclusion of July 2024, although he does not need to have formally resigned and vacated his position by then. An announcement of his intention to do so suffices to resolve this market.

Then, will Iran execute military actions on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET? 

For the context of this inquiry, a "military action" is defined as any forceful engagement carried out by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be included. Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil, will be considered. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not be counted.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) OpenAI commits to "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" before July 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announces resignation and withdrawal before end of July 2024, and (c) Iran initiates military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
(a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024. This means that before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:
- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".

Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. (b) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

(c) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

(b) Joe Biden must announce both that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he will resign and not finish his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. An announcement of his intention to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

For this market, "military action" will be defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot on Israeli soil, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be counted towards the resolution of this market.

question.title: Conditional on the linked market getting at least 377 traders by end of July 15, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The linked market has at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the market has 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). Resolves NO otherwise. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Will there be a minimum of 5 nations securing their first gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if 5 or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Conditional on at least 5 countries winning their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Paris Olympics, 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal. Then, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the same Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to credible sources. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If at least 5 nations secure their inaugural gold medal at the 2024 Olympics, will Kalenjin runners triumph in both the men's and women's marathon events?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: At the 2024 Paris Olympics, 5 or more nations achieve their first Olympic gold medal. Will Kalenjin runners succeed in both the men's and women's marathon events during the same Olympic Games?

Criteria for the condition's resolution: The inquiry is answered with **Yes** if 5 or more nations earn their first Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, based on reliable sources.

Criteria for the outcome's resolution: The inquiry is answered with **Yes** if both marathon champions in the men's and women's categories at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin heritage, according to reputable sources. If the initial condition is not satisfied, the inquiry is deemed N/A.

question.title: Conditional on 5 countries winning their debut gold and Kalenjin athletes winning both marathons at the 2024 Olympics, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the Games?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Olympics, at least 5 countries win their first-ever gold medal and both the men's and women's marathon races are won by athletes with Kalenjin roots. Then, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, and (2) both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Given that 5 nations secure their first gold medals and Kalenjin runners triumph in both marathon events at the 2024 Olympics, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the Games?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: At the 2024 Olympics, at least 5 nations achieve their inaugural gold medal and both the men's and women's marathon titles are claimed by runners of Kalenjin heritage. Then, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Criteria for the condition's resolution: The inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of these conditions are satisfied: (1) 5 or more nations win their first Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, and (2) the champions of both the men's and women's marathons at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris are of Kalenjin descent, as confirmed by reliable sources.

Criteria for the outcome's resolution: The question will be answered as Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), during the period from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or any member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur during the 2024 Summer Olympics: (1) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal and Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races, and (2) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, and both the men's and women's marathon winners have Kalenjin roots according to credible sources. (2) A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is it possible that during the 2024 Summer Olympics, both of the following will take place: (1) A minimum of 5 nations achieve their first-ever gold medal and Kalenjin athletes secure victories in both the men's and women's marathon events, and (2) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) At the 2024 Summer Olympics hosted in Paris, at least 5 nations earn their inaugural Olympic gold medal, and both winners of the men's and women's marathon events are of Kalenjin descent according to reliable sources. (2) A terrorist act occurs in Metropolitan France that causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorists, between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The incident must be classified as a 'terrorist act' by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: Given BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be >2 and ≤4 on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the BSE SENSEX closes between 76,000 and 77,000, and Ron DeSantis is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for P: This condition is met if (1) the BSE SENSEX closes greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, and (2) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, is the following true: On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4?

Resolution criteria for Q: This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, and a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 for the question to resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX is between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee, will Trump's advantage over Biden be greater than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024?

A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. The lead must exceed 2 and be at most 4 for the answer to be Yes.

question.title: Will Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Australia going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Australia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Australia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Australia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this, will Georgia also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Georgia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for the answer to be YES. If Georgia does not qualify, the answer is NO. 

If Australia does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Australia makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia make it as well?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Australia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In this scenario, will Georgia also make it to the Grand Final? 

For the outcome to be YES, Georgia must compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Georgia does not qualify, the outcome is NO. 

If Australia fails to qualify, this question is considered N/A.

Then, will Portugal participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

In that case, will Portugal compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will Australia, Georgia, and Portugal all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Australia, Georgia, or Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Australia, Georgia, and Portugal all make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the following conditions are met: (a) Australia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Australia, Georgia, or Portugal fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service expected to step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is it anticipated that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to hold her position as director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Kimberly Cheatle must no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, due to resignation, being fired, or any other reason.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of acceptance. Resolves NO if such a statement is not made before the deadline.

para_P.title: Should the head of the Secret Service step down within the upcoming 90 days, will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's presidential nomination?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason ceases to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. 

In that case, will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for the condition to be resolved: Kimberly Cheatle must no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, whether due to resignation, dismissal, or any other cause.

Criteria for the outcome to be resolved: Resolves YES if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination in the 2024 election. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive, allowing no possibility of acceptance. Resolves NO if such a statement is not made prior to the deadline.

question.title: Given both the head of the Secret Service resigns and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs:

(a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds her position before October 12, 2024.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, given these conditions, will Tucker Carlson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and **No** if any other candidate is selected.

para_P.title: If both the head of the Secret Service steps down and Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Tucker Carlson be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Imagine the following happens:

(a) Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, either resigns, is dismissed, or for any reason ceases to be in her role before October 12, 2024.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be unequivocal and final, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Given these circumstances, will Tucker Carlson be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question is answered with **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate, and **No** if any other individual is chosen.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(b) Will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle? The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(c) Will Tucker Carlson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will happen: (a) the head of the Secret Service steps down within the next 90 days, (b) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be dismissed, or for any other reason cease to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(b) Will Joe Biden or his campaign issue a clear, public, official statement before midnight Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle? The announcement must be direct and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(c) Will Tucker Carlson be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other options may be introduced in the future.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This resolves to Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both categories. It resolves to No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first place.

question.title: Conditional on the United States winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Then, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Given that the United States secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat be victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The United States secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Will the Miami Heat be victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?

Criteria for determining the condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA secures both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team finishes in any position other than gold.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if another team is declared champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

question.title: Given Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics and the Miami Heat wins the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA. 

Then, is it true that the Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be considered broken if any athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or other credible sources.

para_P.title: If Team USA secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics and the Miami Heat triumphs in the 2024 NBA Finals, will the men's pole vault Olympic record be surpassed during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Team USA achieves gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and the Miami Heat is declared the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals as recognized by the NBA. 

Then, can we conclude that the Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The record will be deemed broken if any competitor clears a height of 6.04m or more, based on results published by the International Olympic Committee or other reliable sources.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) The Miami Heat wins the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Resolves Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (2) The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA, and (3) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. Resolves No if any of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for all of the following to happen: (a) Team USA secures gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) The Miami Heat claims victory in the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) The men's pole vault Olympic record is surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question is answered with Yes if all of these criteria are fulfilled: (1) Team USA achieves gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (2) The Miami Heat is recognized as the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA, and (3) During the 2024 Paris Olympics, a male pole vaulter successfully clears a height of 6.04m or more, based on results from the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. A No answer is given if any of these criteria are not satisfied.

Given this scenario, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for President Biden to drop out of the presidential race before July 20, 2024?

Resolution criteria for P: P is considered true if Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the Secret Service for any reason by October 12, 2024.
Resolution criteria for Q: Q resolves to YES if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the provided source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Should the Director of the Secret Service resign within the upcoming 90 days, will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Kimberly Cheatle, who is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, either resigns, is dismissed, or ceases to hold the position for any reason prior to October 12, 2024. Criteria for determining Q: Q is resolved to YES if, at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the specified source indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to step down. Otherwise, it is resolved to NO.

question.title: Given Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, AND 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, will ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, AND (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, as indicated by the New York Times interactive 2024 elections page. Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: If Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the head of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, AND at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to step down before July 20, 2024, will ChatGPT be widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements hold true: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, has resigned, been dismissed, or for any other reason is no longer in that position before October 12, 2024, AND (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators request Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024, as reported by the New York Times interactive 2024 elections page. In that case, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

The outcome will be determined as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

Here, "widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as was experienced in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be viewed positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Iran will execute a fatal assault inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the date this question is published and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources confirm that an attack linked to Iran, taking place within the territory of Israel, has resulted in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Given Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?

para_P.title: If Iran executes a lethal strike inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX finish between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024?
