question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on June 28th, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses Apple's, as determined by [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), and verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 3.5 would indicate Trump is 3.5 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: Should Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on June 28, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden fall between 3 and 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, as per Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart for that date, when retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, a value of 3.5 would show Trump leading Biden by 3.5 points.

question.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap surpassing Apple's and Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points, will Nigel Farage be elected as an MP in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).
(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election held on July 4, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if credible media reports or official announcements confirm that Nigel Farage is elected as an MP for any UK constituency. The question resolves as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

para_P.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple and Trump is ahead of Biden by a margin of 3 to 4 points, will Nigel Farage secure a seat as an MP in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: 
(a) On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is confirmed to be greater than Apple's, as seen on Companies Market Cap around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).
(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 points, according to Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will Nigel Farage be chosen as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election taking place on July 4, 2024? This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if reliable media sources or official declarations verify that Nigel Farage is elected as an MP for any constituency in the UK. It will be resolved as **No** if this does not happen, unless the general election is cancelled or delayed past July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **void**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, and (c) Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

para_P.title: Is it possible for all of the following to take place: (a) Nvidia's market value surpassing that of Apple's on June 28, 2024, (b) Trump's advantage over Biden being greater than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, and (c) Nigel Farage winning a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), as verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, in the UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as a member of parliament (MP) for any constituency in the UK. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not happen, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should refer to reliable media sources such as the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other significant UK news outlets; or the official declaration of the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage is a candidate.

Farage does not need to be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves based on his election status.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

To be considered a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

(b) This inquiry will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic issues a *public* report detailing the results from an *external* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

(c) This inquiry will be marked as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To receive a Yes marking, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be marked as No.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Asa Hutchinson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Conditional on Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body: Suppose Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as Yes if Asa Hutchinson is indeed chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Then, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM? If her probability is >46.6%, the question resolves Yes; otherwise, it resolves No.

para_P.title: If Asa Hutchinson is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala's chances of winning improve in the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body: Assuming Asa Hutchinson is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, this inquiry will be marked as Yes if he is indeed chosen by the convention's delegates. Subsequently, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College likelihood in Nate Silver's analysis exceed 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM? If her likelihood is greater than 46.6%, the answer will be Yes; otherwise, it will be No.

question.title: Given both Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee and Kamala's odds increase, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (b) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, with her Electoral College probability exceeding 46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM.

Given these conditions, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Asa Hutchinson is the Republican candidate and Kamala's chances improve, will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: (a) Asa Hutchinson is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (b) According to Nate Silver's model, Kamala Harris's chances of winning rise over the upcoming week, with her Electoral College probability surpassing 46.6% by Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM.

Under these circumstances, will at least 10 Democratic Senators advocate for Biden to step down prior to July 20?

Outcome resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the New York Times interactive indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to withdraw at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and Kamala's odds of winning will increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (2) 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(1) Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Kamala's odds of winning will increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(2) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following two events to happen: (1) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election while Kamala Harris's chances of winning rise over the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis (2) At least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(1) Asa Hutchinson must be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will be answered with **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently being considered; other options may be introduced later. The determination of the Republican nominee does not depend on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Kamala Harris's chances of winning will be deemed to have increased over the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis. It resolves as YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It resolves as NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(2) Will at least 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to step aside before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If it shows at least 10 Democratic Senators before midnight July 20 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

question.title: If Larry Elder is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two political events in 2024. 

Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Larry Elder will be the Republican candidate to run for the presidency in the November 2024 US election.

Then, we ask if the following is true: Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. This resolves as **Yes** if, for any reason, Sunak does not win a seat as an MP in the election. If Sunak is elected as an MP for any constituency, it resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome should cite credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate, if applicable.

para_P.title: Should Larry Elder become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak be unsuccessful in securing a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible relationship between two political occurrences in 2024. 

Assuming the following holds true: Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This indicates that Larry Elder will represent the Republican Party in the presidential race in the November 2024 US election.

Next, we inquire whether the following is accurate: Rishi Sunak does not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This resolves as **Yes** if, for any reason, Sunak does not secure a seat as an MP in the election. If Sunak is elected as an MP for any constituency, it resolves as **No**.

The criteria for determining the outcome should reference reliable media sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate, if relevant.

question.title: Given Larry Elder becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This will be confirmed if credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency) state that Sunak was not elected.

Then, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle? This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to this date, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Larry Elder is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and Rishi Sunak does not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) Larry Elder is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024. This will be validated if reliable news sources or an official statement from the electoral officer in the area where Sunak is contesting (if he is contesting in any area) confirm that Sunak was not elected.

Then, will Joe Biden publicly declare before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States for the 2024 election cycle? This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, prior to this deadline, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept his party’s nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, and (c) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This will be confirmed if credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency) state that Sunak was not elected.

(c) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will happen: (a) Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Rishi Sunak does not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election, and (c) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if all of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Rishi Sunak does not get elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This will be verified if reliable media sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is standing (if he is contesting in any constituency) declare that Sunak was not elected.

(c) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither run for nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should not allow for any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls conducted by Manifold are set to conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests a vote for a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically polled either leads or is within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the wider public?

This market will be deemed YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will he be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, each closing on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks them to vote with a generic Democrat. This market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The calculation is based on the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. Then, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for witness tampering: The question resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The calculation follows the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

Assuming the following holds true: Trump secures at least 3% more support from Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat. Then, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?

Criteria for resolution regarding witness tampering: The question resolves to YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks about potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must take place before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Given Trump gains 3% among Manifold respondents against Biden and is charged with witness tampering in Georgia, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. This resolves YES if Trump is charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024.

Then, given these conditions, will Joe Biden die before Saturday? This resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Trump increases his support by 3% among Manifold participants against Biden and faces witness tampering charges in Georgia, is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Assume the following is accurate: (a) When competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, Trump sees an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants. There are two Manifold polls closing on July 6. One poll asks participants to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a generic Democrat. This resolves to YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll surpasses that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close. (b) Donald Trump faces charges of witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024. This resolves to YES if Trump is charged for any remarks concerning potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024.

Then, based on these stipulations, is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday? This resolves to YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death prior to market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents and Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024 (2) Joe Biden dies before Saturday?
question.body:
(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This part of the question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Additionally, Donald Trump must be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(2) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(1) Two Manifold polls will be conducted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden is losing to Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error rate, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically assessed is polling ahead or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents a fair representation of the general population?

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the closing time regardless of circumstances.

Furthermore, Donald Trump must be charged or indicted concerning any remarks pertaining to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must be issued before June 1, 2024.

(2) This will resolve to YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. If not, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news organization report on it at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
The question will be answered YES if a major and trustworthy news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments made by individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will be considered N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers it 6 hours in advance, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out, and a reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This condition will not be met if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given this, will the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election? The question resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when they select a male presidential nominee.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden withdraw and a trustworthy news source reports it 6 hours ahead of time, will the Democratic Party's candidate for President in 2024 be a woman?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden withdraws, and a trustworthy news outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's formal announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or remarks from individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This stipulation will not be fulfilled if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

In light of this, will the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024? The question will resolve to “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female candidate for the 2024 presidential election, and “no” if/when they select a male candidate.

question.title: Given both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman, then will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

(a) A big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout, if he does drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Then, will Kamala Harris announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, confirmed by herself before August 7th?

This question resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.
This question resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate.

para_P.title: If both of the following take place: (a) In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy news source report the story at least 6 hours prior? (b) Will the Democratic nominee for President in 2024 be a woman, then will Kamala Harris choose either Kelly or Shapiro as her vice presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) A major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports President Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before his official announcement, should he decide to withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The Democratic delegates nominate a woman as the presidential candidate for the 2024 election.

Then, will Kamala Harris make her selection for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, confirmed by her before August 7th?

This question resolves YES if Kamala Harris names either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate. This question resolves NO if she chooses someone else.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? (c) Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
(a) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.
Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.
This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.
Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(c) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will happen: (a) In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a reputable news organization report on it at least 6 hours prior? (b) Will the Democratic Party's nominee for the 2024 Presidential election be a woman? (c) Will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her Vice Presidential candidate (YES), or will it be someone else (NO)?
para_P.body:
(a) The answer will be YES if a major and trustworthy media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the dropout with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal via letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy sites, or individual comments on Manifold will not suffice. This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This will be marked as “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024. It will be marked as “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024.

(c) The leading candidates for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Reports suggest that Kamala will make her choice before August 7th. 

This market will be marked YES if/when Kamala Harris declares her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. 

This market will be marked NO if/when Kamala Harris announces any other individual as her running mate.

I will await Kamala's official confirmation of her pick to resolve this.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will at least 24 world records be broken?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will at least 24 world records be broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria:
- Condition (P): Resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
- Outcome (Q): Resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. If fewer than 24 world records are broken, resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not met, resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If a tennis player secures more than one medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will there be at least 24 world records shattered?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A tennis player achieves a minimum of two medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Therefore, will there be at least 24 world records broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria:
- Condition (P): Resolves as **Yes** if any tennis player secures at least two medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
- Outcome (Q): Resolves as **Yes** if the tally of world records broken during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more. If fewer than 24 world records are broken, it resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not satisfied, it resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis and at least 24 world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal in tennis, and (b) At least 24 world records are broken. Given this scenario, we ask whether the United States Olympic Team will win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Resolution Criteria for the Condition: 
- Condition (a) is met if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis.
- Condition (b) is met if the number of world records broken is 24 or greater.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the United States wins more Gold medals than Silver medals.
- Resolves NO if they do not.

para_P.title: If an athlete secures multiple medals in tennis and a minimum of 24 world records are shattered at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the USA achieve a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines a hypothetical situation in which both of the following take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete secures more than one medal in tennis, and (b) At least 24 world records are shattered. In light of this situation, we question whether the United States Olympic Team will obtain a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Criteria for Assessing the Condition: 
- Condition (a) is satisfied if any athlete wins two or more medals in tennis.
- Condition (b) is satisfied if the number of world records broken is 24 or more.

Criteria for Determining the Outcome: 
- Resolves to YES if the United States garners more Gold medals than Silver medals.
- Resolves to NO if they do not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, (2) At least 24 world records are broken, (3) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis, (2) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater, (3) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals.

para_P.title: Will every one of the subsequent events take place at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) A tennis player secures multiple medals, (2) At least 24 world records are surpassed, (3) The USA achieves a higher count of Gold medals compared to Silver?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if all the following criteria are fulfilled during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) Any tennis player earns two or more medals, (2) The total number of world records broken reaches 24 or more, (3) The United States Olympic Team garners a greater number of Gold medals than Silver medals.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: On July 21, 2024, will the final price of BSE SENSEX exceed 75,000 but not surpass 77,000?
para_P.body: This inquiry is determined by the final price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the BSE SENSEX closing value and Iran's potential military action against Israel.

Condition: The closing value of the BSE SENSEX must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

Outcome: Resolves to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Military action is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory, officially acknowledged by Iran or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory are considered. Proxy attacks do not count. Resolves to "No" otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves to N/A.

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX finishes between 75,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, will Iran carry out a military action prior to August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX and the likelihood of Iran's military engagement against Israel.

Condition: The BSE SENSEX must close above 75,000 and at or below 77,000 on July 21, 2024, based on Yahoo Finance data.

Outcome: The question is answered with "Yes" if Iran commences military operations on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime zones from July 30 to August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. Military operations are characterized as any forceful actions taken by Iran on Israeli territory, which are officially recognized by Iran or widely reported by credible sources. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, economic sanctions, or diplomatic measures are excluded. Only actions that are explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil are taken into account. Proxy warfare is not included. The resolution will be "No" in all other cases.

If the specified condition is not fulfilled, the inquiry will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Given both BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Iran initiates military action on Israeli territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, will a Trump family member be the Republican nominee in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
2. Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This includes any use of force executed by Iran that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count, not attacks by proxy forces.

Given these conditions, will a member of the Trump family (Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump) be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX closes between 75,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, and Iran launches military operations against Israel between July 30 and August 12, 2024, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican candidate in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenarios occur:

1. The closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is above 75,000 and at or below 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.
2. Iran engages in military actions on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. This includes any military force employed by Iran that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by credible reports, such as airstrikes, naval operations, or ground assaults, but does not cover cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures. Only actions that are directly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory are considered, excluding attacks conducted by proxy groups.

Based on these scenarios, will a Trump family member (including Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump) secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024? (c) Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as "Yes" if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000.

(b) This question resolves as "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" includes any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, count. Attacks by proxy forces do not count.

(c) This question resolves as "Yes" if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will happen: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the final value of the BSE SENSEX exceed 75k but not surpass 77k? (b) Will Iran carry out a military operation on Israeli land between July 30 and August 12, 2024? (c) Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question is answered with "Yes" if the final value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance, is more than 75,000 and at most 77,000.

(b) This question is answered with "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, by 11:59 PM ET. A "military operation" encompasses any forceful action taken by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by credible reporting, including airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers do not qualify. Only actions that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory are considered. Attacks carried out by proxy groups do not count.

(c) This question is answered with "Yes" if any of the following individuals is the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the closing price of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 76,000 but not go beyond 77,000?
para_P.body: This inquiry determines if the closing price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance, falls within the specified range.

question.title: Suppose the BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024. Will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question considers two separate events:

1. **Condition (P):** On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000. This is determined based on the closing value reported by Yahoo Finance.

2. **Outcome of Interest (Q):** On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election over Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast. This forecast must show Biden having a higher probability of winning than Trump on that specific day, as indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's website.

The question asks whether, given that the BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, FiveThirtyEight will project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX finishes between 76,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry involves two distinct occurrences:

1. **Condition (P):** The closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is more than 76,000 but not exceeding 77,000. This will be based on the closing figure reported by Yahoo Finance.

2. **Outcome of Interest (Q):** On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is forecasted to be the leading candidate for the US presidential election against Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's election predictions. This forecast must reflect Biden having a greater chance of winning than Trump on that particular day, as shown by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's platform.

The inquiry seeks to determine whether, under the condition that the BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, FiveThirtyEight will indicate Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024.

question.title: Given BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Biden is favored by 538, will Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 according to Yahoo Finance, and on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight's election forecast. Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The resolution sources are Yahoo Finance for the BSE SENSEX value, FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for Biden's odds, and legal indictments for Donald Trump's charges.

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX closes between 76,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, and Biden is leading according to 538, will Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?

Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted regarding any remarks about potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The sources for resolution are Yahoo Finance for the BSE SENSEX closing figure, FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for Biden's status, and legal indictments concerning Donald Trump's allegations.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k, and will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on the preceding Friday? (b) Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as 'Yes' if both of the following occur: (1) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 according to Yahoo Finance, and Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight's election forecast for July 19, 2024, meaning Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that day. (2) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with the indictments occurring before June 1, 2024. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves as 'No'. The resolution sources are Yahoo Finance for the BSE SENSEX value, FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for Biden's odds, and official court records for the indictment of Donald Trump in Georgia.

para_P.title: On July 21, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX close above 76,000 but at or below 77,000, while FiveThirtyEight forecasts Biden as the frontrunner on the prior Friday? Additionally, will Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with 'Yes' if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (1) The BSE SENSEX's closing figure on July 21, 2024, exceeds 76,000 and is at most 77,000 according to Yahoo Finance, and on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is anticipated to be the leading candidate over Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's election prediction, indicating Biden has a better chance of winning the US presidential election than Trump on that date. (2) Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with the charges being filed before June 1, 2024. If either condition fails to be met, the answer to this question will be 'No'. The sources for resolution are Yahoo Finance for the BSE SENSEX closing value, FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for Biden's chances, and official court documents regarding the indictment of Donald Trump in Georgia.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump will face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks associated with potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: If Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

If the condition regarding Donald Trump is not met, the question resolves to N/A.

para_P.title: Should Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20?
para_P.body:
The inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks associated with potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments need to take place before June 1, 2024.

Source for resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If, at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, it is evident that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for this action, the market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.
