question.title: Given Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and 10+ Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out by July 20, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024, and (b) at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out according to the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html.

Then, is Ted Cruz selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and **No** otherwise.

para_P.title: If Trump faces witness tampering charges in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, and more than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw by July 20, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any remarks concerning potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024, and (b) at any moment before midnight on July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to step aside according to the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html.

Then, will Ted Cruz be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and **No** if not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024, and (c) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The answer will be **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any comments connected to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. These charges must be made before June 1, 2024.

(b) Source for resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If it is confirmed that 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for this before midnight on July 20 Central Time, then this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

(c) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**. The resolution is not limited to the candidates listed currently; additional candidates may be introduced later.

The determination of this question does not depend on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if any other team is named the champion.

question.title: Conditional on the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per the NBA's official records. Given this condition, we are interested in whether France will place in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the condition: The New York Knicks must win the 2024 NBA Finals.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: France must place in the top 5 in the Olympic medal table, calculated by the total number of medals and ordered by the number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: If the New York Knicks are victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals, will France achieve a Top 5 finish at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the hypothetical situation in which the New York Knicks are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the official NBA records. Under this assumption, we seek to determine if France will secure a position among the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Criteria for the condition: The New York Knicks must triumph in the 2024 NBA Finals.

Criteria for the outcome: France needs to finish in the top 5 of the Olympic medal standings, which are determined by the total count of medals and ranked by Gold, Silver, and subsequently Bronze medals. The question remains unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Given both the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. (2) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024, based on the total number of medals won, ordered by Gold, Silver, then Bronze. The Olympics must take place in 2024 for this condition to be valid.

Given these conditions, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is determined by the total number of medals won, ordered by Gold, Silver, then Bronze. The question resolves positively if the US is the unique highest ranked team, ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place before 2027, and negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

para_P.title: If the New York Knicks are victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals and France secures a Top 5 finish at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the USA lead the Olympic Medal Table in Paris 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements are accurate: (1) The New York Knicks are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per NBA regulations. (2) France achieves a position within the top 5 (ties are resolved in favor) at the 2024 Olympics, based on the total medal count, ranked by Gold, Silver, and then Bronze. The Olympics must occur in 2024 for this scenario to hold true.

Under these circumstances, will the United States Olympic Team be the sole highest-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal rankings are determined by the total number of medals earned, prioritized by Gold, Silver, and then Bronze. The question is answered positively if the US stands as the only highest-ranked team, ambiguously if the Olympics do not occur before 2027, and negatively if any other team matches or surpasses the US team's ranking.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention. (2) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. (3) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following events to happen: (a) The New York Knicks emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) France secures a position in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) the USA leads the Olympic Medal Table at the 2024 Paris Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) The New York Knicks are recognized as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be considered **No** if any other team is declared the champion after being eliminated from the competition. (2) France finishes in the top 5 (ties are counted positively) at the 2024 Olympics. It will be considered ambiguous if the Olympics do not occur in 2024. The medal standings are determined by the total medals earned by each participating nation, ranked by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Number of Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Number of Bronze Medals. (3) The United States Olympic Team is the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not happen before 2027. It will be considered negative if any team matches or exceeds the ranking of the US team. The medal standings are calculated based on all medals won by each competing nation, ranked by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Number of Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Number of Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
[image]

Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

para_P.title: Will the value of USD reach or exceed 145 JPY (yen) by the end of trading on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
[image]

The market will determine the outcome based on the USD/JPY closing rate recorded for August 9th, 2024, as shown on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: If USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be > 3 and <= 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The USD/JPY exchange rate is worth 145 or more yen per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The exchange rate must be 145 or more yen per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Trump's lead over Biden must be between 3 and 4 points (inclusive of 4) in the 538 national polling average on July 15, 2024, as accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Should the USD be valued at 145 JPY or higher at the end of trading on August 9th, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: The exchange rate for USD/JPY is 145 yen or more per USD at the close of business on August 9th, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance.

Then, can we confirm that Donald Trump has a lead of more than 3 points and up to 4 points over Joe Biden according to the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election on July 15, 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: The exchange rate must be 145 yen or greater per USD at the close of trading on August 9th, 2024, as per Yahoo! Finance.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Trump's lead over Biden must fall between 3 and 4 points (including 4) in the 538 national polling average on July 15, 2024, as checked on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

question.title: Conditional on both USD/JPY >= 145 on August 9, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden being >3 and <=4 on July 15, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions:

(a) The USD must be worth at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given that both conditions (a) and (b) are true, will any of the following occur before June 1, 2024?

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Resolution Criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if any of the above events occur before June 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. If none of these events occur, it resolves as **No**. If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Given that the USD/JPY exchange rate is at least 145 on August 9, 2024, and Trump's advantage over Biden falls between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Take into account the following criteria:

(a) The value of the USD must reach a minimum of 145 JPY at the close on August 9, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance.

(b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden must be more than 3 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

Assuming both criteria (a) and (b) hold true, will any of the following actions take place before June 1, 2024?

- The Philippines expels one or more diplomats from the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls one or more of its diplomats based in the PRC.
- The PRC expels one or more diplomats representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls one or more of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Resolution Criteria: The question is answered with **Yes** if any of the aforementioned events occur before June 1, 2024, according to official announcements or reliable reports. If none of these events take place, the answer is **No**. If either criterion (a) or (b) is not satisfied, the question is marked as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(c) This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will happen: (a) the USD will reach a value of at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9, 2024, (b) Trump's margin over Biden will be more than 3 but at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) there will be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution of this market will depend on the USD/JPY closing value reported for August 9, 2024, as found on Yahoo! Finance.

(b) This inquiry will conclude positively if Donald Trump is shown to be ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For this question, a positive outcome indicates Trump is leading, while a negative outcome signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, if the report on July 5, 2024, indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, that would be considered a positive outcome of 2.4 for this question.

(c) This question will be marked as **Yes** if any of the following events occur before June 1, 2024, based on official announcements or [reliable reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If no such events are reported before that date, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and step down from his position before July concludes?
para_P.body:
This will be confirmed as YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he will not seek re-election and will resign from his current presidential term. Such announcements must occur prior to the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time; however, he is not required to have formally resigned and vacated his office by that date. A declaration of his plans to do so will suffice for this market to resolve positively.

If no such announcement is made, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: GIVEN Joe Biden announces dropping out and resigning, will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is both dropping out of the presidential race and resigning from the presidency. This announcement must be made in Pacific Time by the end of July 2024, but the actual resignation does not need to occur by then. 

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7th, 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if Joe Biden makes the specified announcements by the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time.
- The outcome resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and NO if she announces anyone else. The announcement must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself before August 7th, 2024.

para_P.title: IF Joe Biden declares his withdrawal and resignation, will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP?
para_P.body:
Imagine this scenario: Joe Biden proclaims before the conclusion of July 2024 that he is withdrawing from the presidential election and resigning from his presidential role. This proclamation must occur in Pacific Time by the end of July 2024, although the actual resignation can take place later. 

In this case, will Kamala Harris reveal her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7th, 2024? 

Criteria for resolution: 
- The condition is satisfied if Joe Biden makes the aforementioned announcements by the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time.
- The outcome is a YES if Kamala Harris names her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and a NO if she chooses someone else. This announcement must be made by Kamala Harris herself prior to August 7th, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Biden resigning and Harris picking Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, and (2) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Then, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- Resolves YES if both (1) and (2) occur as described.
- Resolves NO if either (1) does not occur by August 1, 2024, or (2) if Kamala Harris picks someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.
- Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Biden steps down and Harris selects either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, will Israel extend its ground assault to Rafah prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (1) Joe Biden declares that he will not seek re-election and will resign from his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, and (2) Kamala Harris announces her choice for a running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Under these circumstances, will Israel broaden its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: 
- Resolves YES if both (1) and (2) happen as stated.
- Resolves NO if either (1) does not take place by August 1, 2024, or (2) if Kamala Harris selects someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) indicates Israeli military actions on its map at any of six sites around Rafah before June 1, 2024.
- Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Resolves NO on August 1st otherwise.

(2) Resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Resolves NO if she announces anyone else. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala herself, and she is expected to choose before August 7th.

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the term "deepfake" be mentioned by Trump, Biden, or a moderator during the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, during the airing of the presidential debate organized by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators states the term "deepfake." Conversely, if this does not occur, the question will be marked as **No**.

The determination of whether any of the candidates or moderators has said "deepfake" will be solely at the discretion of the Admins at Metaculus. They will have the final authority to decide if this has taken place, and their judgment will be conclusive. In situations of uncertainty, they may refer to CNN's official transcript, which is usually available at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It is crucial to understand that without a clear instance of the word being spoken, particularly if it is absent from the transcript, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: GIVEN both deepfake is mentioned in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024, and Mike Pence is the Republican nominee, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake," and (b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for (a): This resolves as Yes if "deepfake" is uttered during the debate broadcast. Metaculus's Admins will determine the outcome, consulting CNN's transcript if needed.
Resolution criteria for (b): This resolves as Yes if Mike Pence is chosen as the Republican nominee by the convention delegates.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if, before August 1, 2024, there is an official statement or credible report of diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China as specified in the Metaculus question.

para_P.title: IF the term deepfake is referenced in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024, and Mike Pence is the chosen Republican candidate, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) "deepfake" is said in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators says "deepfake." Metaculus's Admins will decide if this has occurred, potentially consulting CNN's transcript. If "deepfake" is not clearly uttered, it resolves as **No**.

(b) This resolves as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(c) This resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, the Philippines or the PRC expels or recalls a diplomat from the other country, according to official statements or credible reports. If no such reports exist by that date, it resolves as **No."

para_P.title: Is it guaranteed that the following will take place: (a) the term "deepfake" is mentioned during the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) there are diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as **Yes** if during the airing of the presidential debate conducted by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators mentions the term "deepfake." The decision will be made by Metaculus's Admins, who may refer to CNN's transcript. If the term "deepfake" is not distinctly spoken, it will be marked as **No**.

(b) This will be marked as **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(c) This will be marked as **Yes** if, before August 1, 2024, either the Philippines or the PRC expels or recalls a diplomat from the other nation, based on official announcements or reliable reports. If there are no such reports by that date, it will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Conditional on at least 30% of Manifold respondents agreeing that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. These polls ask "has weak AGI been achieved," allowing respondents to vote based on their own understanding without a specific definition. The goal is to characterize AI progress broadly.

The poll results from previous months have shown a steady increase in the percentage of respondents agreeing that weak AGI has been achieved, with the latest results being 15% and 27% in the respective months.

The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of respondents in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI has been achieved. Then is it true that the Crimean Bridge will be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?

This question about the Crimean Bridge will resolve as YES if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

If not, it will be answered NO.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

- For (a), the market resolves to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3.
- For (b), the market resolves to YES if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- The question resolves as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

para_P.title: Is Linda Yaccarino set to hold the position of CEO at Twitter by July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino occupies the role of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official statements from Twitter or reliable media outlets.

question.title: Given Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is met if Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as CEO on July 1, 2024.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.
- If no such announcement is made by the deadline, the outcome resolves as **No**.
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Linda Yaccarino holds the role of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden declare his refusal of the Democratic Party's nomination for President prior to July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider this scenario: Linda Yaccarino is officially recognized as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on announcements from Twitter or reliable news outlets. In that case, will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for resolution:
- The condition is satisfied if Linda Yaccarino is verified as CEO on July 1, 2024.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than an unspecified Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both set to close on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a non-specific Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in similar hypotheticals is either leading or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader public sentiment?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

These polls and the associated question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until their designated closing time.

question.title: Conditional on Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.
Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: If Trump secures a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat, will Rishi Sunak not succeed in being elected during the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold have been released, both concluding on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes with Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, and the other asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump by a margin outside the error range, while other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public opinion?

This market will resolve to YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer will be YES if the result of the first poll's formula minus the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

These polls and this question will not resolve to N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

Criteria for resolution: This question will be marked as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not get elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024. Conversely, if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. The resolution should reference reliable media sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is contesting in any constituency).

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% against Biden among Manifold respondents and Sunak fails in 2024, will Trump be blocked from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents; (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election.

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? 

This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: If Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support than Biden among Manifold respondents and Sunak does not succeed in 2024, will Trump be prohibited from appearing on any primary ballot according to the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Imagine the following situation: (a) Against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, Trump secures at least 3% more support from Manifold respondents; (b) Rishi Sunak does not achieve election in the 2024 UK General Election.

(a) Two Manifold polls will be conducted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to choose between Joe Biden and a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to select a generic Democrat.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically tested is either leading or close within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents a true reflection of the general populace?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump’s vote percentage in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation for Trump’s vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, it is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will remain active until the closing time regardless of circumstances.

(b) This inquiry resolves as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election for any reason.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

Resolution must refer to [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports or an official declaration from the returning officer for the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

Then, will it be confirmed that Donald Trump will be barred or prevented from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or prevented from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or prevention must be validated through official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or credible media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur *after* the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry resolves negatively.
