question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. Then, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Donald Trump has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

para_P.title: If Trump's margin over Biden is more than 3 but at most 4 on July 15, 2024, will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 3 and at most 4 according to 538's national polling average. Will Joe Biden be projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024?

Criteria for assessing the condition: This is determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, which was reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is projected to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Donald Trump is projected to have a higher chance. If Biden and Trump are seen as equally likely to win, it resolves 50-50. The source for resolution is FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, and 538 projecting Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is according to the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024, and will resolve when the July 20 datapoints become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Given these conditions, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

para_P.title: Assuming Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, and 538 indicates Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, will Nigel Farage secure a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
Consider the following scenarios:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election by a margin that exceeds 3 and does not surpass 4. This is based on the data available for that date, which was checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure denotes a lead for Trump.

2. According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. This is determined by the blue and red trend lines for that date, and will be confirmed when the data points for July 20 are released. If data points for July 19 are not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the outcome will be based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

With these conditions in mind, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election scheduled for July 4, 2024? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: This question will be marked as **Yes** if Nigel Farage is elected as an MP for any UK constituency during the general election on July 4, 2024. It will be marked as **No** if he is not elected, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. The resolution should reference reliable media sources such as the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other significant UK news outlets; or the official statement from the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage stands as a candidate. It is not necessary for Farage to take the oath as an MP for the question to be resolved as **Yes** -- the resolution depends solely on whether he is elected or not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and 538 will project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024; (2) Nigel Farage will be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves to "Yes" only if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is according to the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. Additionally, Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024, and will resolve when the July 20 datapoints become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as "No" if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be annulled. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as "Yes" -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve to "Yes." If either condition is not met, this question resolves to "No."

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to the national polling average from 538, and on July 19, 2024, 538 will indicate Biden as the frontrunner; (2) Nigel Farage will secure a position as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" only if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 3 and at most 4. This information is based on the data for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive lead signifies that Trump is ahead. Additionally, Joe Biden must have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This will be determined based on the metrics shown by the blue and red trend lines for that date, and will finalize once the data points for July 20 are released. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will refer to the closest previous data to July 19.

2. In the UK general election on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage must be elected as a member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. If this does not happen, the question will resolve to "No", unless the general election is either cancelled or postponed past July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be invalidated. The resolution should reference reliable media coverage from sources like the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other prominent UK news outlets; or the official declaration from the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage is a contestant. It is not necessary for Farage to take the oath as an MP for the question to resolve as "Yes" -- this question is determined solely based on his election or non-election.

Both conditions must be fulfilled for this question to yield a "Yes" response. If either condition fails to be met, the question will resolve to "No."

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will withdraw prior to 7/13?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or become otherwise incapable of pursuing his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Given that Biden drops out before 7/13, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his run as president before the specified time for this condition to be true.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes. This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws prior to 7/13, will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his presidential campaign before midnight July 13 Central Time. In that case, will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Criteria for the condition's resolution: Biden must withdraw or be unable to continue his presidential campaign before the specified deadline for this condition to be considered true.
Criteria for the outcome's resolution: Resolves as Yes if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two parties have an equal number of seats, both will resolve as Yes. This determination is based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before 7/13 and GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, and (2) GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or be tied for the most seats. Then, will Joe Biden still be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024? Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president at that time, and NO otherwise. If both conditions are not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Biden exits the race prior to 7/13 and GUE/NGL secures the largest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Joe Biden remain in office by the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: Let us consider the following scenario: (1) Biden will withdraw or be unable to pursue his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time, and (2) GUE/NGL will possess the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or will be tied for the highest. Given these conditions, will Joe Biden still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024? The criteria for resolution: Resolves to YES if Joe Biden is still the official president at that moment, and NO if he is not. If either of the conditions is not satisfied, it resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will Joe Biden drop out before July 13, GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: (1) Joe Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. (2) GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or be tied for the most seats. (3) Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. All three conditions must be met for this to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will withdraw from the presidential race before July 13, that GUE/NGL will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and that Joe Biden will remain in office as president by the end of July?
para_P.body: (1) Joe Biden will either withdraw or be otherwise unable to pursue his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time. (2) GUE/NGL will have the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or will be tied for the highest number of seats. (3) Joe Biden will still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. All three criteria must be satisfied for this to be answered with YES.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion captured on video for over 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest relevant interview was Biden's guest appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden takes part in another such face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will conclude with a NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town hall meetings, etc. It may include guest spots on podcasts or late-night talk shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video could potentially showcase only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus not counting. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have all contained under 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Conditional on Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Resolution criterion for the condition: If Biden appears in such an interview, this resolves YES; if not, it resolves NO.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: On June 1, 2024, the ISW map must show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control for this to resolve YES. If these coordinates are not under Russian control, it resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Biden participates in a 45-minute or longer in-person filmed interview before the end of July 2024, will Chasiv Yar be under Russian control on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden engages in an in-person filmed discussion or interview lasting no less than 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town hall meetings. It may include guest appearances on a podcast or late-night television show, or an interview included in a program like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Condition for resolution: If Biden is featured in such an interview, it resolves to YES; if he is not, it resolves to NO.

Condition for outcome: On June 1, 2024, the ISW map must indicate that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are under the control of Russia for this to resolve to YES. If those coordinates are not under Russian control, it resolves to NO.

If the condition is not fulfilled, the question resolves to N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024 and Russia controlling Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will he announce not accepting the Democratic nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be similar to Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes. The criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden participates in a 45-minute or longer face-to-face interview before the conclusion of July 2024 and that Russia has control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will he declare that he will not accept the Democratic nomination?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following conditions: 
1. Joe Biden engages in an in-person interview or on-camera discussion lasting no less than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This interview must resemble Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. The outlined criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, containing at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an interview setting.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as falling under any classifications that signify Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other designations indicating Russian dominance.

Given these stipulations, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party? This will be considered a YES if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, (2) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be similar to Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes. The criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

3. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If all three conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If any condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (1) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, (2) Russia secures control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if each of the conditions listed below is satisfied:

1. Joe Biden engages in a direct interview or conversation on camera for a minimum of 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. The interview should resemble Biden's participation on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. The criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, featuring at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as categorized under any classifications showing Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other classifications indicating Russian dominance.

3. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news that they believe Biden's chances for a November victory are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will conclude with a YES if a group of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter, as mentioned above, or it could involve a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's conclusion. In cases of ambiguity where such names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Conditional on a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressuring Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If a coalition of at least five identifiable Democratic House Members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two secure-seat members have already called for Biden's withdrawal publicly. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have stated to local news outlets that they have given up on Biden's chances for November.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters making the rounds among House Democrats, and at least one is expected to urge Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will be considered YES if a coalition of at least five identifiable Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden and collectively asking him to step down.

This market necessitates that all five individuals are part of the same collective message. Five individuals independently indicating to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES determination.

Any reports of an unspecified number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are mentioned but not verified beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as YES if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible reports suggest that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's territory, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

If the condition is not fulfilled, it resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both (a) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

(b) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Then, given the above, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: If at least five named Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and if Israel conducts a lethal operation within Iran before May 1, 2024, will there be 10 or more Democratic Senators advocating for Biden's withdrawal before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (a) A coalition of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party members from the US House of Representatives or US Senators collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate discontinuing his 2024 presidential campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, ahead of Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could manifest through a signed letter or a group meeting with Biden where they collectively request his departure from the race. It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective appeal. Merely five individuals independently expressing to reporters their belief that Biden should exit is inadequate. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and imploring him to step aside will not be sufficient unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly prior to the deadline. Ambiguous scenarios will default to a NO outcome. If these stipulations are not fulfilled before July 20th, this part will also result in a NO.

(b) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible information suggests that an operation attributed to Israel, taking place within Iran's territory, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

Given the aforementioned, will 10 or more Democratic Senators advocate for Biden's withdrawal before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time, it is confirmed that there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

(b) This question resolves YES if, at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, as reported by the New York Times interactive 2024 US elections page.

(c) This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for all of the following to take place: (a) A coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, 2024, (b) At least 10 Democratic Senators will demand Biden's exit before July 20, 2024, and (c) Israel will execute a lethal strike within Iran's territory before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be marked YES if a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be accomplished through a signed letter or another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same collective communication. Five individuals independently expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient. Reports of any unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and urging him to step aside will not be adequate unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the deadline. Unclear situations will tend to resolve NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this aspect will resolve NO.

(b) This question will be marked YES if, at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it is reported that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down, as indicated by the New York Times interactive 2024 US elections page.

(c) This question will be marked YES if, after the date of the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible information emerges suggesting that an attack credited to Israel and taking place within Iran's borders has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia possess Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the site



The inquiry will conclude as **No** if the site is not evaluated to be in any of the classifications denoting Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activity

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the site or an absence of Russian control of the site.

question.title: Conditional on Russia having control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024. This is determined by the ISW map showing the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control, such as 'Assessed Russian Control' or similar. Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on the seasonally adjusted Core CPI data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the exact value.

para_P.title: Assuming Russia maintains authority over Chasiv Yar as of June 1, 2024, will the US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body: Let's consider this scenario: Russia is in control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024. This determination is made using the ISW map that shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories that indicate Russian dominance, such as 'Assessed Russian Control' or similar terms. In this case, will the US Core CPI for July 2024 show an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to June 2024? The outcome will be determined based on the seasonally adjusted Core CPI data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, utilizing the precise value.

question.title: Given Russia controls Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control, and (b) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

Given these conditions, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If Russia maintains control over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, and the US Core CPI rises more than 0.1% in July 2024, will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) As of June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are under Russian authority, and (b) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase exceeding 0.1% compared to June 2024.

Under these circumstances, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not included.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

(b) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will take place: (a) Russia controls Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rises by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered as **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other classifications created by ISW that signify Russian control of the area

The question will be answered as **No** if the location is not classified in any of the categories indicating Russian control, including but not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other classifications created by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control of the area

(b) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The resolution data will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is OpenAI's ChatGPT expected to be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Widely accessible" means that the normal condition for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (potentially requiring a payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or not available to certain groups (like minors), the answer will still be affirmative, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. The answer remains affirmative if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT being generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, will Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it), and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, still resolving positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, will Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024? This resolves based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

para_P.title: Assuming OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024, will Jonas Vingegaard be the champion of the Tour de France 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: OpenAI's ChatGPT is broadly accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Broadly accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is to access it without using a VPN (which may involve a fee), and that more than 50% of the population is able to utilize it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, still determining positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same.

In that case, will Jonas Vingegaard be recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024? This will be determined based on the cyclist who is officially acknowledged as the victor of the Tour de France 2024, according to the official results published on the Tour de France website or other reliable sources.

question.title: Given that both OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring payment), with availability to at least >50% of the population, and (b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024 based on official results published on credible sources. Given these conditions, will the S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats, or ties for the most seats, after the elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. Resolves as **No** otherwise.

para_P.title: If OpenAI's ChatGPT is available to the public in the EU starting June 30, 2024, and Jonas Vingegaard is declared the winner of the Tour de France 2024, will the S&D party secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body: Assuming the following statements are accurate: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be generally accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning that most individuals in the EU can use it without needing a VPN (possibly with a fee), and it will be available to over 50% of the population, and (b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially acknowledged as the winner of the Tour de France 2024 as per official results from reputable sources. Under these circumstances, will the S&D party hold the greatest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This will be considered **Yes** if the S&D has the highest number of seats or ties for the highest number after the elections, according to official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media outlets. It will be **No** in all other cases.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, (b) Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024, and (c) S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(c) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

The question resolves as **NO** if any of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it guaranteed that the following will happen: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024, (b) Jonas Vingegaard is declared the champion of the Tour de France 2024, and (c) S&D secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if all of these conditions are satisfied:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without a VPN (potentially with a payment requirement). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was the scenario in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to (for instance) minors, it will still be considered positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. The term "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially acknowledged as the victor of the Tour de France 2024, according to official results released on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(c) The S&D holds the greatest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will be answered with **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and will be **No** for all other political factions. If two parties are tied for seats, both will be considered **Yes**. This question will be resolved based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media reports.

The question will be answered with **NO** if any of these conditions are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democrats will need a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is needed, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: If Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between a brokered convention and Democratic Senators' support for Biden.

Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the condition: If more than one ballot is required, this condition is **Yes**; if only one ballot is required, this condition is **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this question resolves to **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves to **No**.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Should there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024, will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between a brokered convention and the backing of Democratic Senators for Biden.

Assuming the following holds true: The Democratic Party must engage in multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the presidential election in the US for 2024.

Criteria for determining the condition: If more than one ballot is necessary, this condition is **Yes**; if only a single ballot is needed, this condition is **No**.

Criteria for determining the outcome: If at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the New York Times indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are advocating for Biden to step aside, this question will resolve to **Yes**. If not, it will resolve to **No**.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question will resolve as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both a brokered Democratic convention and 10+ Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, and (b) at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Given these conditions, will Vivek Ramaswamy be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- (a) Occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting to nominate its candidate.
- (b) Occurs if 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 as shown by the New York Times interactive.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Given a brokered Democratic convention and 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to withdraw, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican candidate for 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds: (a) The Democratic Party needs multiple voting rounds in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 presidential election, and (b) before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are advocating for Biden to step aside.

Under these circumstances, will Vivek Ramaswamy be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Criteria for the condition: 
- (a) This is met if the Democratic Party requires more than one voting round to select its candidate.
- (b) This is met if 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to withdraw before July 20, as shown by the New York Times interactive.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to YES if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves to NO if not. If the condition is unmet, resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, and (c) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: This occurs if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it does not occur.

(c) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will happen: (a) there will be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024, (b) at least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, and (c) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024 occurs if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is needed, then this does not take place.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urging Biden to withdraw before July 20 happens if, at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down. If not, it does not happen.

(c) Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election will be confirmed as **Yes** if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 13, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his presidential run before midnight July 13 Central Time for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democrats will need a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Democrats having a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Assuming that Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024, will a minimum of 20 Democratic representatives in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden virtually at an early stage?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following situation: The Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 presidential election in the United States. In that case, will a minimum of 20 Democratic representatives in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden at an early stage?

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice opposition against their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially scheduled, which they believe suppresses the ongoing vigorous discussion about his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and distributed by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria: This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, it will resolve to NO.
