Criteria for determining this condition: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Now, is it correct that the value of one ounce of silver will be greater than $30.50 (USD) at precisely 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9, 2024, according to the live ticker price per ounce published on Kitco.com?

Criteria for determining this outcome: The market will be marked as YES if the price is above $30.50 USD. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or lower, the market will be marked as NO.

question.title: Conditional on both Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August 2024 and Silver closing above $30.50 on August 9, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, meaning the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President. This must occur before August 2024 (Eastern time), and the duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. (b) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. The price must be strictly above $30.50 USD, not exactly $30.50 or below.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question resolves as YES if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before this deadline that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Assuming both that Biden is declared unable to fulfill his duties under the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 and that the price of silver exceeds $30.50 on August 9, 2024, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Consider the following scenario: (a) Joe Biden is officially declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, which entails that the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) formally asserts that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office," resulting in the Vice President acting as President. This declaration must take place before August 2024 (Eastern time), and the length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included, nor is Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment. (b) The market price for 1 ounce of silver is higher than $30.50 (USD) at precisely 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as indicated by the live ticker price per ounce on Kitco.com. The price must be strictly greater than $30.50 USD, not exactly $30.50 or lower.

Under these stipulations, will Joe Biden make an announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This inquiry will resolve as YES if Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before this deadline indicating that he will not seek and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made before the deadline, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (2) the Silver Close above $30.50 at 4pm on August 9th, 2024, and (3) Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) Resolves YES if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024. The price will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below at that time, the resolution is NO. The question is specific to the price being ABOVE $30.50 USD.

(3) Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following will happen: (1) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, (2) the price of silver exceeds $30.50 at 4pm on August 9, 2024, and (3) Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(1) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(2) Resolves YES if the value of 1 ounce of silver is higher than $30.50 (USD) at precisely 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9, 2024. The price will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or lower at that moment, the resolution is NO. The question specifically pertains to the price being ABOVE $30.50 USD.

(3) Resolves YES if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek nor will he accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden going to remain president until the conclusion of July?

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden being president at the end of July 2024 and the Democratic Nominee being a woman, will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores two separate geopolitical events and their potential overlap. Suppose the following is true: At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially the president of the United States, and the Democratic delegates have selected a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves 'yes' if South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024, based on credible reports. Resolves 'no' otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden remains president at the conclusion of July 2024 and the Democratic nominee is a woman, will South Africa choose a president prior to July 1, 2024?

question.body: This question will resolve as 'yes' if all of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States, and the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (2) The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources. It will resolve as 'no' if any of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Will both of these events take place: (a) Joe Biden remains in office as president by the conclusion of July 2024 and a woman is chosen as the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee, (b) South Africa will have a presidential election prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered 'yes' if all of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States, and the Democratic delegates nominate a woman for the presidential candidacy in the 2024 election. (2) The president of South Africa is officially elected by the National Assembly before July 1, 2024, based on information from reliable sources. It will be deemed 'no' if any of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: In the event that Biden withdraws or is unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: If Biden drops out before July 20, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close below $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close below $100 per share on any day before 7/31? Resolution criteria: For the condition, Biden must drop out or be unable to continue before July 20. For the outcome, NVDA must close below $100 on any day before 7/31.

para_P.title: Should Biden exit the race prior to July 20, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) finish below $100 per share by the end of July?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario holds: Joe Biden exits or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before the stroke of midnight on July 20 Eastern Time. In that case, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) have a closing price below $100 per share on any day leading up to 7/31? Criteria for resolution: Biden must exit or be unable to continue before July 20 for the condition, and NVDA must close below $100 at least once on any day before 7/31 for the outcome.

question.title: Conditional on both Biden dropping out before July 20 and Nvidia closing below $100 by July 31, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by July 15?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 on any day before July 31. Given these conditions, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link provided has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Assuming both Biden exits the race prior to July 20 and Nvidia finishes below $100 by July 31, will the associated market attract a minimum of 377 participants by July 15?
para_P.body:
Let us consider these conditions to be valid: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, and (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes at a price lower than $100 on any day leading up to July 31. Under these circumstances, will the associated market attract at least 377 participants by the close of July 15?

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if the market linked in the provided reference has 377 participants before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share by 7/31, and (c) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body: (a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. (b) This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31. (c) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

para_P.title: Is it certain that all of the following will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) finishes below $100 per share by July 31, and (c) the specified market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15?
para_P.body: (a) This market will conclude with a yes if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. (b) A YES resolution occurs if NVDA's closing price falls below $100 on any day before July 31. (c) The resolution will be YES if the market mentioned above has at least 377 traders before the market closes on July 15 at 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Otherwise, it resolves to NO. (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Republican Party to keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly held by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if reliable sources indicate that an individual affiliated with the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources conflict, an Ohio State source or official statement will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: If the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Kamala Harris be president by Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? This will resolve as Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before the specified time. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with credible reporting as a secondary source.

para_P.title: Should the Republican Party hold onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Kamala Harris be recognized as president by Friday?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Republican Party maintains control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This will be considered a Yes if reliable sources confirm that a Republican Party candidate has secured victory in the special election for OH's 6th district. In case of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official statement or source from Ohio will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be nullified.

Then, can we affirm that Kamala Harris will be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? This will be marked as Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially acknowledged as President or Acting President of the United States before the designated deadline. The main source for resolution will be official US government information, with credible news reporting as a secondary reference.

question.title: Given the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th district and Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used if popular sources disagree, unless no election is held before January 1, 2025, in which case this part is annulled. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary resolution source being official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4? For this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: If the Republican Party secures Ohio's 6th district and Kamala Harris is inaugurated as President or serves as Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (1) A candidate affiliated with the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th district, utilizing Ohio State sources or statements if popular sources conflict, unless no election occurs before January 1, 2025, in which case this condition is voided. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary source of resolution being official US government data or a consensus of reliable reporting.

Then, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, exceed 3 and be less than or equal to 4? In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, (2) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if BOTH of the following occur: (1) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used if popular sources disagree. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary resolution source being official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting. (3) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) The Republican Party keeps Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Kamala Harris is declared President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, (2) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 3 but does not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as Yes if BOTH of the subsequent conditions are satisfied: (1) Reliable sources confirm that an individual from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district, utilizing Ohio State sources or statements if widely accepted sources are at odds. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this segment of the question is rendered void. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the main source of resolution being official US government information or a consensus of trustworthy reporting. (3) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is documented as exceeding 3 and being less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Given another Democratic party presidential debate, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is another Democratic party presidential debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition resolves YES if there is a debate as described. Resolves NO otherwise.
- The outcome resolves YES if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If there is another debate among Democratic presidential candidates, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 3 but is no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A new debate occurs among potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then can we conclude that Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the upcoming presidential election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition resolves to YES if the debate occurs as described. It resolves to NO if it does not. 
- The outcome resolves to YES if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and at most 4 in the 538 national polling average reported on July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. It resolves to NO otherwise.

question.title: If both a Democratic debate occurs and Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for President in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Should a Democratic debate take place and Trump's margin over Biden fall between 3 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz secure the Republican nomination for President in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: (a) There is a debate among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 3 but no greater than 4 as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will Ted Cruz be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be considered YES if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) a Democratic party presidential debate, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(c) Resolves YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will happen: (a) a debate among Democratic party presidential candidates, (b) Trump's advantage over Biden being more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Ted Cruz becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if there is a debate featuring potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

(b) This will be marked as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 3 and is at most 4, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

(c) This will be marked as YES if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be marked as NO. This question is not limited to the candidates listed; additional candidates may be included later.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, will the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this condition, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will the US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden makes a clear and official public statement that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be clear and definitive, with no possibility of Biden accepting the nomination.

Under this premise, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 show an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The determination will rely on the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, and the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? The resolution source for this is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators, the answer is YES. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination, and if the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July 2024, will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions are met: (1) Joe Biden makes a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming election. This statement must be definitive and leave no ambiguity regarding his acceptance of the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, according to the precise value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then, will at least 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024? The source for this resolution is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If it is noted that 10 or more Democratic Senators have made such a call before midnight July 20 Central Time, the answer is YES. If not, it is NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (2) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. (3) If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, then this condition is satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Joe Biden publicly declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, and the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July 2024, and (2) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: Is it the case that all of the following will take place: (1) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden makes an official and clear announcement stating that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election. This statement must be unmistakable, public, and final, with no indication that Biden might accept the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024, based on the exact (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. (3) If, at any time before midnight Central Time on July 20, the website https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down, then this condition will be fulfilled.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden dying before Saturday, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, as officially announced. 

Then, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden passes away before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, as officially reported. 

Then, will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's passing before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves to NO.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if, during the World Health Assembly in May 2024, the Pandemic Agreement is approved by a vote, according to reports from reliable sources.

question.title: Given Joe Biden dies before Saturday AND the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions: 

1. Joe Biden dies before Saturday, with an official announcement of his death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.
2. The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, according to credible sources.

Given these conditions, will Biden drop out or otherwise be unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time? If he does, this resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday and the Pandemic Agreement receives approval during the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will he withdraw from the presidential race before July 13?
para_P.body:
Take into account these factors: 

1. Joe Biden passes away before Saturday, with a formal announcement of his death made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th.
2. The Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, based on reliable sources.

In light of these factors, will Biden withdraw or be unable to proceed with his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time? If he does, the answer is YES. If not, the answer is NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, and (c) Biden drops out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

para_P.title: Was there a deliberate shooting at Trump on July 13th?
para_P.body:
According to the NYT: "The sounds that interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania resembled gunfire. Trump was quickly taken off the stage and seemed to be bleeding from his ear."

This will be considered YES if an individual aimed and fired a bullet or similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. It will be NO if the incident was due to an accidental discharge or a ricochet that directed something towards Trump.

*The term bullet-like projectile refers to any object that functions similarly to a bullet, even if it does not meet the technical definition of a bullet. For instance, a BB gun pellet would not qualify as it is not likely to be lethal like a bullet.

If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Are Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson both set to be the Republican candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election, with Kamala Harris as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson are chosen by the Republican National Convention as candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the outcome will be **No**.

Regarding the first criterion, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is only based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

As for the second criterion, if Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, this market will resolve to yes. If a different individual is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately following the nomination.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure signifies a Trump advantage, while a negative figure indicates that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points. This is determined by accessing the chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET? The four weeks are based on CDC's epidemiological weeks. The rate used is for all ages, races, and sexes, and the season is from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024. Data is considered after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 in the US take place within a month of the highest combined rates for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead of more than 2 and up to 3 points over Joe Biden according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is verified by reviewing the chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

Then, can we confirm that the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the date when the combined peak for all three is reached, as reported by the CDC's RESP-NET? The four-week period is aligned with the CDC's epidemiological weeks. The rate is calculated for individuals of all ages, races, and genders, with the season spanning from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024. Data is evaluated after the typical reporting delay of four weeks following the end date.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 and hospitalization peaks align, will Ron DeSantis be the 2024 Republican nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
(b) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, according to the CDC's RESP-NET.

Then, will Ron DeSantis be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

para_P.title: With Trump's margin over Biden ranging from 2 to 3 and hospitalization peaks coinciding, is Ron DeSantis set to be the Republican nominee for 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: 
(a) As of July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but at most 3, based on 538's national polling average.
(b) The highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 in the US is expected to occur within four weeks following the peak of COVID, influenza, and RSV for the 2023-24 season, as per the CDC's RESP-NET.

Under these circumstances, will Ron DeSantis be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional options may emerge later.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, (b) the US hospitalization peak occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, and (c) Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3.

(b) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. The 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. The question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following three events will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, (b) the peak of US hospitalizations occurs within four weeks of the highest rates for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, and (c) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The determination of Trump's lead over Biden will be based on Donald Trump's position relative to Joe Biden in the national polling average conducted by 538 for the 2024 presidential election, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates that Trump is ahead, whereas a negative figure shows that Biden is in the lead. The lead must exceed 2 but not surpass 3.

(b) The highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 individuals in the US will be marked as **Yes** if the peak weekly rates for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occur within a maximum of four weeks (28 days) from the date of the collective peak for all three, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The four-week period will be calculated based on the week-ending dates. The statistics will include all ages, races, and genders. The 2023-2024 season will be recognized as starting with the week ending October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending June 1, 2024. The resolution of this question will depend on data available after the usual reporting delay, typically four weeks following the week-ending date.

(c) This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to currently listed candidates; others may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent. It will be solely determined by the selection made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections.  All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024)

para_P.title: Is it possible for the BJP to establish the government after the upcoming Indian general election in 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if a member of the BJP is inaugurated as the next Indian Prime Minister after the forthcoming general elections. Any outcome involving other parties will be answered with **No**.

This question pertains to the next general election scheduled after June 1, 2022 (currently anticipated for May 2024).

question.title: Given BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential impact of BJP forming the government on the volatility of the S&P 500. 

Suppose the following is true: BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, which are expected to occur by May 2024. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023?

The resolution for the volatility index will be based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023 for a 'Yes' resolution.

para_P.title: If the BJP secures power after the upcoming Indian general elections in 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible effects of the BJP taking control on the fluctuations of the S&P 500. 

Assuming the following holds true: a BJP representative is inaugurated as the next Indian Prime Minister after the general elections, which are anticipated to take place by May 2024. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show a rise on July 20, 2024, when compared to July 20, 2023?

The determination for the volatility index will rely on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. For a 'Yes' outcome, the figure for July 20, 2024, must exceed that of July 20, 2023.

question.title: Given both the BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 and the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: 
1. The BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, meaning a BJP member is sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the general elections expected for May 2024. This resolves as **Yes** only if BJP forms the government after the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022.
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: If the BJP successfully establishes a government following the upcoming Indian general election in 2024 and the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index shows an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements hold true: 
1. The BJP successfully establishes a government after the next Indian general election in 2024, which indicates that a BJP member takes the oath as the next Indian Prime Minister after the elections anticipated for May 2024. This condition resolves as **Yes** only if the BJP forms the government after the general elections that take place after June 1, 2022.

Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must take place before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 (c) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024. para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) BJP establishes the government after the upcoming Indian general election in 2024 (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 (c) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) The BJP needs to have one of its members inaugurated as the next Indian Prime Minister following the anticipated general elections in May 2024. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be brought before June 1, 2024. All three conditions (a), (b), and (c) need to be fulfilled for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome Q: The Greens–EFA political group must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: If the price of Silver exceeds $30.50 on August 9, 2024, will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats in the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

In the event of a tie in seats between two groups, both sub-questions will be considered Yes.

question.title: Conditional on both of the following occurring: (a) Silver closes above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, and (b) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president by the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will determine a yes outcome if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden still being president by the end of July, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

Then, will Meta publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden remains president until the end of July, will Meta release a report detailing the findings from an external red-team assessment of their safety models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

In that case, will Meta make available a public report containing the findings from a third-party red-team evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

Criteria for the condition: Resolves to YES if Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.
Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta releases a public report with the findings from an external red-team evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves to NO otherwise. If the condition is not satisfied, resolves to N/A.

question.title: Given Joe Biden is still president by July 31, 2024, and Meta publishes a safety report by June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.
2. By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Given these conditions, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, any of the following occurs according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden remains the president on July 31, 2024, and Meta releases a safety report by June 30, 2024, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: 

1. At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the sitting president of the United States.
2. By June 30, 2024, Meta issues a public report detailing the findings from an external audit assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

Under these circumstances, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?

The outcome will be deemed **Yes** if any of the following occurs before June 1, 2024, based on official announcements or credible sources:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

question.title: GIVEN Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, is Donald Trump removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution Criteria for the Condition (P):
- Kamala Harris needs to be nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the condition is not met. The condition can be resolved immediately after the nomination.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome (Q):
- The question resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.
- This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

para_P.title: IF Kamala Harris serves as the Democratic Vice President, will Donald Trump be disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:

Criteria for Determining the Condition (P):
- Kamala Harris must be chosen as the Democratic Vice President. If another individual is appointed as VP, the condition is not satisfied. The condition can be evaluated immediately after the nomination.

Criteria for Determining the Outcome (Q):
- The inquiry resolves as "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.
- This must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources.
- The inquiry resolves as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. The resolution does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may arise after the specified date.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP and Donald Trump is blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, meaning she is the initial nominee for the Vice President position by the Democratic party, and (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This means that on July 15, 2024, official announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports confirm his removal or blockage, and speculative reports do not count. Given these conditions, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if Trump is charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before the specified date.

Under these circumstances, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This would be answered with **Yes** if Trump is charged regarding any remarks related to possible witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before the aforementioned date.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP, (b) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (c) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this part resolves to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this part resolves to no. The VP nomination is considered based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This part resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been removed or blocked based on official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for subsequent legal changes after this date.

(c) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

For the combined question to resolve as "Yes," all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) must occur as described.

para_P.title: Will the following three events take place: (a) Kamala Harris receives the nomination for Democratic Vice President, (b) Donald Trump is either removed or barred from the primary election ballot for any federal position in any U.S. state according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (c) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President. This condition will be marked as yes if Kamala Harris is indeed the nominee for the Democratic VP role. If a different candidate is chosen for VP, this condition will be marked as no. The evaluation of the VP nomination is based on the initial selection and will not change even if the VP is altered for any reason after the initial choice.

(b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is officially removed or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This condition is satisfied with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, there are official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports confirming his removal or barring. Speculative information or unofficial statements will not be accepted. The resolution is strictly based on the situation as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider any legal developments that may occur afterward.

(c) Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks about potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

For the overall question to be answered with "Yes," all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) must be fulfilled as specified.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made, it resolves as No.

Criteria for resolution: This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive. If such a statement is not issued, it resolves as No.

question.title: If both Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?

Then, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM?

Resolution criteria:
- For (a): Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is selected as the Republican nominee.
- For (b): Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability is >46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability exceeds 46.6% at the specified date and time in Nate Silver's analysis. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.body:
(a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(c) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.
