para_P.body:
(a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President: This question will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

(c) The chances of Kamala winning rise in the next week as per Nate Silver's model: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Should Will Hurd be the Republican nominee, will Vivek Ramaswamy also secure the nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Vivek Ramaswamy also chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for the condition's resolution: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Criteria for the outcome's resolution: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as Republican nominees, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This scenario is highly unlikely as typically only one candidate is selected as the nominee. The resolution criterion for this condition is that both individuals must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is the following true? The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are chosen as the Republican nominees, will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This situation is quite improbable since usually only one candidate is nominated. The criterion for resolving this condition is that both candidates must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, can we affirm the following? The Republican Party maintains its hold on Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) during the 2024 special election. This is considered Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In case of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are chosen as the Republican candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party keeps control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed Yes if both of these conditions are satisfied: (1) The Republican National Convention selects both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based solely on the decisions made by the convention's delegates. (2) Reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was previously held by Bill Johnson. In cases of conflicting reports, an official Ohio State source will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be void.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the head of the Secret Service will step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is there a chance that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will either resign, be dismissed, or cease to hold the position of director for any other reason prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: Conditional on the head of the Secret Service resigning, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds the position before October 12, 2024. 

Then, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?

Every month, a Manifold poll is posted to gather consensus on the progress towards AGI, asking simply "has weak AGI been achieved," without defining the term. Respondents vote based on their understanding. The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: If the head of the Secret Service steps down, will a minimum of 30% of Manifold participants concur that weak AGI was realized prior to July 23, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario is accurate: Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason is no longer in the role before October 12, 2024. 

In that case, will at least 30% of Manifold participants agree that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024?

Each month, a Manifold survey is conducted to assess the consensus on advancements in AGI, simply asking "has weak AGI been achieved," without providing a definition for the term. Participants cast their votes according to their interpretation. The poll in July 2024 will be deemed YES if the proportion of YES/(NO + YES) is 0.3 or higher, disregarding "no opinion" votes. If not, it will be considered NO.

question.title: Given Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (b) at least 30% of Manifold respondents will agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. 

(a) This means Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will have resigned, been fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

(b) The July 2024 poll on Manifold will result in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, indicating that at least 30% of respondents agree weak AGI was achieved, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Assuming Kimberly Cheatle is not the director of the U.S. Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, and that at least 30% of Manifold participants acknowledge the achievement of weak AGI before July 23, 2024, will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following conditions: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will cease to be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (b) at least 30% of Manifold participants will concur that weak AGI was realized prior to July 23, 2024. 

(a) This implies that Kimberly Cheatle, who holds the position of Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will have stepped down, been dismissed, or otherwise no longer serve in that capacity before October 12, 2024.

(b) The poll conducted in July 2024 on Manifold will show a proportion of YES/(NO + YES) that is at least 0.3, signifying that a minimum of 30% of participants agree that weak AGI was achieved, excluding those who express "no opinion." 

Thus, can we conclude that Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be considered TRUE if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, (2) at least 30% of Manifold respondents will agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (3) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(2) Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady. The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly underestimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (1) Kimberly Cheatle will cease to be the director of the U.S. Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, (2) at least 30% of Manifold participants will concur that weak AGI has been realized before July 23, 2024, and (3) Donald Trump will secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, step down, be dismissed, or otherwise no longer hold the position of director before October 12, 2024?

(2) Each month, a poll on Manifold is conducted to capture the collective opinion on advancements towards AGI. Unlike the various markets and inquiries on Manifold, these polls will simply inquire "has weak AGI been realized," without providing a specific definition of the term. The intention is that since the term is quite expansive, the only way to assess AI advancement is to allow participants to vote based on their own interpretations.

Progress has been consistent. The earlier polls are noted here:

The earlier markets concerning this topic, which greatly underestimated Manifold's confidence in AI progress, included:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re

The polls will not refer to any particular model and will not define "AGI" other than to clarify that the poll does not necessitate that the software system be capable of interacting with the physical environment. The polls commence on the 23rd of each month and conclude on the 30th.

This market will determine a YES if the results from the July 2024 poll yield a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) that is equal to or exceeds 0.3. Responses of "no opinion" will be disregarded. If not, this question will result in a NO.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Rankings at the 2024 Paris Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the US Olympic Team stands as the (sole) highest ranked team during the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be deemed uncertain if the Paris Olympics are not conducted before 2027. It will be regarded as negative if any other team achieves a ranking that is equal to or surpasses that of the US team.

The medal rankings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and arranging them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Conditional on the USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two sporting events:

1. **Condition:** The USA must top the Olympic Medal Table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This occurs if the United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team based on the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals. If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, the condition resolves ambiguously.

2. **Outcome:** Resolves YES if the American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game.

The question asks: If the USA is the top-ranked team at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game?

para_P.title: If the USA leads the Olympic Medal Count at Paris 2024, will the American League Team emerge victorious in the MLB All Star Game?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between two athletic competitions:

1. **Prerequisite:** The USA must lead the Olympic Medal Count at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This is established if the United States Olympic Team is the (singular) highest positioned team based on the total gold, silver, and bronze medals won. Should the Paris Olympics not occur before 2027, the prerequisite remains uncertain.

2. **Result:** Concludes with YES if the American League Team prevails in the MLB All Star Game.

The inquiry is: Should the USA be the leading team at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game?

question.title: Given the USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 AND the American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game, will the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, calculated by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals in that order, and (2) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game. Given these conditions, will the Milwaukee Bucks be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA? The question resolves as **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as **No** if any other team wins or if the Bucks are eliminated from contention. If either of the initial conditions is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the USA leads the Olympic Medal Count at the Paris 2024 Games AND the American League Team secures victory in the MLB All Star Game, will the Milwaukee Bucks emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (1) The Olympic Team of the United States stands as the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, determined by the tally of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals in that sequence, and (2) The American League Team triumphs in the MLB All Star Game. Under these circumstances, will the Milwaukee Bucks be declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA? The answer is **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals. It is **No** if another team wins or if the Bucks are eliminated from the playoffs. If either of the initial conditions is not satisfied, the answer is N/A.

question.title: Will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game, AND the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if ALL of the following occur: (1) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. (2) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game. (3) The Milwaukee Bucks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

The question resolves negatively if any of these conditions fail.

para_P.title: Will the USA lead the Olympic Medal Count at Paris 2024, the American League Team secure victory in the MLB All Star Game, AND the Milwaukee Bucks claim the 2024 NBA Championship?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if ALL of the following conditions are met: (1) The United States Olympic Team is the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are determined by tallying all medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Number of Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Number of Bronze Medals. It will be deemed ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will be answered negatively if any team achieves a ranking that is equal to or exceeds that of the US team. (2) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game. (3) The Milwaukee Bucks are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

The question will be answered negatively if any of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Conditional on the linked market getting at least 377 traders by end of July 15, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:

Given this, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023?

para_P.title: If the linked market achieves a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be greater Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
