question.title: Given both the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, 2023, and the VXVCLS is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) The linked market gets at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2023, and (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, as reported by the St. Louis Fed.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The linked market resolves YES if it has 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2023. The VXVCLS question resolves YES if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes an unambiguous and conclusive statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If the linked market has a minimum of 377 traders by July 15, 2023, and the VXVCLS shows an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (1) The linked market achieves at least 377 traders prior to the market close on July 15, 2023, and (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is reported to be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed.

Under these circumstances, will Joe Biden or his campaign issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election?

Criteria for the condition's resolution: The linked market is deemed to resolve YES if it has 377 traders before the market closes on July 15, 2023. The VXVCLS question resolves YES if the figure reported on July 20, 2024, exceeds that of July 20, 2023.

Criteria for the outcome's resolution: Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes a clear and definitive announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(1) The linked market will resolve YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 2023, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. The link to the market is: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

(2) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve YES if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will happen: (1) the linked market will have a minimum of 377 traders by the close of July 15, 2023, (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be greater than it was year-over-year on July 20, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(1) The linked market will resolve as YES if it reaches 377 traders before the market closes on July 15, 2023, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time. It will resolve as NO if it does not. The link to the market is: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

(2) The inquiry regarding the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve as YES if the figure reported on July 20, 2024, is higher than the figure reported on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed's reporting: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(3) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official public announcement stating that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Will the Miami Heat emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
The resolution will be **Yes** if the Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It will be **No** if another team is declared champion or if the Miami Heat is removed from the competition.

question.title: Conditional on the Miami Heat winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA. Then, will the USD/JPY exchange rate be at least 145 JPY per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The Miami Heat must win the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves NO if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The exchange rate must be at least 145 JPY per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming the Miami Heat secures victory in the 2024 NBA Finals, will the value of USD reach or exceed 145 JPY by the end of trading on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: The Miami Heat is declared the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals as recognized by the NBA. Under these circumstances, will the USD/JPY exchange rate be no less than 145 JPY for each USD at the end of trading on August 9th, 2024?

Criteria for the condition to be satisfied: The Miami Heat must be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. The answer will be NO if any other team wins the championship or if the Miami Heat is no longer in the running.

Criteria for the outcome: The exchange rate must be at a minimum of 145 JPY per USD at the end of trading on August 9th, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance. If the condition is not fulfilled, the result is N/A.

question.title: Given that the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals and USD is worth >= 145 JPY on August 9th, 2024, will BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA.
2. The USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 is greater than or equal to 145 JPY, according to Yahoo! Finance.

Then, is it true that the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

para_P.title: If the Miami Heat are the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals and the USD is valued at 145 JPY or more on August 9, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX finish between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: 
1. The Miami Heat are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA.
2. The USD/JPY closing rate on August 9, 2024, is at least 145 JPY as per Yahoo! Finance.

Then, is it correct that the BSE SENSEX's closing figure on July 21, 2024, will be above 75,000 and at or below 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The Miami Heat wins the 2024 NBA Finals, (2) USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, and (3) BSE SENSEX closes > 75k and <= 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if all of the following occur: (1) The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) The USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 is greater than or equal to 145 JPY, according to Yahoo! Finance. (3) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

It resolves **No** if any of the above conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (1) The Miami Heat secures victory in the 2024 NBA Finals, (2) The USD reaches a value of at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9, 2024, and (3) The BSE SENSEX finishes between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if all of the following conditions are satisfied: (1) The Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) The USD/JPY closing rate for August 9, 2024, is equal to or exceeds 145 JPY, according to Yahoo! Finance. (3) The closing figure for the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is above 75,000 and at most 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

It will resolve to **No** if any of these conditions are not fulfilled.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the BSE SENSEX's closing price on July 21, 2024, exceed 76,000 but not surpass 77,000?
para_P.body: This inquiry is determined by the closing price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions: 

1. The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

2. The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) must invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Suppose the BSE SENSEX condition is met. Then, will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked as described before August 2024?

para_P.title: Assuming the BSE SENSEX finishes between 76,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be utilized to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This inquiry involves two prerequisites: 

1. The closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be above 76,000 and at most 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

2. The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent group) must activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

If the condition regarding the BSE SENSEX is satisfied, will the invocation of the 25th Amendment Section 4 occur as outlined before August 2024?

question.title: Given both (a) BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true:

(a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
(b) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given these conditions, will Vivek Ramaswamy be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as YES if he is selected, and NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX closes between 76,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, and Biden is declared unable to perform his presidential duties under the 25th Amendment prior to August, is it true that Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true:

(a) The closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is more than 76,000 but less than or equal to 77,000, based on Yahoo Finance data.
(b) Prior to August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office," leading to the Vice President acting as President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Under these circumstances, will Vivek Ramaswamy be chosen as the Republican nominee by the National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will be answered with YES if he is chosen, and NO if he is not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August? (c) Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (a) Will the BSE SENSEX close between 76,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024? (b) Will Biden be officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August? (c) Will Vivek Ramaswamy secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

(b) This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not counted.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other candidates may emerge in the future.

For this question, it is not important who is nominated by the Republican Party on election day in 2024; it is determined solely by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two independent events:

1. **Condition:** The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. This resolves to Yes if the number of Gold medals is greater than the number of Silver medals.

2. **Outcome:** Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves to Yes if Donald Trump is chosen as the nominee.

Suppose the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Then, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

para_P.title: If the USA secures a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Donald Trump be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry investigates the connection between two separate occurrences:

1. **Condition:** The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. This is affirmed if the tally of Gold medals exceeds that of Silver medals.

2. **Outcome:** Donald Trump is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is affirmed if Donald Trump is selected as the nominee.

Assuming the USA attains more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Donald Trump be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics and Donald Trump being the Republican nominee, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if both (1) and (2) are true. If either or both are not met, the condition is false.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the categories indicating Russian control. It resolves as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

para_P.title: If the USA secures a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver at the Paris 2024 Olympics and Donald Trump is the Republican candidate, will Russia have dominion over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: (1) The United States Olympic Team achieves more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (2) Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Under these circumstances, will Russia possess control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Criteria for the condition to be satisfied: The condition is fulfilled if both (1) and (2) are true. If either or both are false, the condition does not hold.

Criteria for the outcome: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as belonging to any of the categories that signify Russian control. It will be marked as **No** if the location is not classified under any of the categories that denote Russian control.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (3) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves No.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will happen: (a) the USA secures a greater number of Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, (b) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) Russia maintains control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if all of these criteria are fulfilled: (1) The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (2) The Republican National Convention nominates Donald Trump as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (3) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any classifications denoting Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area. If any of these conditions are not satisfied, this question will be answered with No.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, is it true that Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No otherwise. The nomination is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but no more than 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, will Tucker Carlson be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538. This is established by the lead that Donald Trump has over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

Then, can it be confirmed that Tucker Carlson will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is answered with Yes if Tucker Carlson is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No if he is not. The nomination is determined exclusively by the choices made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points and Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee, will 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Given these conditions, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For this to resolve YES, the group must collectively ask Biden to drop out, such as by signing a letter or speaking with him in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Separate individual statements do not count. Unnamed sources are insufficient unless at least 5 names are confirmed publicly before the end date. If these criteria are not met by July 20th, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: With Trump's advantage over Biden ranging from 2 to 3 points and Tucker Carlson being the Republican candidate, will at least 5 Democratic House Members or Senators compel Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 and up to 3 points based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Tucker Carlson has been chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Under these circumstances, will a minimum of five specific Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For this to be considered a YES, the group must jointly appeal to Biden to resign, for instance, by endorsing a letter or having a face-to-face discussion with him. All five members must be part of the same collective communication. Individual statements made separately do not qualify. Anonymous sources are not adequate unless at least 5 individuals are publicly identified before the deadline. If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(3) This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will happen: (1) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, (2) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) a coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators pressurize Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will conclude as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purpose of this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(2) This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being chosen will resolve as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other options may emerge in the future. For this inquiry, it does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(3) This market resolves YES if a collective of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be through signing a letter as reported above, but it could also manifest in another format such as a group conversing with Biden in person and collectively urging him to withdraw.

This market mandates that all five individuals be part of the same group communication. Five individuals separately informing reporters they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are subsequently made public before this market's closing date. In any ambiguous situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO. 

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This is affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

Background: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

Then, is it true that credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels?

para_P.title: Should Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment for Biden's removal from office.

Then, can it be confirmed that reliable sources indicate Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels?

question.title: Conditional on Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment and Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will the governor of Gagauzia travel to Russia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial concerning payments to Stormy Daniels. 
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. 
(b) Resolves YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Then, is it true that the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, will travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

para_P.title: If Biden is found incapacitated under the 25th Amendment and Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will the governor of Gagauzia visit Russia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (a) Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, and (b) Donald Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial regarding payments made to Stormy Daniels. 
(a) This will be considered TRUE if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable. 
(b) This will be considered TRUE if reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Therefore, is it accurate to say that the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, will make a trip to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024? This question will be marked as **Yes** if, following April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources indicate that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory during that timeframe.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial, and (c) Evghenia Guțul travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Resolves YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(c) Resolves YES if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following events will take place: (a) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, (b) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, and (c) Evghenia Guțul visits the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not considered. Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Resolves YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(c) Resolves YES if, following April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources confirm that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory during that timeframe.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident happening in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the answer will be negative if the aforementioned situation does not occur.

An incident will qualify as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any official entity of the State of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: If a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that Asa Hutchinson will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Should a terrorist incident take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Asa Hutchinson be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario holds: A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics that results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The occurrence must be labeled as a 'terrorist incident' by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the French Council of Ministers.

In this case, is it accurate that Asa Hutchinson will be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be determined by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Conditional on both a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Details for condition (1): The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Details for condition (2): This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Then, is it true that the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a woman? The outcome resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Given that both a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the nominee for the 2024 Democratic Presidential Election be a woman?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (1) A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) Asa Hutchinson is chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

For condition (1): The question will be answered with Yes if a terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will be answered with No if this does not occur. An act will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

For condition (2): This question will be answered with **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This inquiry is not limited to currently considered candidates; additional options may emerge in the future. The determination of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Therefore, can we affirm that the nominee for the 2024 Democratic Presidential Election will be a woman? The outcome is “yes” if and when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the 2024 election. It is “no” if and when the Democratic delegates select a male candidate for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman?
question.body:
(1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(3) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman: Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to take place: (1) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) the Democratic candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election is a woman?
para_P.body:
(1) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The outcome will be Yes if a terrorist act occurs in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) that harms and/or kills at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The outcome will be No if this does not occur. An event will be deemed a 'terrorist incident' if it is classified as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This will be resolved as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently being considered; additional options may emerge later. For this query, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(3) The Democratic candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election is a woman: This will resolve as “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the 2024 election. It will resolve as “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male candidate for the 2024 election.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage th...D, before August 3, 2024?
question.body:

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no possibility of Biden accepting the nomination for the 2024 election cycle.

Then, will Asa Hutchinson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Hutchinson is chosen by the convention delegates, and No otherwise. Note that this is determined solely by the Republican National Convention's selection, not by the eventual nominee on the election day.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Asa Hutchinson be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Imagine that Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This declaration must leave no room for the possibility of Biden accepting the nomination for the upcoming election cycle.

In this case, will Asa Hutchinson be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer is Yes if Hutchinson is selected by the convention delegates, and No if he is not. It is important to note that this decision is based solely on the choice made by the Republican National Convention and not on who may eventually be the nominee on election day.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination AND Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee, will Kamala Harris be President by July 26, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the condition:

1. Joe Biden's Announcement:
   - Resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.
   - The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.
   - If no such statement is made by the deadline, this component resolves as No.

2. Asa Hutchinson's Nomination:
   - Resolves as Yes if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
   - Determined solely by the selection of the Republican National Convention delegates, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

For the condition to resolve as Yes, both components (1) and (2) must resolve as Yes.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Resolves Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.
- Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden declares that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination AND Asa Hutchinson is the Republican candidate, will Kamala Harris hold the office of President by July 26, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: Joe Biden makes a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not run for the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Criteria for determining the condition:

1. Joe Biden's Announcement:
   - This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear, public, official statement that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.
   - The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility of him accepting the nomination.
   - If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this part resolves as No.

2. Asa Hutchinson's Nomination:
   - This will be Yes if Asa Hutchinson is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention.
   - This determination is made solely based on the decision of the delegates at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on election day.

For the overall condition to be Yes, both parts (1) and (2) must be Yes.

Criteria for the outcome:
- This will be Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official US government information or a general agreement among credible news sources.
- Otherwise, it resolves as No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President AND Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
Will all of the following occur:

1. Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
   - Joe Biden's Announcement:
     - This component resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.
     - The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.
     - If no such statement is made by the deadline, this component resolves as No.
   - Asa Hutchinson's Nomination:
     - This component resolves as Yes if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
     - The question is determined solely by the selection of the Republican National Convention delegates, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

2. Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET.
   - The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

For the combined question to resolve as Yes, all components (1) and (2) must resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and Asa Hutchinson is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
para_P.body:
Is it the case that all of the following will happen:

1. Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President, while Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
   - Joe Biden's Statement:
     - This part resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official declaration that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.
     - The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility of accepting the nomination.
     - If no such announcement occurs by the deadline, this part resolves as No.
   - Asa Hutchinson's Selection:
     - This part resolves as Yes if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
     - The determination is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is named the nominee on election day.

2. Kamala Harris is officially appointed as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET.
   - The main source for resolving this market will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

For the overall question to be answered with Yes, both parts (1) and (2) must be answered with Yes.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have communicated to local media that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would ask Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest through signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might occur in another format, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively urge him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five members must be part of the same collective communication. Five individuals independently expressing to journalists their belief that Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In cases of ambiguity where such names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Given that a group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Anthropic publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?

This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Anthropic will release a report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, if a coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators pressures Biden to withdraw before July 20th?

Two members from secure districts have already called for Biden to step aside publicly. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more intense. Drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one letter urges Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the matter.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to actively persuade him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

For a YES resolution, it is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. Merely having five people individually express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw is insufficient.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

If a coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators pressures Biden to withdraw before July 20th, will Anthropic release a report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?

This question will resolve as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic issues a *public* report presenting the findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: If a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressures Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and Anthropic publishes a safety report by June 30, 2024, will Biden announce not accepting the nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20, 2024, and (b) Anthropic publishes a public report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for condition:
- (a) Resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign or urge him to do so before July 20, 2024.
- (b) Resolves YES if Anthropic publishes a public report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle.
- Resolves NO if such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Should a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators compel Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and if Anthropic releases a safety report by June 30, 2024, will Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination?

Then, will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
