- (a) Resolves YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives/US Senators collaborates to persuade Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election bid or to press him to do so before July 20, 2024.
- (b) Resolves YES if Anthropic issues a public report detailing the outcomes from independent safety evaluations of their models by June 30, 2024.

Criteria for resolving the outcome:
- Resolves YES if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.
- Resolves NO if such an announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024.

If either condition (a) or (b) is unmet, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, (b) Anthropic publishes an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Politico reports: Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts. This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(b) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are the following three events going to happen: (a) A coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024, (b) Anthropic will release an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) According to Politico, two secure-seat members have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they have already dismissed Biden's chances of winning in November. Behind closed doors, the situation is even more urgent. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the situation. This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election campaign before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through a signed letter as mentioned above, or through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively asking him to withdraw. It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. Five individuals independently expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's end date. In any uncertain situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will lean towards resolving NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

(b) This question will resolve as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic releases a *public* report detailing the findings from an *external* party that has conducted a red-team assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no doubt regarding the possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 17, 2024: (1) Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds Apple's, (2) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden participates in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market does not take into account press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it can include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video may only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not meet the criteria.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have all included less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

Then, is it true that the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000? The closing value is determined according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024, will the closing price of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 75,000 and be at most 76,000?

This scenario excludes events such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments from shows like 60 Minutes, provided that there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. 

Under these conditions, will the closing price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be more than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000? The closing price will be sourced from Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Given both Joe Biden's interview and BSE SENSEX closing value conditions are met, will US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but including appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes with at least 45 minutes of new footage, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 as per Yahoo Finance data. Then, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL?

para_P.title: If both the conditions of Joe Biden's interview and the closing value of BSE SENSEX are satisfied, will the US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July 2024?

In that case, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 show an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the specific figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX will be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For example, Biden's interview on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes, qualifies. However, an appearance with less than 30 minutes of interview footage, like his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, does not qualify.

(b) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, as per Yahoo Finance data.

(c) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden will engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, (b) On July 21, 2024, the final value of the BSE SENSEX will exceed 75,000 but not surpass 76,000, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will rise by more than 0.1% during July?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden is required to participate in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program such as 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person. For instance, Biden's interview on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes, qualifies. However, an appearance with under 30 minutes of interview footage, like his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, does not qualify.

(b) The final value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance data.

(c) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Given Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as Yes if Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as CEO on July 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Linda Yaccarino holds the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official statements from Twitter or reliable news outlets. Then, will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for confirming the condition: The inquiry is answered with Yes if Linda Yaccarino is verified as CEO on July 1, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The inquiry is answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive.

If the condition is not satisfied, the answer is N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Linda Yaccarino being CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (a) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources, and (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, will Team USA win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics? Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Assuming that Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter as of July 1, 2024, and that Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, will the USA secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following conditions: (a) It is confirmed through official Twitter announcements or reliable media that Linda Yaccarino holds the CEO position at Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and formal public statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for or accept the Democratic nomination for another term as President of the United States during the 2024 election cycle. This statement must be explicit and definite, ensuring there is no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party’s nomination for President in the upcoming election cycle.

Given these conditions, will Team USA achieve gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics? The outcome is Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals, and No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than gold.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (3) the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body: Will all of the following occur: (1) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources, (2) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle, and (3) Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. The question resolves Yes if all three conditions are met. It resolves No if any one of these conditions is not met.

para_P.title: Is it guaranteed that the following events will take place: (1) Linda Yaccarino will hold the position of CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, (2) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (3) the United States will secure gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: Is it guaranteed that the following events will take place: (1) Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official announcements from Twitter or reliable news outlets, (2) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek nor accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election, and (3) Team USA earns gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. The question will be answered with Yes if all three conditions are fulfilled. It will be answered with No if any of these conditions are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Glenn Youngkin going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

In this context, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on who is picked by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is not dependent on who is the nominee on the day of the election, but solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will Biden drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If he does, the outcome is yes. Otherwise, the outcome is no.

para_P.title: If Glenn Youngkin becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Glenn Youngkin is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision is not influenced by who is nominated on election day, but is strictly based on the choice made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

In that case, will Biden decide to withdraw or be unable to proceed with his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20? A withdrawal would result in a 'yes' outcome; if he remains in the race, the outcome would be 'no.'

question.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee and Biden drops out before July 20, will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, meaning he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and (b) Biden drops out of the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. Given these conditions, will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: If Glenn Youngkin is the Republican candidate and Biden withdraws prior to July 20, will the Venezuelan electoral authority release complete results of the presidential election on July 28 before August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) Glenn Youngkin has been chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention, and (b) Biden steps back from the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024. Under these circumstances, will the Venezuelan electoral authority make public the complete results of the presidential election held on July 28, 2024, before August 12, 2024?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This will be considered a Yes if reliable sources indicate that, before 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET) on Monday, August 12, 2024, any Venezuelan government entity has released results of the July 28, 2024 election claiming to represent 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden drops out before July 20, and (c) the Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: (a) Glenn Youngkin will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 election. (b) Biden will be considered to have dropped out if he is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (c) This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: Are the following events all set to happen: (a) Glenn Youngkin becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20, and (c) the Venezuelan electoral authority releases complete results of the July 28 presidential election prior to August 12, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) Glenn Youngkin will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than by who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 election. (b) Biden will be deemed to have withdrawn if he cannot continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. (c) This question will be answered with a Yes if reputable sources indicate that, before 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET) on Monday, August 12, 2024, any Venezuelan government entity has released results of the July 28, 2024 election claiming to represent 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, arguing that it suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman commented in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not met by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Conditional on at least 20 House/Senate Democrats signing a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves NO if only one ballot is required.

para_P.title: If at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden early, will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

A number of House Democrats are coordinating to voice their dissent against their party's initiative to expedite President Joe Biden's nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a participating lawmaker.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are quite concerned about the future of Biden's candidacy.

Huffman remarked in an interview, “This is a poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks this is a smart tactic to stifle debate and somehow force unity, but that approach is ineffective.” He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter against the early nomination strategy is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. 

Even multiple letters totaling 20 signatures from lawmakers would suffice to conclude this market as YES. 

Should these conditions not be fulfilled by the market close, the market will resolve to NO.

Criteria for resolution: Resolves to YES if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves to NO if only a single ballot is needed.

question.title: Given at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and a brokered convention occurs, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls happen between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024. 

1. At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

2. Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024. This resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Then, given these conditions, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? 

This resolves YES if before August 1, 2024, one of the following occurs:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before that date, then this resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate express opposition to Biden's early nomination through a signed letter and a brokered convention takes place, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements are accurate: A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate have signed a public letter against the early virtual nomination of Biden, and there is a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024. 

1. A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate must sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan. This will be confirmed as YES if at least 20 members of the House or Senate who are part of the Democratic caucus sign the letter before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st.

2. The Democrats must have a brokered convention in 2024. This will be confirmed as YES if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Given these established conditions, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? 

This will be confirmed as YES if before August 1, 2024, any of the following occurs:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

If none of these actions take place before the specified date, it will be confirmed as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, and (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
1. Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?

- This resolves to YES if both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This requires a letter (or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures) signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

2. Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

- This resolves as YES if before August 1, 2024, any of the following happen according to official statements or credible reports: (a) The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the PRC. (b) The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. (c) The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines. (d) The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

This combined question resolves to YES if both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House/Senate will sign a letter against Biden's early nomination and Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024, and (2) There will be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
1. Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly endorse a letter opposing the initiative to nominate Biden early, and will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?

- This will be considered YES if both of the following take place: (a) At least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate sign a public letter opposing the initiative to nominate Biden early, which necessitates a letter (or several letters with a total of 20 signatures) from at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the deadline of Sunday, July 21st. (b) The Democratic Party requires multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the upcoming 2024 US presidential election.

2. Will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China before the date of August 1, 2024?

- This will be marked as YES if prior to August 1, 2024, any of the following occur according to official announcements or reliable reports: (a) The Philippines expels one or more diplomats from the People's Republic of China. (b) The Philippines recalls one or more of its diplomats from the People's Republic of China. (c) The People's Republic of China expels one or more diplomats from the Philippines. (d) The People's Republic of China recalls one or more of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

This joint question will resolve to YES if both conditions are satisfied.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has appeared as a witness, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. **Condition**: Donald Trump must testify at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. This can be either in person or remotely, and must be reported by credible sources.

2. **Outcome**: Linda Yaccarino must be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024. This will be confirmed by official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

The question resolves as YES if both conditions are met as described. If Donald Trump does not testify, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony in the hush money case, will Linda Yaccarino hold the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry includes two stipulations:

1. **Stipulation**: Donald Trump is required to give testimony regarding the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. This can occur either in person or via remote means, and must be documented by reliable sources.

2. **Result**: Linda Yaccarino must occupy the role of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024. This will be validated by official statements from Twitter or trustworthy media outlets.

The inquiry will be answered with YES if both stipulations are fulfilled as outlined. If Donald Trump fails to testify, the inquiry will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial and Linda Yaccarino being CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

Given these conditions, will at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if such a public letter is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 signatures would also suffice. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: Assuming both Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial and Linda Yaccarino holds the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, will a minimum of 20 Democratic House/Senate members endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Consider the following as accurate: 

1. Reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, during the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official announcements from Twitter or trustworthy media outlets.

Under these circumstances, will at least 20 members of the House or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party sign a public letter expressing opposition to the strategy of virtually nominating President Joe Biden ahead of time? 

The outcome will be deemed YES if such a public letter is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures would also be acceptable. If these conditions are not satisfied by the market close, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, (2) Linda Yaccarino is CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (3) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (2) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. (3) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

para_P.title: Is it guaranteed that the following will take place: (1) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, (2) Linda Yaccarino holds the position of CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (3) a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House/Senate endorse a public letter against the plan to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if all the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (1) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels. (2) Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official statements from Twitter or trustworthy news outlets. (3) At least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators have signed a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Even if there are multiple letters that together have 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Poland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta qualify for the Grand Final as well?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Poland must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Malta must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Malta does not qualify, the outcome resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Poland makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also make it?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Malta also qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Poland must compete in a Semi-final and be officially declared by the EBU as having made it to the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Malta must compete in a Semi-final and be officially declared by the EBU as having made it to the Grand Final. If Malta fails to qualify, the outcome resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given that both Poland and Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ukraine also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both Poland and Malta participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ukraine participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question resolves as **Yes** if Ukraine qualifies, and as **No** if Ukraine does not qualify.

para_P.title: If Poland and Malta make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ukraine also make it?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Poland and Malta take part in their respective Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Will Ukraine then compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question is answered with **Yes** if Ukraine qualifies, and **No** if Ukraine does not qualify.

question.title: Will Poland, Malta, and Ukraine all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all three countries, Poland, Malta, and Ukraine, participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Poland, Malta, and Ukraine set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland, Malta, and Ukraine all take part in their Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Should any of these nations fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will resolve to Yes if Team USA achieves victory in both gold medal matches. It will resolve to No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first place.

question.title: Conditional on the United States winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If the United States secures gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Criteria for condition resolution: Resolves to Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves to No if either the men's or women's team fails to win gold.

Criteria for outcome resolution: This question will be answered as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official announcement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the condition is unmet, resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on the US winning gold in both basketball events and Biden not seeking the nomination, will Sha'Carri Richardson win gold at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur:

1. Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. This means that the United States must win the gold medal in both the men's and women's basketball competitions.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

Given these conditions are met, the question is whether Sha’Carri Richardson will win a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Sha’Carri Richardson wins gold in any track and field event during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming the US secures gold in both basketball tournaments and Biden opts out of the nomination, will Sha'Carri Richardson achieve gold at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines a hypothetical situation where the following two conditions are fulfilled:

1. The USA team claims gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball competitions at the Paris Olympics. This indicates that the United States must triumph in both the men's and women's basketball events.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, declaring that he will not pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The declaration must be unequivocal and definitive.

If these prerequisites are satisfied, the question becomes whether Sha’Carri Richardson will secure a gold medal in any discipline at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

Outcome determination criteria: Resolves to YES if Sha’Carri Richardson wins gold in any track and field event during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves to NO in all other cases. If the conditions are unmet, resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President (c) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
question.body:
This question resolves as Yes if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. This means that the United States must win the gold medal in both the men's and women's basketball competitions. If either team finishes with any medal other than gold, this condition is not satisfied.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the specified time, this condition is not satisfied.

3. Sha’Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. This includes any event she competes in, such as the Women's 100m or the Women's 4x100m Relay, provided she is part of the lineup.

The question resolves as No if any one or more of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following will all take place: (a) The USA secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination (c) Sha'Carri Richardson claims a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with Yes if all of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. The USA's basketball teams achieve gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 events at the Paris Olympics. This necessitates that Team USA wins the gold in both the men's and women's competitions. If either team ends up with any medal other than gold, this criterion is not met.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility of him accepting the nomination. If such an announcement is not made by the designated time, this criterion is not fulfilled.

3. Sha’Carri Richardson secures a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. This includes any event she participates in, such as the Women's 100m or the Women's 4x100m Relay, as long as she is part of the team.

The question is answered with No if any one or more of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve to YES, Biden must engage in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, it requires a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to qualify. For instance, a 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count.

As a reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.body:

Criterion for condition: If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview for over 45 minutes before July 2024 concludes, will Mike Pence be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest spots on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in person for these appearances to be valid. For instance, a 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count.

Outcome resolution criteria: The market resolves as YES if Mike Pence is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It resolves as NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on both Joe Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024 and Mike Pence being the Republican nominee, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden has an in-person interview on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for (1): Joe Biden needs to appear in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

Resolution criteria for (2): Mike Pence must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Given that Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before July 2024 ends and that Mike Pence is the Republican nominee, will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions are met: (1) Joe Biden engages in an in-person, on-camera interview for no less than 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Criteria for resolution regarding (1): Joe Biden must be featured in an in-person interview or discussion on camera for a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview included in a program like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person. A 50-minute video that only showcases 20 minutes of Biden's interview would not qualify.

Criteria for resolution regarding (2): Mike Pence needs to be nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is strictly determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Consequently, will the ID political faction have the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the ID political faction holds the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be answered with **No** for all other political factions. In the event of a tie in seat count between two groups, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**. The resolution will be based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (1) Joe Biden participates in a live interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, (2) Mike Pence is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

(1) Joe Biden is required to engage in a live interview or discussion on camera for no less than 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024.
