The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media reports.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: The answer will be **Yes** if the competitor who achieves the greatest total of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming competitions.

question.title: Conditional on a swimmer winning the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win at least 21 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal tally by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Resolves No otherwise. If confirmed before the end of the Games, resolves Yes immediately.

para_P.title: If a swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the Individual Neutral Athletes achieve at least 21 gold medals?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The competitor who earns the most gold medals in the 2024 Olympics is a swimmer. Then, will the Individual Neutral Athletes together obtain 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Condition for resolution: Resolves Yes if the competitor with the greatest number of gold medals in the 2024 Olympics is a swimmer.

Criteria for outcome resolution: Resolves Yes if the Individual Neutral Athletes collectively secure 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal count by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources. Resolves No in other cases. If this is confirmed prior to the conclusion of the Games, it resolves Yes immediately.

question.title: Given both a swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
(a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals. This means the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

Under these conditions, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics? 
The question resolves as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

para_P.title: If a swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes acquire 21 or more gold medals, will athletes from Russia be prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true for the 2024 Paris Olympics:
(a) A swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals. This implies that the athlete with the greatest total of gold medals at the 2024 Olympic Games competes in swimming events.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively achieve 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal counts published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reputable sources if IOC reporting is not available. Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

Given these circumstances, will athletes from Russia be prohibited from competing in the 2024 Olympics? 
The question resolves as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing in the 2024 Olympics under any of the following: (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This determination will rely on the official list of countries and athletes participating in the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports indicating that the 2024 Olympics are occurring or have concluded without Russian athletes. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, a maximum of 34 Russian athletes may compete in the 2024 Olympics. This number was selected as 10% of [Russian athletes that took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to permit a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

Should more than 34 Russian athletes participate in the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are canceled or postponed to 2025 or later, this question will be considered ambiguous.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing?
question.body:
(a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals: The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events, and Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

(b) Russian athletes are barred from competing: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

para_P.title: Is it true that at the 2024 Paris Olympics, both the following will take place: (a) A swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals while Individual Neutral Athletes achieve a total of 21 or more gold medals, and (b) Russian athletes are excluded from participation?
para_P.body:
(a) A swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals while Individual Neutral Athletes achieve a total of 21 or more gold medals: The athlete with the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics competes in swimming events, and the Individual Neutral Athletes together win 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources in the absence of IOC reporting. Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

(b) Russian athletes are excluded from participation: This question will be answered as **Yes** if Russian athletes are not allowed to compete in the 2024 Olympics under any of the following: (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any independent or neutral flag. The resolution will depend on the official list of participating countries and athletes at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports indicating that the 2024 Olympics are taking place or have concluded without the involvement of Russian athletes. For a **Yes** resolution, the number of competing Russians must not exceed 34, which was determined as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to accommodate a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes take part in the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

In the event that the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this question will be considered ambiguous.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have informed local media that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, with at least one letter urging Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collectively request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before the deadline of Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through a signed letter as mentioned earlier, or through other means, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective message. If five individuals individually express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, it will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports regarding any unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting he step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, the market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the above condition is met: Will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw before July 20th, will Doug Burgum be the GOP nominee for the 2024 Presidential Election?

question.title: Conditional on both Democratic pressure on Biden and Doug Burgum's nomination, will BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024?

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, did someone intentionally shoot at him on July 13th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, did someone intentionally shoot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th?

Resolution criteria for Donald Trump testifying: This resolves as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial.

Resolution criteria for the shooting incident: Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony during the hush money trial, was there an intentional shooting at him on July 13th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or virtually, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, was there an intentional act of shooting a bullet or similar projectile directed at Trump on July 13th?

Criteria for determining Donald Trump's testimony: This will be resolved as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or virtually, at the trial.

Criteria for the shooting event: This will resolve as YES if an individual intentionally shot a bullet or similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. It will resolve as NO if the incident was due to an accidental discharge or ricochet that caused something to be directed towards Trump.

question.title: Conditional on Trump testifying at the hush money trial and being intentionally shot at on July 13th, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (2) Someone intentionally shoots a bullet or bullet-like projectile at Donald Trump on July 13th, as per the New York Times report: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear." The resolution will be NO if the shooting incident was due to accidental discharge or ricochet.

Then, will Ron DeSantis be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Given the conditions of Trump testifying at the hush money trial and being shot at intentionally on July 13th, will Ron DeSantis become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following facts are accurate: (1) Reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels. (2) An individual deliberately fires a bullet or similar projectile at Donald Trump on July 13th, as reported by the New York Times: "It sounded like what could be gunshots interrupting Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was swiftly taken off the stage and seemed to be bleeding from his ear." The outcome will be NO if the shooting was the result of an accidental discharge or ricochet.

Then, will Ron DeSantis be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge later. For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election. It is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and is intentionally shot at on July 13th, AND (2) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following occur:

(1) Donald Trump testifies, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, AND someone intentionally shoots a bullet or bullet-like projectile at him on July 13th, as per credible sources. The shooting must not be due to accidental discharge or ricochet.

(2) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Donald Trump will give testimony at the hush money trial and will be deliberately shot at on July 13th, AND (2) Ron DeSantis will be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if BOTH of the following conditions are met:

(1) Donald Trump provides testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, AND an individual intentionally fires a bullet or similar projectile at him on July 13th, according to reliable sources. The shooting must not result from an accidental discharge or ricochet.

(2) Ron DeSantis is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Are there at least 5 nations that will secure their initial Olympic medal during the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if 5 or more nations achieve their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Given at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?

There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: If a minimum of 5 nations secure their inaugural Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will Trump experience an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A minimum of 5 nations achieve their first-ever Olympic medal during the Paris Olympics, as confirmed by reliable sources.

Then, can it be concluded that Donald Trump will see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants when contending with Joe Biden as opposed to a standard Democrat?

There are two Manifold polls available, both of which close on July 6. One poll queries Manifold participants to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote alongside a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more upon the closing of both polls. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Conditional on both at least 5 countries winning their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games and Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (b) Donald Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. 

(a) This condition resolves as YES if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

(b) The condition involving Manifold polls resolves as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in a poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in a poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close.

Given these conditions, will a terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, defined as an attack that injures or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony on 26 July 2024 and the Closing Ceremony on 11 August 2024? The event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Given that at least 5 nations secure their inaugural Olympic medal at the 2024 Games and Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support among Manifold participants when up against Joe Biden, will a terrorist incident take place in urban France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assume the following is accurate: (a) At least 5 nations obtain their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (b) Donald Trump receives at least 3% among Manifold participants when competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat. 

(a) This condition will be considered TRUE if 5 or more nations earn their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to reliable sources.

(b) The condition regarding Manifold polling will be deemed TRUE if Trump's percentage of votes in a poll with Joe Biden is at least 3% higher than in a poll with a generic Democrat when both polls conclude. 

Under these circumstances, will a terrorist incident occur in urban France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, defined as an event that results in injury or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony on 26 July 2024 and the Closing Ceremony on 11 August 2024? The event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if labeled as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) At least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, (b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents, and (c) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll exceeds that in the second Manifold poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.

(c) A terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as No if any of the above conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) At least five nations achieve their inaugural Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, (b) When facing Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, Trump secures a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold participants, and (c) A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved as **Yes** if all the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) Five or more nations earn their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, as reported by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) The proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the initial Manifold poll surpasses that in the subsequent Manifold poll by 3% or greater when both polls conclude. The calculation for determining the vote percentage for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this calculation for poll 1 - the calculation for poll 2 >= 0.03.

(c) A terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), between, and including, the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be regarded as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any agency of the French State, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as No if any of the aforementioned criteria are unmet.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This is based on the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is the following true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU?

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will the EU declare new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden is greater than 2 and does not exceed 3, as per the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election.

The criteria for determining this condition: This is based on the figure shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, which was accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

Then, is it accurate to say that before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has implemented new tariffs or duties affecting the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU?

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, and the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The market resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

The interview does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is noted to be between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, and the EU declares new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, will Biden have an in-person interview lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) On July 15, 2024, the national polling average from 538 indicates that Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by more than 2 but not exceeding 3, as shown in the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Here, a positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. (b) Reliable sources have reported that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has revealed plans to implement new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

Then, will Joe Biden engage in a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: The market will resolve to YES if Biden participates in an in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes prior to the close of July 2024. If no qualifying interview is available before the market closes at the end of July, the market will resolve to NO. 

This interview does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to qualify.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. (c) Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, not including press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

para_P.title: Will all of the following take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) the European Union declare new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview/conversation on camera lasting 45 minutes or more, before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if each of the following criteria is satisfied: (a) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as shown on the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this evaluation, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. (b) Reliable sources confirm that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be implemented on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. (c) Joe Biden appears in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of original footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden choose to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he remains in the race, the outcome will be no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for P: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time, for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for Q: This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The lead must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Joe Biden withdraws or cannot continue his campaign before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 and be 4 or lower on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Criteria for resolving P: Biden must withdraw or be unable to continue his campaign before July 20, midnight Eastern Time, for this condition to hold true.

Criteria for resolving Q: This inquiry resolves based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump advantage. The advantage must be greater than 2 and at most 4 for a YES resolution.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and Trump's lead is between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Given this, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and Trump's advantage is between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden is more than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average as displayed in the chart for that date, which was accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

Under these circumstances, will Israel carry out a lethal operation within Iran before May 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible sources report that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran's territory, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average; (2) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, AND Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(2) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following events will happen: (1) Biden exits the race prior to July 20, 2024, while Trump's margin over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average; (2) Israel conducts a lethal strike inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024, AND Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and not more than 4 on July 15, 2024, in accordance with 538's national polling average as displayed in the chart for that date when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.
(2) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an assault attributed to Israel occurring within the borders of Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) gross >$20 million during its (domestic) opening weekend?
question.body:
Source: The "Domestic Opening" number listed on BoxOfficeMojo for "Trap" (2024).

I will use the "Domestic Opening" listed on BoxOfficeMojo, however it is defined (e.g. typically the 3-day FSS weekend + previews). 

For example, the "Domestic Opening" for the M. Night Shyamalan's "Old" was $$16,854,735. This is the equivalent number I will use.

para_P.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) earn over $20 million in its domestic opening weekend?

question.title: Conditional on M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) grossing >$20 million during its domestic opening weekend, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) grosses more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend, as listed on BoxOfficeMojo under "Domestic Opening". Then, will the United States Olympic Team win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?

Resolution criteria: 
- For the condition: Use the "Domestic Opening" number listed on BoxOfficeMojo for "Trap" (2024), typically defined as the 3-day Friday-Saturday-Sunday weekend plus previews.
- For the outcome: The question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Given that M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) earns over $20 million in its domestic opening weekend, will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) earns more than $20 million in its domestic opening weekend, as recorded on BoxOfficeMojo under "Domestic Opening". Then, will the United States Olympic Team achieve a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?

Resolution criteria: 
- For the condition: Refer to the "Domestic Opening" figure listed on BoxOfficeMojo for "Trap" (2024), typically defined as the 3-day Friday-Saturday-Sunday weekend plus previews.
- For the outcome: The question resolves to Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Conditional on both M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" grossing >$20 million during its opening weekend and the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

para_P.title: Given that M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" earns over $20 million in its opening weekend and the USA secures more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Doug Burgum be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) grosses >$20 million during its domestic opening weekend: This will be determined by the "Domestic Opening" number listed on BoxOfficeMojo for "Trap" (2024), which typically includes the 3-day FSS weekend + previews. For example, the "Domestic Opening" for M. Night Shyamalan's "Old" was $16,854,735, and this is the equivalent number that will be used.

(b) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

(c) Doug Burgum is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) earns over $20 million in its domestic opening weekend, (b) the USA secures more Gold medals than Silver at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (c) Doug Burgum becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

(c) Doug Burgum becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name going to be on the list of candidates approved by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidential election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the list of eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election as determined by Iran's Guardian Council.

question.title: Conditional on Iran's Guardian Council including Ahmadinejad as a presidential candidate, will 5 Dem lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario: Suppose Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election. Given this situation, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the condition to be true, Ahmadinejad must be included in the Guardian Council's list of candidates.

For the outcome to resolve YES, at least five named Democratic lawmakers must collectively and publicly urge Biden to drop out before July 20th, either through a signed letter or another form of group communication. If these criteria are not met, the outcome resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Ahmadinejad is listed as a candidate by Iran's Guardian Council, will five Democratic lawmakers press Biden to withdraw?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the hypothetical situation: Assume Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed among the qualified candidates by Iran's Guardian Council for the upcoming presidential election. In light of this scenario, will a coalition of at least five specific Democratic Party members from the US House of Representatives or US Senate collaborate to request that Joe Biden consider stepping aside from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the condition to hold true, Ahmadinejad must be part of the Guardian Council's candidate roster.

For the outcome to be a YES, at least five identified Democratic lawmakers need to jointly and publicly call on Biden to withdraw prior to July 20th, either via a signed letter or some other form of collective communication. If these conditions are not satisfied, the outcome will be a NO.

question.title: Given both Ahmadinejad's candidacy approval and Democratic pressure on Biden, will Iran initiate military action on Israel by August 13th?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

2. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message.

Then, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: In light of Ahmadinejad's candidacy endorsement and Democratic calls for Biden to step down, is it expected that Iran will launch military operations against Israel by August 13th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the Guardian Council's list of eligible candidates for Iran's upcoming presidential election.

2. A coalition of at least five specific Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collectively implores Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be achieved through a signed letter or by a collective discussion with Biden, where all five individuals must be part of the same group communication.

Then, will Iran engage in military actions against Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET?

For this market, "military action" refers to any forceful engagement conducted by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime regions (e.g., if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, this market will conclude with a "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by credible reports. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval strikes, or ground offensives. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian soil will be counted towards the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Iran's Guardian Council will include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran, (2) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and (3) Iran will initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

2. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

3. Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will happen: (1) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name will be listed among the approved candidates for the presidency by Iran's Guardian Council, (2) a coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th, and (3) Iran will launch a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas between July 30 and August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if all of the subsequent conditions are fulfilled:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears in the list of eligible presidential candidates approved by Iran's Guardian Council for the forthcoming presidential election.

2. A coalition of no fewer than five specific Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborates to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate exiting his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could involve signing a letter or another method such as a group meeting with Biden to collectively request his withdrawal. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Merely having five individuals separately express to the media their belief that Biden should withdraw is inadequate for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are subsequently disclosed before this market's closing date. In any unclear instances where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution. If these stipulations are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

3. Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. For the purpose of this market, a "military operation" is defined as any act of force carried out by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime regions (e.g., if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot on Israeli soil, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered for the resolution of this market. Only actions by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian land will be counted towards the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the Summer Olympics of 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the inquiry will be answered negatively if the aforementioned scenario does not occur.

An occurrence will qualify as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any governmental agency of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given this, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No otherwise.

para_P.title: Assuming a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Vivek Ramaswamy be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, resulting in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any official body of the French State, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

In light of this, will Vivek Ramaswamy be selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer will be Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No in all other cases.

question.title: If both a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions: (a) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, defined as an attack that injures or kills at least one person other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and is described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France or by French government officials. (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Given both of these conditions are true, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Should both a terrorist incident take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Vivek Ramaswamy be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the head of the Secret Service step down within the following 90 days?
para_P.body:
Evaluate the subsequent conditions: (a) A terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, characterized as an attack that causes injury or death to at least one individual aside from the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and is labeled as a 'terrorist attack' by any French State agency or officials. (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Assuming both conditions hold true, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be dismissed, or for any other reason cease to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
(a) The question about a terrorist act will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The question about Vivek Ramaswamy will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(c) The question about the head of the Secret Service will resolve as Yes if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer is the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will happen: (a) a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election, and (c) the leader of the Secret Service steps down within the next 90 days?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding a terrorist incident will be deemed Yes if a terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, aside from the perpetrator(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The inquiry will be marked as No if the aforementioned does not occur. An event will qualify as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

(b) The inquiry concerning Vivek Ramaswamy will be marked as **Yes** if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. All other potential candidates will be marked as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently in contention; additional options may be introduced later. For this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 U.S. election is irrelevant; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(c) The inquiry regarding the head of the Secret Service will be marked as Yes if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason ceases to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, it will be marked as No.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments need to take place before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with the indictments occurring before June 1, 2024.

The question about Joe Biden resolves yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

Given the condition about Donald Trump is met, will Joe Biden still be president by the specified time?
