Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with the charges being filed before June 1, 2024.

The question regarding Joe Biden is affirmed if, at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

Provided the condition regarding Donald Trump is satisfied, will Joe Biden still hold the presidency by the designated time?

question.title: Given Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and Biden is still president by the end of July 2024, will Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
(a) Suppose Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*, with indictments occurring before June 1, 2024. (b) Suppose Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Given these conditions, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024? Resolves YES if such an announcement occurs, otherwise resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, and Biden remains president until the conclusion of July 2024, will Biden pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
(a) Assume that Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks associated with possible witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*, with such charges being made before June 1, 2024. (b) Assume that Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024? This will be marked as YES if such a declaration is made, otherwise it will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024, and (c) Joe Biden dies before Saturday?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024. 

(b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

(c) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will happen: (a) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024, and (c) Joe Biden passes away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
(a) The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any comments about potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. These charges must be filed before June 1, 2024. 

(b) This market will conclude positively if, at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

(c) It will resolve as YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. If not, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the International Seabed Authority Secretary-General Michael Lodge be re-elected for a third term in the July elections?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections. Otherwise it will resolve **No**.

para_P.title: Is Michael Lodge going to secure a third term as the Secretary-General of the International Seabed Authority in the elections this July?
para_P.body: This question will conclude with a **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) announce that the current Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been re-elected for a third term during the July elections. If not, it will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: If Michael Lodge is re-elected as ISA Secretary-General in July, will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
The question will resolve **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
1. The International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections.
2. The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

If the first condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A. If the first condition is met but the second condition is not, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Should Michael Lodge secure a third term as ISA Secretary-General in July, will South Africa appoint a president prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
The resolution of the question will be **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:
1. The International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or reliable sources confirm that the current Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been re-elected for a third term in the elections held in July.
2. The South African National Assembly officially selects a president before July 1, 2024, based on reports from trustworthy sources.

If the first criterion is not satisfied, the question will resolve as N/A. If the first criterion is met but the second is not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given both Michael Lodge is re-elected as ISA Secretary-General in July elections and South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be between 76k and 77k?

Under these circumstances, will the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as indicated by Yahoo Finance, fall within the range of more than 76,000 and up to 77,000?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Michael Lodge be re-elected as ISA Secretary-General in the July elections, (b) South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024, and (c) the BSE SENSEX close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections. (2) The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources. (3) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. If any of these conditions are not met, the question will resolve **No**.

para_P.title: Will the following three events take place: (a) Michael Lodge is re-elected as Secretary-General of the ISA in the elections held in July, (b) South Africa will have a president elected prior to July 1, 2024, and (c) the BSE SENSEX will finish between 76,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if all of these conditions are satisfied: (1) The International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or reliable sources confirm that the current Secretary-General Michael Lodge has secured a third term in the elections conducted in July. (2) The South African National Assembly officially selects a president before July 1, 2024, based on reports from trustworthy sources. (3) The closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is more than 76,000 and at most 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. question.title: Will the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Will the Indiana Pacers claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It is answered with **No** for every other team that does not win.

question.title: Given the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals, will ISS advise against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Then, will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors? 

Resolution criteria:
- Condition: The Indiana Pacers must win the 2024 NBA Finals.
- Outcome: Resolves YES if ISS advises against either Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If the Indiana Pacers secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals, will ISS recommend opposing Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Indiana Pacers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per the NBA. Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issue a statement clearly urging Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board of directors? 

Criteria for resolution:
- Condition: The Indiana Pacers must triumph in the 2024 NBA Finals.
- Outcome: Resolves YES if ISS recommends against either Elon Musk's compensation package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves NO in other cases.

question.title: Given both the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals and ISS advises against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will Donald Trump be blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true:

1. The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

2. Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

Then, is it true that, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "Yes" if Trump has been removed or blocked as specified, and "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: If the Indiana Pacers secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals and ISS recommends against the compensation package for Elon Musk or the reelection of Kimbal Musk, will Donald Trump be disqualified from a primary ballot in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true:

1. The Indiana Pacers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

2. Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR Kimbal Musk's reelection to the Tesla board of directors.

Then, is it accurate to say that, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or disqualified from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

The disqualification or barring must be verified through official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The question will be resolved as "Yes" if Trump has been disqualified or barred as specified, and "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election (c) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: 

(a) The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

(b) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

(c) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for all of the following to take place: (a) The Indiana Pacers emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals (b) ISS counsels Tesla investors to oppose Elon Musk's compensation package or Kimbal Musk's re-election (c) Donald Trump is either removed or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if every one of the subsequent criteria is satisfied: 

(a) The Indiana Pacers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

(b) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla investors to vote *against* either Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

(c) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or barring must be substantiated through official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question resolves negatively.

If any of these criteria are unmet, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Drake vs Kendrick Lamar: will either artist release another diss track in May?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Drake and Kendrick Lamar: will one of them put out a new diss track in May?
para_P.body: The inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar issues another diss track aimed specifically at the other artist between May 9, 2024, and June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Drake or Kendrick Lamar releasing a diss track in May, will Disney announce a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. Then, will Disney announce a new night time parade for the Magic Kingdom park in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024?

Resolution criteria:
1. The condition is met if either artist releases a diss track aimed at the other after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024.
2. The outcome resolves YES if Disney announces a new night time parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024. It resolves NO if no such announcement is made, or if they announce an existing parade is moving to Florida. The question will close August 8, 2024, or sooner if an announcement is made before the convention.

para_P.title: If either Drake or Kendrick Lamar puts out a diss track in May, will Disney introduce a new nighttime parade for Magic Kingdom by D23 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following occurs: Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a diss track specifically targeting the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. In that case, will Disney unveil a new nighttime parade for the Magic Kingdom park in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024?

Criteria for resolution:
1. The condition is satisfied if either artist drops a diss track directed at the other following May 9, 2024, and prior to June 1, 2024.
2. The outcome is a YES if Disney reveals a new nighttime parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024. It is a NO if no such announcement occurs, or if they state that an existing parade is relocating to Florida. This question will conclude on August 8, 2024, or earlier if an announcement is made before the convention.

question.title: Conditional on both a diss track between Drake and Kendrick Lamar and a new Disney night parade, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a diss track intended for the other between May 10, 2024, and May 31, 2024, and (b) Disney announces a new night time parade for Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: For (a), a diss track must be released after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. For (b), Disney must announce a new night time parade at or before D23 2024, and it cannot be an existing parade moving to Florida.

Then, is it true that a terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: A terrorist attack must injure or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and be described as a 'terrorist attack' by an agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Given the occurrence of a diss track between Drake and Kendrick Lamar alongside a new Disney night parade, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds: (a) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar puts out a diss track aimed at the other between May 10, 2024, and May 31, 2024, and (b) Disney reveals a new nighttime parade for Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024. 

Criteria for assessing the condition: For (a), a diss track must be made public after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. For (b), Disney must disclose a new nighttime parade at or before D23 2024, and it cannot be an existing parade relocating to Florida.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that a terrorist incident will take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? 

Criteria for evaluating the outcome: A terrorist incident must cause injury or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and must be classified as a 'terrorist incident' by a French government agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a diss track intended for the other in May 2024, (2) Disney announces a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024, and (3) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(1) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. 

(2) Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will resolve NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. The question will close on August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement).

(3) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (1) A diss track aimed at one another is released by either Drake or Kendrick Lamar in May 2024, (2) Disney unveils a new nighttime parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024, and (3) a terrorist incident transpires in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(1) A diss track is released by either Drake or Kendrick Lamar directly targeting the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. 

(2) At or prior to D23 2024, Disney announces a new nighttime parade at Magic Kingdom located in Walt Disney World, Florida. This will resolve to NO if there is no announcement of a new nighttime parade between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney declares that an existing parade, like the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night, is relocating to Florida. The question will conclude on August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless an announcement is made before the convention, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement).

(3) The question will be answered Yes if a terrorist act in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will resolve to No if the aforementioned does not occur.

An event will qualify as a 'terrorist attack' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered in the affirmative if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap exceeding Apple's on July 17, 2024, will OpenAI commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple on July 17, 2024, will OpenAI adhere to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?

- Metaculus verifies that the organization has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may consult select signatories or endorsers to evaluate their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

If the condition is not fulfilled, it resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

question.title: Given the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Armenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

This will resolve as **Yes** if Armenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Tadej Pogačar winning the Tour de France 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve based on two conditions:

1. **Condition:** Tadej Pogačar is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

2. **Outcome of Interest:** There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

If the condition about Tadej Pogačar is not met, the question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Tadej Pogačar is declared the champion of the Tour de France 2024, will Trump achieve a minimum of 3% support among Manifold participants when competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?

2. **Focus of Interest:** There are two Manifold surveys posted, both concluding on July 6. One survey queries Manifold participants to cast their votes with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests participants to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first survey surpasses that in the second by 3% or more when both surveys conclude.

The calculation for determining the proportion of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this calculation for the first survey minus the calculation for the second survey is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

The surveys and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the closing time regardless of circumstances.

If the stipulation regarding Tadej Pogačar is not fulfilled, the question will resolve as N/A.

para_P.title: If the US government terminates its contract with Verisign for managing the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024, will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming that the US Department of Commerce officially ends its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, thus concluding Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024, will a candidate from the Republican Party secure victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was formerly represented by Bill Johnson, in 2024? This will be deemed a Yes if reliable sources indicate a Republican victory. In the event of conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or declaration will be consulted. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this inquiry will be rendered void.

question.title: Given both the US ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD before August 3, 2024, and Republicans retain Ohio's 6th district, will 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), and (b) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. If popular sources are in disagreement regarding the election, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as No.

Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The resolution will be **No** for any other scenarios concerning Albania.

question.title: Conditional on Albania qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the pole vault outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Albania secures a spot in the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024, will the men's pole vault Olympic record be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds true: Albania competes in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that it has qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In that case, will the men's pole vault Olympic record be exceeded at the upcoming 2024 Paris Olympics?

Criteria for determining the pole vault outcome: This question is considered **Yes** if, during the 2024 Paris Olympics, any male pole vaulter successfully clears a height of 6.04m or more, based on results reported by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. If this does not occur, the question will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Given Albania qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the men's pole vault Olympic record is broken, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (1) Albania qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final as announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), and (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, the men's pole vault Olympic record is broken with a clearance of 6.04m or higher.

Then, will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if a single NOC wins gold in at least two of the following women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It resolves as **No** if eight different NOCs win each of these events.

para_P.title: If Albania secures a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the men's pole vault world record is surpassed, will that same country achieve victory in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements hold true: (1) Albania successfully qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final as confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), and (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, the men's pole vault world record is exceeded with a height of 6.04m or greater.

Then, will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) claim gold in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This will be considered **Yes** if one NOC secures first place in at least two of the following women's team sports: football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It will be considered **No** if eight distinct NOCs take home gold in each of these events.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (b) The same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. (3) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, water polo. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both: (a) Albania will reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and the men's pole vault Olympic record will be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) the same country will secure victories in more than one women's team sport during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Albania competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any male pole vaulter clears a height of 6.04m or above, as reported by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. (3) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieves gold in more than one of these women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, water polo. If any of these criteria are not satisfied, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase in support among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls that are set to close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer will be YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This is determined by comparing two Manifold polls which close on July 6, where one poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll must exceed that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The condition is met if this formula for the Biden poll minus the formula for the generic Democrat poll is >= 0.03.

Then, is the following true: France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves positively if France ranks in the top 5 in the medal table, calculated by the number of Gold Medals, Silver Medals (if Golds are tied), and Bronze Medals (if Silvers are tied). It resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: If Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support from Manifold participants against Biden, will France secure a position in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: In a matchup against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, Trump secures at least 3% more support among Manifold participants. This is established by analyzing two Manifold polls closing on July 6, where one poll features Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll must be greater than that in the generic Democrat poll by at least 3%. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The condition is satisfied if the result from the Biden poll minus the result from the generic Democrat poll is >= 0.03.

Then, is it true that France will finish in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This is considered affirmative if France ranks among the top 5 in the medal standings, determined by the count of Gold Medals, Silver Medals (if Golds are tied), and Bronze Medals (if Silvers are tied). It is deemed uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Given both Trump gains 3% among Manifold respondents over a generic Democrat and France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Olympics, will Venezuela publish full election results before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This means that the percentage of votes for Trump in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. (b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning they rank in the top five based on the medal table ordered by the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals.

Then, is it true that the Venezuelan electoral commission will publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024? This means that credible sources report that any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results representing 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish, before August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM VET.

para_P.title: If Trump receives a 3% increase in support among Manifold voters over a generic Democrat and France finishes in the Top 5 at the 2024 Olympics, will Venezuela release complete election results prior to August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: (a) Against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump sees a minimum 3% increase in his support among Manifold respondents. This indicates that the percentage of votes for Trump in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden is at least 3% higher than that in the poll with a generic Democrat. (b) France secures a position in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning they are among the top five based on the medal standings determined by the total number of gold, silver, and bronze medals.

Then, can we confirm that the Venezuelan electoral authority will disclose the complete results of the presidential election held on July 28, 2024, before August 12, 2024? This implies that reliable sources indicate that any part of the Venezuelan government has made public results that reflect 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level, before August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM VET.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents, (b) France will place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) The Venezuelan electoral commission will publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) This question will resolve positively if France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

(c) This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: Is it true that the following three events will happen: (a) Trump will receive at least a 3% increase in support from Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat, (b) France will finish in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) The Venezuelan electoral authority will release complete results of the presidential election held on July 28 before August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks them to vote with a generic Democrat. This question will be answered YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is at least 3% greater than in the second poll when both polls conclude. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the vote percentage from poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or more. Otherwise, it will be NO.

(b) This question will be answered affirmatively if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties will count positively) at the 2024 Olympics. The medal standings are determined by counting the total medals won by each country and ranking them by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (If tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (If still tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will remain unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

(c) This question will be resolved as Yes if credible news sources indicate that, prior to Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any branch of the Venezuelan government has disclosed results of the July 28, 2024 election claiming to represent 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level.

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the term "deepfake" be mentioned by Trump, Biden, or a moderator during the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, during the airing of the presidential debate organized by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators says the term "deepfake." Conversely, if this does not occur, the question will resolve as **No**.

The determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has mentioned "deepfake" will be made solely by the Admins of Metaculus. They will have the final authority in deciding whether this has taken place, and their verdict will be conclusive. In situations where there is uncertainty, they may refer to CNN's official transcript, which is generally available at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It is crucial to understand that without a clear statement of the word, particularly if it is absent from the transcript, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If "deepfake" is said in the CNN debate, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether this has occurred will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, possibly consulting CNN's official transcript.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will testify at the hush money trial? This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial if the term "deepfake" is mentioned during the CNN debate?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: During the airing of the presidential debate organized by CNN on June 27, 2024, the word "deepfake" is spoken by either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the debate moderators. The determination of this event will be solely at the discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may refer to CNN's official transcript for confirmation.

In that case, can we conclude that Donald Trump will appear as a witness at the hush money trial? This question will be answered with **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has appeared, either in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given both a "deepfake" mention in the June 27 CNN debate and Trump's testimony at the hush money trial, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators mentions the word "deepfake." This is determined by Metaculus's Admins, possibly consulting CNN's official transcript.
2. Credible sources report that Donald Trump testifies, either in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Given these conditions are met, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals, with ties broken by Silver and then Bronze Medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

para_P.title: If there is a reference to a 'deepfake' during the CNN debate on June 27 and Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will the USA lead the Olympic Medal Count at Paris 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: 
1. During the CNN presidential debate aired on June 27, 2024, the term 'deepfake' is mentioned by Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the debate moderators. This will be verified by the Admins of Metaculus, possibly using CNN's official transcript for reference.
2. Reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump gives testimony, either in person or virtually, regarding the trial about the 'hush money' payments to Stormy Daniels.

If these criteria are satisfied, will the United States Olympic Team be the sole top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The ranking is based on the total number of Gold Medals, with ties resolved by counting Silver and then Bronze Medals. If the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027, the question remains unresolved.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Both of the following: (a) Trump, Biden, or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial; AND (2) USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Both of the following conditions are met:
   a. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether this has happened will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript. If the word is not clearly uttered, the condition is not met.
   b. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

If all conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If any condition is not met, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (1) Both of these: (a) During the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, Trump, Biden, or a moderator mentions the term "deepfake," and (b) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial; AND (2) Does the USA lead the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Both of these criteria must be fulfilled:
   a. In the course of the CNN presidential debate scheduled for June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators states the word "deepfake." The determination of whether this occurs will be solely at the discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may refer to CNN's official transcript. If the term is not distinctly articulated, this condition will not be considered satisfied.
   b. Reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. The United States Olympic Team ranks as the (sole) highest team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027, the question will be resolved with uncertainty. It will be resolved negatively if any team matches or surpasses the ranking of the US team.

If all criteria are fulfilled, this question resolves as **Yes**. If any criterion is not fulfilled, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Israel qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Israel does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Israel going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Israel takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Israel fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Israel qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Assuming Israel makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Trump have a lead over Biden ranging from 3 to 4 points on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the scenario where Israel competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

In that case, will Donald Trump’s advantage over Joe Biden in the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential race be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to the data available on that date when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

For clarity, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Given both Israel qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Borussia Dortmund win the UEFA Champions League?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Israel qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, which means Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified; and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, with a positive value indicating a Trump lead. Then, will Borussia Dortmund win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, which resolves **Yes** if they win the Final on June 1, 2024, according to UEFA, and **No** otherwise?

para_P.title: If both Israel makes it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and Trump is ahead of Biden by a margin of 3 to 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Borussia Dortmund claim victory in the UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (a) Israel makes it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning they participate in a Semi-final and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified; and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, where a positive figure signifies a Trump lead. Then, will Borussia Dortmund emerge victorious in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, which resolves to **Yes** if they win the Final on June 1, 2024, according to UEFA, and **No** otherwise?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Israel qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Borussia Dortmund wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:
(a) Israel will qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final if it participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified. If Israel does not qualify, this part will resolve as **No**.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 if, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, the value reported for July 15, 2024, shows Trump leading Biden by more than 3 points but not more than 4 points. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(c) Borussia Dortmund wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League if they win the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following events will take place: (a) Israel secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, (b) Trump's advantage over Biden falls between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (c) Borussia Dortmund triumphs in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body:
(a) Israel will make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final if it competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified. If Israel fails to qualify, this part will be considered **No**.

(b) Trump's margin over Biden will be more than 3 and at most 4 if, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, the figure reported for July 15, 2024, indicates Trump leading Biden by over 3 points but not exceeding 4 points. Metaculus will verify this on July 17, 2024. A positive number reflects a Trump lead, while a negative number signifies a Biden lead.

(c) Borussia Dortmund will be declared the winner of the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League if they claim victory in the Final on June 1, 2024, as per [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other outcomes will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their dissent towards their party's move to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the initial public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump, showing that many of their members are still quite troubled about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the above is true. Then, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Director of the U.S. Secret Service will step down, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to hold the position before October 12, 2024, if over 20 Democrats voice their opposition to Biden's expedited nomination?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A significant number of House Democrats are mobilizing to challenge their party's initiative to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination earlier than initially scheduled, claiming it suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, as reported by a participating lawmaker.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are profoundly concerned about Biden's candidacy.

Huffman stated in an interview, "This is a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and presumably create unity through sheer force, but that approach is ineffective." He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures will also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given both (a) at least 20 Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and (b) the head of the Secret Service resigns, will BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This letter must be signed before the end of Sunday, July 21st, and can be a single letter or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures. (b) The head of the Secret Service, Kimberly Cheatle, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds the position of director before October 12, 2024.

Given these conditions, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance?

para_P.title: If at least 20 Democratic lawmakers publicly express their opposition to Biden's early nomination and the director of the Secret Service steps down, will the BSE SENSEX finish between 75,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenarios hold true: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from either the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the early nomination of Biden, which must be signed by the end of Sunday, July 21st, and may consist of one or more letters totaling at least 20 signatures. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the head of the Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or otherwise ceases to be the director prior to October 12, 2024.

Considering these scenarios, will the BSE SENSEX's closing value on July 21, 2024, fall within the range of over 75,000 and at most 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, (b) The head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days, and (c) The closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k on July 21, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following will happen: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule, (b) The Director of the Secret Service will step down within the upcoming 90 days, and (c) The final value of the BSE SENSEX will exceed 75,000 but not surpass 77,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from either the House or Senate publicly support a letter that opposes the strategy to nominate Biden early?
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a campaign to express their dissent against their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the campaign.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO signals the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain significantly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that approach is ineffective,” Huffman stated in an interview. He opted not to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.
