question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following four occurrences take place, based on official announcements or [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines dismisses at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC dismisses at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If none of these events are reported before that date, then this will be deemed **No**.

question.title: If diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. Resolves as No otherwise.

para_P.title: Should there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024, will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assume the following occurs: Before August 1, 2024, one of these four scenarios happens, as reported by official statements or credible sources: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls one or more of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

In that case, will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024 stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Outcome criteria: The answer is Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. The statement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would not accept the nomination. The answer is No in all other circumstances.

question.title: Given diplomatic tensions and Biden's announcement, will Machado be imprisoned by August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two events both occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China happen before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. This includes the Philippines or China expelling or recalling diplomats from each other's countries. (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive and unambiguous. 

Given these conditions, will the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET? The question will resolve as YES if she is imprisoned by that date and time.

para_P.title: In light of diplomatic strains and Biden's declaration, is it possible that Machado will face imprisonment by August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Consider the following two conditions: (a) There are diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China occurring prior to August 1, 2024, as confirmed by official announcements or reliable sources. This includes either the Philippines or China expelling or recalling diplomats from each other's nations. (b) Joe Biden makes a clear and unequivocal statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. 

Under these circumstances, is it true that the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado will be imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET? The inquiry will be considered YES if she is indeed imprisoned by that specified date and time.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) This part resolves as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This part resolves as **Yes** if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET.

The combined question will resolve as **Yes** only if all parts (a), (b), and (c) resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will happen: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden declaring before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This part will be considered **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events occurs, based on official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this will be considered **No**.

(b) This part will be considered **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This part will be considered **Yes** if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is incarcerated before Friday August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET.

The overall question will resolve as **Yes** only if all parts (a), (b), and (c) resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 30% of respondents on Manifold concur that weak AGI was realized prior to July 23, 2024?
para_P.body:
[image]Each month, a poll is conducted on Manifold to capture the collective opinion on advancements towards AGI. In contrast to many of the inquiries and markets on Manifold, these polls will simply inquire "has weak AGI been realized," without providing a specific definition for the term. The intention is that due to the broad nature of the term, the only way to assess AI progress is to allow participants to vote based on their personal interpretation.

Advancements have been consistent. The previous polls can be found here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The earlier markets regarding this subject, which greatly underestimated Manifold's confidence in AI advancements, included:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not refer to any particular model and will not define "AGI" other than to clarify that the poll does not necessitate that the software system can interact with the physical environment. The polls commence on the 23rd of each month and conclude on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the results from the July 2024 poll yield a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) that is equal to or exceeds 0.3. Responses categorized as "no opinion" will be disregarded. Otherwise, this inquiry will conclude with a NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: If at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will "House of the Dragon" S2E7 be rated >8.5 on IMDB?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is based on a monthly poll conducted by Manifold, where respondents vote based on their own understanding of "weak AGI." The poll results in a YES/(NO + YES) ratio greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that "House of the Dragon" S2E7 will be rated greater than 8.5 on IMDB two days after its release? The rating will be checked on IMDB two days after release (July 30th), at noon PT, and must be strictly greater than 8.5, using the precision listed by IMDB.

para_P.title: Should at least 30% of participants in the Manifold survey concur that weak AGI was realized prior to July 23, 2024, will the rating for "House of the Dragon" S2E7 exceed 8.5 on IMDB?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: At least 30% of participants in the Manifold survey believe that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024. This is based on a monthly survey conducted by Manifold, where participants cast their votes according to their interpretation of "weak AGI." The results of the survey yield a YES/(NO + YES) ratio that is equal to or greater than 0.3, excluding those who express "no opinion."

Then, can we conclude that "House of the Dragon" S2E7 will have a rating higher than 8.5 on IMDB two days following its premiere? The rating will be verified on IMDB two days post-release (July 30th), at noon PT, and it must be strictly above 8.5, according to the precision indicated by IMDB.

question.title: Conditional on both at least 30% of Manifold respondents agreeing that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, and "House of the Dragon" S2E7 being rated >8.5 on IMDB, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) At least 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio being >= 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" votes, in the July 2024 poll. (2) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 is rated strictly greater than 8.5 on IMDB, two days after its release on July 30, 2024, at noon PT.

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap surpasses Apple's on July 17, 2024, and Tyson Fury defeats Oleksandr Usyk, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, and Tyson Fury defeats Oleksandr Usyk to become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion. 

- Criterion for Nvidia and Apple: This part resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

- Criterion for Tyson Fury: This part resolves Yes if Tyson Fury wins the boxing bout against Oleksandr Usyk. It will resolve No if Usyk wins or there is a draw. If there is no fight between the two boxers before May 19th, 2024, the question is annulled.

Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

- Criterion for Russian control: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
  - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
  - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
  - Assessed Russian Control
  - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
  - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
  - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
  - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
  - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
  - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

- Condition for Tyson Fury: This part resolves to Yes if Tyson Fury is victorious in the boxing match against Oleksandr Usyk. It will resolve to No if Usyk wins or if the match ends in a draw. If no fight occurs between the two boxers before May 19th, 2024, the question is rendered void.

Then, will Russia possess control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

- Condition for Russian control: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:
  - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
  - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
  - Assessed Russian Control
  - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
  - Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area.

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not classified under any categories that indicate Russian control, including but not limited to:
  - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
  - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
  - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
  - Any other classifications created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has taken the stand, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Scotland hold an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified at the trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, and this referendum is officially sanctioned with the consent of the London government. It may be advisory but not a "wildcat" or unsanctioned referendum.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will Scotland conduct a formal referendum on its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or through remote means, at the trial related to the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Will Scotland carry out a formal, authorized referendum on its independence from the United Kingdom before the date of May 3, 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: The question is answered with YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified at the trial.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question is answered with YES if a referendum regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom is conducted in Scotland before May 3, 2024, and this referendum is officially authorized with the agreement of the London government. It may be advisory but must not be an unsanctioned or "wildcat" referendum.

question.title: Conditional on both Trump testifying at the hush money trial and Scotland holding an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, will there be a break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. The referendum must have the consent of the London government and not be a "wildcat" or unauthorized vote.

Then, is the following true: 

Will there be a break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41? A break is defined as any amount of time sufficient for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one. Resolves "YES" if there is a break after chapter 40, "NO" if there is no break after chapter 40. This will be determined by official release or known-accurate leakers posting any details about a break ahead of time.

para_P.title: If both Trump testifies in the hush money trial and Scotland conducts an official independence referendum prior to May 3, 2024, will there be an interval between chapters 40 and 41 of Kagurabachi?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: 

1. Reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.
2. An official referendum takes place in Scotland regarding its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum occurs before May 3, 2024. The referendum must be sanctioned by the London government and not be an unauthorized or "wildcat" vote.

Then, is it accurate to say: 

Will there be an interval between chapters 40 and 41 of Kagurabachi? An interval is defined as any duration sufficient for Shonen Jump to announce at the conclusion of chapters whether there will be a pause before the subsequent one. Resolves "YES" if a break occurs after chapter 40, "NO" if no break follows chapter 40. This will be determined by official releases or credible leakers providing advance information about a break.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, and (2) there is a break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:  
(1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.  
(2) A break occurs between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41, defined as any amount of time sufficient for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one. The question will close on the official release, or earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time.

para_P.title: Will both of the subsequent events take place: (1) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial and Scotland conducts an official, sanctioned independence referendum prior to May 3, 2024, and (2) there is a hiatus between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:  
(1) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and a referendum is held in Scotland concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be an "advisory" vote; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legally binding impact. It will not be regarded as resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused to authorize the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society organizations. A referendum must be acknowledged to have the approval of the London government.  
(2) A pause occurs between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41, defined as any duration sufficient for Shonen Jump to announce at the conclusion of chapters if there will be a break before the subsequent one. The question will conclude upon the official release, or sooner if known-accurate informants share any details about a break in advance.

question.title: Will Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Cyprus set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Cyprus takes part in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Cyprus fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Cyprus qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose Cyprus participates in a Eurovision 2024 Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final. Given this, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson, in the 2024 special election?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Cyprus must be officially announced as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final by the EBU.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if credible sources report that a Republican Party representative has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If sources disagree, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If Cyprus makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the upcoming special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming Cyprus competes in a Semi-final for Eurovision 2024 and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Grand Final. In light of this, will the Republican Party maintain its hold on Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was formerly represented by Bill Johnson, during the special election in 2024?

Criteria for resolution:
- For the condition: Cyprus must be confirmed as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final by the EBU.
- For the outcome: The answer is YES if reliable sources indicate that a Republican Party candidate has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If there are conflicting reports, an official statement or source from Ohio will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Given Cyprus qualifies for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and Republicans win Ohio's 6th district, will at least 24 world records be broken at 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Cyprus qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning they participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified. (2) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, with credible sources or Ohio State statements confirming a Republican victory. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this condition is annulled.

Given these conditions, will at least 24 world records be broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if 24 or more world records are broken during the Olympics.

para_P.title: If Cyprus secures a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the Republicans maintain control of Ohio's 6th district, will there be a minimum of 24 world records shattered at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (1) Cyprus secures a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, indicating their participation in a Semi-final and receiving official confirmation of qualification from the European Broadcasting Union (EBU). (2) The Republican Party successfully holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, with reliable sources or statements from Ohio State affirming a Republican win. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this condition becomes void.

Under these circumstances, will there be at least 24 world records set during the 2024 Paris Olympics? This is considered **Yes** if 24 or more world records are established during the Olympics.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Cyprus qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, and (c) at least 24 world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the second condition is annulled. (3) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. If any condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will take place: (a) Cyprus secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, (b) the Republican Party maintains control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024, and (c) at least 24 world records are set at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if every one of the following criteria is fulfilled: (1) Cyprus competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. (2) Reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources conflict, an official Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the second criterion becomes void. (3) The total number of world records established during the Paris Olympics is 24 or more. Should any of these criteria not be satisfied, the answer will be **No**.

question.body:

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

question.title: Given Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the BSE SENSEX close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the correlation between Kalenjin athletes winning both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris and the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): This resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves as **Yes** if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. It resolves as **No** otherwise. If the condition is not met, the outcome resolves as N/A.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Luxembourg qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the French Prime Minister is not from New Popular Front or Together, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur: (1) Luxembourg is announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final after participating in a Semi-final. (2) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France belongs to a party other than New Popular Front or Together, according to credible sources.

Given these conditions, the question resolves as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It resolves as **No** if any other party or group holds the most seats, or if Renew is tied for the most seats and official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports do not confirm Renew as holding the most seats.

para_P.title: If Luxembourg secures a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the French Prime Minister is affiliated with a party other than New Popular Front or Together, will Renew emerge with the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:

(2) At 12:00 Central European Time on July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France is from a political party that is neither New Popular Front nor Together, based on reliable sources.

Under these circumstances, the answer is **Yes** if Renew has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. The answer is **No** if another party or coalition has more seats, or if Renew is tied for the most seats and there are no official confirmations from the European Parliament or trustworthy media reports asserting that Renew holds the most seats.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

para_P.title: Was there an intentional shooting directed at Trump on July 13th?
para_P.body:
According to the NYT: "There were sounds resembling gunfire that interrupted Trump's rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was quickly taken off the stage and seemed to have a wound near his ear."

This resolves to YES if an individual deliberately aimed and fired a bullet or similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. It resolves to NO if an unintentional discharge or ricochet resulted in something being directed towards Trump.

*The term bullet-like projectile refers to any object that functions similarly to a bullet, even if it is not classified as one. For instance, a BB gun pellet would not be considered since it is not likely to be lethal like a traditional bullet.

question.title: Conditional on someone intentionally shooting at Trump on July 13th, will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Criterion for condition: Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming that an individual deliberately fired a weapon at Trump on July 13th, is it possible that a minimum of 50 members of the Kenyan military or police will be present in Haiti prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
NYT: "There were sounds that resembled gunfire which disrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. He was quickly escorted off the stage and seemed to have a wound by his ear."

Criterion for condition: Resolves YES if an individual intentionally discharged a bullet or similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if an accidental discharge or ricochet led to something being shot towards Trump.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, reliable sources indicate that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: If someone intentionally shot at Trump on July 13th and at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th, and (b) After May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? 

This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Should an individual have deliberately fired at Trump on July 13th and if a minimum of 50 Kenyan military or police personnel reach Haiti prior to June 1, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index show a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) An individual deliberately shot a bullet or similar projectile at Trump on July 13th, and (b) Between May 22, 2024, and June 1, 2024, reliable sources indicate that no fewer than 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) exhibit a higher Year-over-Year figure on July 20, 2024? 

This inquiry will be resolved based on information provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.body: (1) Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. (2) Resolves YES if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti. para_P.body: (1) Resolves YES if an individual intentionally discharged a bullet or similar projectile towards Trump on July 13th. question.title: Given both a change in French PM coalition and Nigel Farage's election, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body:

2. Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election held on July 4, 2024, unless the election is cancelled or postponed.

Given these conditions, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024? The polling data should be accessed on July 17, 2024, and a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Considering the alteration in the French Prime Minister's coalition and Nigel Farage's election, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden ranging from 2 to 4 points on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions are met: 

1. On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France is part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together, as confirmed by reliable sources.

2. Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024, unless the election is cancelled or delayed.

Under these circumstances, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be more than 2 points and no more than 4 points according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024? The polling information should be retrieved on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, (2) Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election, and (3) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met:

1. The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the Member of Parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as No if either condition is not met. Note that the second condition will be annulled if the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024.

3. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution should cite credible media reports as specified for each condition: credible sources for the first condition, credible UK media or official announcements for the second condition, and the 538 national polling average for the third condition.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together, Nigel Farage be chosen as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024, and will Trump's advantage over Biden fall between 2 and 4 according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if all of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. The French Prime Minister's party is not New Popular Front or Together as of July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

2. Nigel Farage is selected as a Member of Parliament (MP) representing any UK constituency in the general election scheduled for July 4, 2024. The outcome will be negative if either condition is not fulfilled. Note that the second criterion will be void if the general election is cancelled or delayed beyond July 4, 2024.

3. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) must be greater than 2 and at most 4, as reported in the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution should reference trustworthy media reports as specified for each criterion: reliable sources for the first criterion, credible UK media or official announcements for the second criterion, and the 538 national polling average for the third criterion.

question.title: Will Sifan Hassan win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Resolves YES if Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, NO otherwise

para_P.title: Is it possible for Sifan Hassan to secure a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: Determines YES if Sifan Hassan achieves any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, NO if not.

question.title: Conditional on Sifan Hassan winning a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Then, will a terrorist attack occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

If Sifan Hassan does not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Sifan Hassan secures a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: Sifan Hassan earns any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

In that case, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

This question will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be answered with No if the aforementioned does not occur.

An incident will be classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

If Sifan Hassan does not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, the question will be considered N/A.

question.title: Given that both Sifan Hassan wins a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics and a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France, injuring and/or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s), between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given these conditions, will there be credible reports confirming one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties before June 6, 2024? If both conditions are met, then the question resolves YES if there is such a death before June 6, 2024, and NO otherwise. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If both Sifan Hassan secures a medal in the 2024 Paris Olympics and a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will there be a reported fatality due to armed conflict between China and Taiwan prior to June 6, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Both (a) Sifan Hassan achieves any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) A terrorist incident occurs in Metropolitan France, resulting in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual aside from the terrorist(s), between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The incident must be officially labeled as a 'terrorist attack' by any French state agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Under these stipulations, will there be reliable reports indicating one or more fatalities among the military personnel of China or Taiwan due to conflict between the two nations before June 6, 2024? If both conditions are satisfied, the answer is YES if such a fatality occurs before June 6, 2024, and NO otherwise. If either condition is unfulfilled, the answer will be N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Sifan Hassan wins a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics and a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) before June 6, 2024, there is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan?
question.body: This question resolves YES if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Both (a) Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) A terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers; and (2) Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it the case that all of the following will take place: (1) Sifan Hassan secures a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics and a terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) prior to June 6, 2024, there is a fatality due to armed conflict between China and Taiwan?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the following conditions are satisfied: (1) Both (a) Sifan Hassan earns any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) A terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), occurring between, and including, the Opening Ceremony date (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony date (11 August 2024). The incident must be officially classified as a 'terrorist attack' by any French state agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers; and (2) Before June 6th, 2024, trustworthy reports indicate one or more fatalities among the military forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict between them. It will be answered with NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Count at the 2024 Paris Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if the U.S. Olympic Team stands as the sole highest-ranked team at the Paris Olympics in 2024. It will be deemed uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not occur before the year 2027. It will result in a negative outcome if any other team matches or surpasses the ranking of the U.S. team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for Gold) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for Silver) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Conditional on USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics based on the medal table, which is calculated by the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals won. Then, is it true that "Twisters" (2024) will have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release (July 26th)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The US team must be the highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If the Olympics do not take place before 2027, the condition resolves ambiguously.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: "Twisters" (2024) must have a Tomatometer score of 75% or higher on Rotten Tomatoes one week after its release. The score is based on the integer percentage displayed by Rotten Tomatoes.

para_P.title: If the USA is the leading nation in the Olympic Medal Count at Paris 2024, will "Twisters" (2024) achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of no less than 75%?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The United States Olympic Team stands as the singular top-ranked team in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics, which is determined by the total gold, silver, and bronze medals earned. Then, can we confirm that "Twisters" (2024) will secure a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week post its premiere (July 26th)?

Criteria for the condition to be met: The US team must be the foremost team in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Should the Olympics not occur before 2027, the condition will remain uncertain.

Criteria for the outcome to be satisfied: "Twisters" (2024) needs to attain a Tomatometer rating of 75% or above on Rotten Tomatoes one week after its debut. This rating is based on the integer percentage shown by Rotten Tomatoes.

question.title: Given the USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 and "Twisters" (2024) scores at least 75% on Rotten Tomatoes, will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics based on the medal table, and (b) "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release. Given these conditions, will the Los Angeles Clippers be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA? The question resolves as Yes if the Clippers win, and No if any other team wins the 2024 NBA Finals.

para_P.title: If the United States leads the Olympic Medal Rankings at the Paris 2024 Games and "Twisters" (2024) achieves a minimum of 75% on Rotten Tomatoes, will the Los Angeles Clippers secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (a) The USA Olympic Team is the sole top-ranked team in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) "Twisters" (2024) receives a critic score of at least 75% on Rotten Tomatoes one week post-release. Under these circumstances, will the Los Angeles Clippers be declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA? The outcome is Yes if the Clippers are victorious, and No if another team clinches the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, (b) "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, and (c) the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
(a) Will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

(b) Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%?
This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th).

Details:

- I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).
- For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.
- "Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).
- "Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(c) Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
The question resolves as Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will happen: (a) the USA will lead the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, (b) "Twisters" (2024) will achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of no less than 75%, and (c) the Los Angeles Clippers will be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
(a) Will the USA lead the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
This question will be answered with a Yes if the United States Olympic Team ranks as the (sole) highest team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be answered ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will be answered with a No if any other team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is determined by counting all the medals won by each participating nation and ranking them by:

1. Total Number of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Total Number of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Total Number of Bronze Medals

(b) Will "Twisters" (2024) receive a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%?
This will be a Yes if the Tomatometer score is 75% or more, one week after its release (July 26th).

Details:

- I will use the precision provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually an integer percentage, without decimals).
- For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the score I will reference.
- "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for clarity (to my knowledge, it requires a score of >=75% on the Tomatometer, but there may be other criteria—the market resolves strictly based on the displayed score).
- "Twisters" (2024) is an independent sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(c) Will the Los Angeles Clippers secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
The question will be answered with a Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with a No for any other teams that are eliminated from the competition.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which corresponds to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Sifan Hassan win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question combines two distinct events:

This is determined by accessing 538's national polling average chart for the 2024 presidential election on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

2. Then, is it true that Sifan Hassan will win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves YES if Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and NO otherwise.

If the first condition is not met, the question is not applicable.

para_P.title: Assuming that Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will Sifan Hassan achieve a podium finish at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry involves two separate occurrences: 

1. Let us assume the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points. This is verified by consulting 538's national polling average chart for the 2024 presidential election on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead.

2. Following that, is it accurate to state that Sifan Hassan will secure a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The answer is YES if Sifan Hassan earns any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and NO otherwise.

If the initial condition is not satisfied, the question does not apply.

question.title: Conditional on both Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, and Sifan Hassan winning a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This conditional question examines the outcome of the Miami Heat in the 2024 NBA Finals based on the following conditions:

Condition (a): Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the date of July 15, 2024, as reported by the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Condition (b): Sifan Hassan must win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for the conditional question to be considered. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Resolves NO if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.
If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Given that Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but no more than 3 on July 15, 2024, and that Sifan Hassan secures a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This question investigates the Miami Heat's performance in the 2024 NBA Finals under the following stipulations:

Stipulation (b): Sifan Hassan must earn any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Both stipulations (a) and (b) must be fulfilled for the question to be valid. 

Outcome determination: Resolves to YES if the Miami Heat wins the 2024 NBA Finals, as per NBA records. Resolves to NO if another team wins the championship or if the Miami Heat is disqualified from the competition.
If either stipulation (a) or (b) is unmet, the question is marked as N/A.
