question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

para_P.title: Will the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 individuals in the US take place within four weeks following the combined peak of COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 individuals for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the peak rate for all three viruses combined, as reported by the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week period will be determined based on the end dates of the weeks. The CDC defines "epidemiological weeks" starting on Sunday and concluding on Saturday. The rates considered will encompass all ages, races, and genders. Please refer to the detailed guidelines for the appropriate filters. For this question, the 2023-2024 season is defined as commencing with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending June 1, 2024.

To account for data updates and reporting lags, the resolution of this question will depend on data available after the reporting delay period, specifically when the relevant statistics for the current season are not indicated as a dashed line, usually four weeks post the week ending date.

question.title: Given the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the potential link between the timing of peak hospitalizations in the US for the 2023-24 season and Biden's decision to drop out of the race before July 20. 

Condition: The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV must occur within four weeks (28 days) of the combined peak for all three, according to the CDC's RESP-NET data. The relevant period is from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024.

Outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, otherwise resolves NO.

para_P.title: If the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 in the United States takes place within four weeks of the joint peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible relationship between the timing of peak hospitalization rates in the US for the 2023-24 season and Biden's choice to withdraw from the race before July 20. 

Condition: The highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV must occur within four weeks (28 days) of the combined peak for all three, based on the CDC's RESP-NET data. The relevant timeframe spans from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024.

Outcome: Resolves YES if Biden withdraws or is unable to continue his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time, otherwise resolves NO.

question.title: Given both the US hospitalization peak timing and Biden dropping out, will "Trap" (2024) be Fresh on Rotten Tomatoes?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US for the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV, according to the CDC's RESP-NET data.
(b) Biden drops out of the presidential race before July 20, 2024.

Given these conditions, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, thereby being rated as "Fresh"? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher one week after release (August 9th). The score used will be the integer percentage listed on Rotten Tomatoes.

para_P.title: Considering the timing of the peak hospitalizations in the US and Biden's withdrawal, will "Trap" (2024) achieve a Fresh rating on Rotten Tomatoes?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: 
(a) The peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 people in the US for the 2023-24 season is reached within four weeks of the overall peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV, as per the CDC's RESP-NET data.
(b) Biden exits the presidential race prior to July 20, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) secure a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of no less than 60%, thus being classified as "Fresh"? 

The outcome will be considered YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or above one week after its release (August 9th). The score referenced will be the whole number percentage displayed on Rotten Tomatoes.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will both of the following occur: (a) Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season? (b) Will Biden drop out before July 20? (2) Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

(b) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

(2) "Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

"Knock at the Cabin": 67%

"Old": 50%

"Glass": 37%

The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions).

Currently, the close date is set for resolution. If there's sufficient interest & a clear review embargo date is set, I might upgrade this to "Plus" and set the close date to be the review embargo—so perhaps don't bet if you're concerned that the close date might shift up.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (1) (a) Will the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 people in the US be recorded within four weeks of the peak combined rates for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season? (b) Will Biden withdraw from the race before July 20? (2) Will M. Night Shyamalan's film "Trap" (2024) achieve a critics score of at least 60% on Rotten Tomatoes?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the combined maximum rate for all three, as reported by the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week period will be calculated based on the end dates of the weeks. The CDC tracks "epidemiological weeks," which start on Sunday and conclude on Saturday. The data will encompass all demographics, including age, race, and gender. Refer to the fine print for appropriate filters. For this question, the 2023-2024 season is defined as commencing with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending June 1, 2024. To account for data adjustments and reporting delays, the resolution will rely on figures available post the reporting delay, specifically when the relevant data for the ongoing season is not indicated as a dashed line, typically four weeks post the week end date.

(b) If Biden exits or is otherwise unable to proceed with the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will indicate yes. Otherwise, it will indicate no.

(2) For "Trap" (2024), the Rotten Tomatoes page

This will resolve to YES if the Tomatometer score reaches 60% or more, one week following its release (August 9th). 

Details 

The resolution will utilize whatever precision is provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually an integer percentage, without decimals).

For reference, here are the Rotten Tomatoes scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

"Knock at the Cabin": 67%

"Old": 50%

"Glass": 37%

The "Fresh" label in the title is merely for illustrative purposes; it will not determine the market resolution (to my knowledge, films scoring >=60% are "Fresh", though there may be additional criteria).

Currently, the resolution date is established. If there is enough interest and a clear review embargo date is determined, I may enhance this to "Plus" and adjust the close date to coincide with the review embargo—so it may be wise to refrain from betting if you are worried about the close date potentially changing.

question.title: Given the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, will Croatia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
The condition is that the linked market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) must have at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. If this condition is met, then the question is whether Croatia will qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the market has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If the specified market reaches a minimum of 377 participants by July 15, will Croatia advance to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body:

Should this requirement be fulfilled, the inquiry is whether Croatia will advance to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Criteria for resolving the outcome: Resolves YES if Croatia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given both 377 traders in the linked market by July 15, 2024, and Croatia qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, and (b) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: (a) Resolves YES if the market has 377 traders before market close. (b) Resolves YES if Croatia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Resolves NO otherwise. If two groups are tied for seats, the resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Iran will execute a lethal assault inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports emerge that an attack linked to Iran occurring within the territory of Israel has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Given Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: After the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Then, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024? This resolves as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

para_P.title: If Iran executes a lethal strike inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024, will there be fatalities from military conflict involving China and Taiwan in 2024?
para_P.body: Assume the following scenario is accurate: Following the release of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable information suggests that an attack linked to Iran has occurred within the territory of Israel, resulting in the deaths of at least five people. In that case, will there be fatalities from military conflict involving China and Taiwan in 2024? This is considered a Yes if, before June 6, 2024, reliable reports verify one or more deaths among the military forces of China or Taiwan due to conflict between the two nations.

question.title: Given both an Iranian attack in Israel and a China-Taiwan armed conflict death, will the Oklahoma City Thunder win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

Then, will the Oklahoma City Thunder be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/)? The question resolves as **Yes** if the Oklahoma City Thunder wins the 2024 NBA Finals, and **No** otherwise.

para_P.title: In light of an Iranian offensive in Israel and fatalities from a China-Taiwan military clash, are the Oklahoma City Thunder set to claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold true: 

(a) After this question is published and prior to May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an Iranian-led attack within the territory of Israel has resulted in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

(b) Before June 6, 2024, trustworthy reports verify one or more fatalities among the military forces of either China or Taiwan due to the conflict between them.

Then, will the Oklahoma City Thunder emerge as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/)? The outcome is considered **Yes** if the Oklahoma City Thunder secures the title in the 2024 NBA Finals, and **No** if they do not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, (b) an armed forces conflict death occurs between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) the Oklahoma City Thunder wins the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(c) The Oklahoma City Thunder is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other outcomes as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following events to take place: (a) Iran executes a lethal assault within the borders of Israel prior to May 1, 2024, (b) a fatal military engagement occurs between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) the Oklahoma City Thunder secures victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if all of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

(a) After this question is published and before May 1, 2024, credible information emerges indicating that an assault linked to Iran has taken place within Israel, resulting in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

(b) Prior to June 6, 2024, reliable reports verify that there have been one or more fatalities among the military forces of China or Taiwan due to conflict between the two nations.

(c) The Oklahoma City Thunder is declared the victor of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). The answer will be **No** for any other outcomes, as they will be excluded from consideration.
